original: gang gi tshe 'bras s'a lu 'bras yes kyi gnas skabs su gyur pa de'i tshe na yos zhes bya'o //🔽skyer mi rung ba'i chos can zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'bras s'a lu 'bras yes kyi gnas skabs su gyur pa de'i tshe na yos zhes bya'o // skyer mi rung ba'i chos can zhes bya ba ni /
translated: When it is in the state of ripe rice, it is called rice.🔽The state of being unarisen is the state of not being able to arise.

original: myu gu bskyed pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: myu gu bskyed pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is called the state of being unarisen because it does not have the power to produce a sprout.

original: mi spro na gsol ba bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi spro na gsol ba bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If he is not willing, they should request him.🔽If a monk is not willing to inform the houses, then all the monks should request him, saying, “These two monks, the monk and the nun, are wicked.

original: gal te dge slong khyim du so sor go bar byed pa'i khyim rnams su so sor go bar byed par mi spro na de'i tshe dge slong thams cad kyis dge slong dang dge slong ma 'di gnyis sdig can yin no zhes khyim du so sor go bar bya🔽ba'i gsol ba bya'o //
analyzed: gal te dge slong khyim du so sor go bar byed pa'i khyim rnams su so sor go bar byed par mi spro na de'i tshe dge slong thams cad kyis dge slong dang dge slong ma 'di gnyis sdig can yin no zhes khyim du so sor go bar bya ba'i gsol ba bya'o //
translated: They should inform the houses that they are not to have any contact with them.”

original: shes gtso bo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes gtso bo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The chief of the knowers.

original: 'dir yang shes gtso bo zhes bya ba'i ming dang 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba'i ming can du sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: 'dir yang shes gtso bo zhes bya ba'i ming dang 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba'i ming can du sbyor bar byed do //
translated: Here, the chief of the knowers is the one who is the chief in terms of name and in terms of perception.

original: yul gang la zhe na /
analyzed: yul gang la zhe na /
translated: What is the object?

original: de'i phyir nyan pa po mi shes pa nyid dang bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa nyid dag dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyan pa po mi shes pa nyid dang bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa nyid dag dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the listener is endowed with ignorance and not fully ordained.

original: nyan pa po mi shes pa nyid dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa nyid dag dang ldan pa'i yul de la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: nyan pa po mi shes pa nyid dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa nyid dag dang ldan pa'i yul de la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: The object of the listener endowed with ignorance and not fully ordained is the primary object of the expression.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: ltung ba 'byin par byed pa'i dge slong gang gis nyan pa po pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma zhes bya ba'i ltung ba mi shes pa nyid dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa nyid yin par shes na nyan pa po'i yul de gnyis la ltung ba 'byin par byed pa'i dge slong gi 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: ltung ba 'byin par byed pa'i dge slong gang gis nyan pa po pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma zhes bya ba'i ltung ba mi shes pa nyid dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa nyid yin par shes na nyan pa po'i yul de gnyis la ltung ba 'byin par byed pa'i dge slong gi 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: If the fully ordained monk who commits the offense does not know the offense that causes defeat or the offense called a partial defeat, and if he knows that the listener is not fully ordained, then the object of the listener is the primary object of the expression of the fully ordained monk who commits the offense.

original: ci zhig rjes su sgrub na gnas ngan len brjod pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig rjes su sgrub na gnas ngan len brjod pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is accomplished that becomes the offense of describing a fault?

original: de'i phyir smras na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “if one speaks.”

original: tshig tu smra na'o //
analyzed: tshig tu smra na'o //
translated: If one speaks words.

original: brjod par bya ba ci zhig smras na zhe na /🔽de'i phyir pham par 'gyur ba dang dge 'dun lhag ma dag so sor yang rung /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ci zhig smras na zhe na / de'i phyir pham par 'gyur ba dang dge 'dun lhag ma dag so sor yang rung /
translated: What is the subject matter of the words?🔽Therefore it is said:

original: bsdus pa yang rung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bsdus pa yang rung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: “whether the offenses entailing expulsion and the residual faults are individual or collective.”🔽Individual means separate.

original: gnas ngan len brjod par bya ba pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma dag so so zhes bya ba tha dad pa dag kyang rung bsdus pa zhes bya ba bsdus pa'i rang bzhin yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: gnas ngan len brjod par bya ba pham par 'gyur ba dang / dge 'dun lhag ma dag so so zhes bya ba tha dad pa dag kyang rung bsdus pa zhes bya ba bsdus pa'i rang bzhin yang rung ba'o //
translated: Collective means of the nature of a collection.

original: 'o na gang gi tshe de gnyis bsdus pa dag smras pa de'i tshe ci ltung ba gcig tu 'gyur ram /
analyzed: 'o na gang gi tshe de gnyis bsdus pa dag smras pa de'i tshe ci ltung ba gcig tu 'gyur ram /
translated: If one speaks of the offenses entailing expulsion and the residual faults as collective, then how can there be a single offense?

original: 'on te du mar 'gyur zhe na /🔽de'i phyir don du ma nyid la tshig tha dad pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'on te du mar 'gyur zhe na / de'i phyir don du ma nyid la tshig tha dad pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Or how can there be many offenses?🔽Therefore it is said:🔽“There is no separate word for many meanings.”

original: don du ma nyad la tshig tha dad @267a * //
analyzed: don du ma nyad la tshig tha dad @267a * //
translated: There is no separate word for many meanings.

original: pa med pas de'i phyir tshig gcig la don du ma yod kyang don du ma brjod par 'dod pa la tshig tha dad par mi 'gyur bas ltung ba gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa med pas de'i phyir tshig gcig la don du ma yod kyang don du ma brjod par 'dod pa la tshig tha dad par mi 'gyur bas ltung ba gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, even though there are many meanings in a single word, if one wishes to express many meanings, it is not a separate word, so it is a single downfall.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: tshig gcig yin pa'i phyir ltung ba bsdus pa de gnyis la ji ltar ltung byed gcig tu 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: tshig gcig yin pa'i phyir ltung ba bsdus pa de gnyis la ji ltar ltung byed gcig tu 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Since it is a single word, how can those two downfalls be combined into a single downfall?

original: 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: It is like this.

original: dge slong gang la la zhig gis brdzun gyi tshig 'di skad ces 'dis dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa'i srog chags lnga bsad do zhes smra na tshig gcig yin pa'i phyir brdzun du smra ba'i ltung byed gcig tu 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dge slong gang la la zhig gis brdzun gyi tshig 'di skad ces 'dis dud 'gro'i skye gnas su gtogs pa'i srog chags lnga bsad do zhes smra na tshig gcig yin pa'i phyir brdzun du smra ba'i ltung byed gcig tu 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, if a certain monk were to say these false words, “By this, five animals belonging to the animal realm were killed,” because it is a single word, it would be a single downfall of lying.

original: 'di gnyis las gzhan pa'i kha na ma tho ba brjod pa ni 'di'i rjes su 'brang ba nyes byas yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyis las gzhan pa'i kha na ma tho ba brjod pa ni 'di'i rjes su 'brang ba nyes byas yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the secondary offense of a misdeed is the expression of a downfall other than these two.

original: rjod par byed pa ji lta bu la ltung ba 'di 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: rjod par byed pa ji lta bu la ltung ba 'di 'byung zhe na /
translated: What kind of expression gives rise to this downfall?

original: de'i phyir bsko ba byas pa la'o zhes bya ba smras te /🔽brjod pa'i phyir gang la dge 'dun gyis bsko ba ma byas pa de ni bsko ba ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsko ba byas pa la'o zhes bya ba smras te / brjod pa'i phyir gang la dge 'dun gyis bsko ba ma byas pa de ni bsko ba ma byas pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the term “without being appointed” is stated.🔽If the Saṅgha does not appoint someone, then he is not appointed.

original: rjod par byed pa bsko ba ma byas pa de la'o //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa bsko ba ma byas pa de la'o //
translated: The term “without being appointed” refers to one who is not appointed to do the announcing.

original: ci gnas skabs thams cad la'am zhe na /
analyzed: ci gnas skabs thams cad la'am zhe na /
translated: Is this in all circumstances?

original: de'i phyir dge 'dun la ma gsol pa la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dge 'dun la ma gsol pa la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, the term “without asking the Saṅgha” is stated.

original: gal te dge 'dun la ma gsol ba la ste /
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun la ma gsol ba la ste /
translated: If one does not ask the Saṅgha,

original: gsol ba zhes bya ba go bar bya ba byas pa la'o //
analyzed: gsol ba zhes bya ba go bar bya ba byas pa la'o //
translated: “asking” means having done the announcement.

original: dge 'dun la brjod par bya ba'i phyir gsol ba la ni brjod kyang ltung ba med do //
analyzed: dge 'dun la brjod par bya ba'i phyir gsol ba la ni brjod kyang ltung ba med do //
translated: If one asks the Saṅgha, then there is no offense in announcing.

original: bden par smra ba la kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bden par smra ba la kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur gyi /
translated: This offense is incurred by telling the truth.

original: brdzun du smras na ni ltung ba gzhan smras pa yang yin no //
analyzed: brdzun du smras na ni ltung ba gzhan smras pa yang yin no //
translated: If one lies, then one commits another offense.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i gnas ngan len brjod par byas na kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i gnas ngan len brjod par byas na kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur gyi /
translated: This offense is incurred by announcing the faults of one who has taken full ordination.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i ni na smad pa nyid do //
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i ni na smad pa nyid do //
translated: If one who is not fully ordained, it is a downfall of the lowest degree.

original: gnas ngan len brjod pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: gnas ngan len brjod pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The downfall of “speaking of negative tendencies” has been explained.

original: // / mi'i chos bla ma brjod pa'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas de'i phyir bden pa nyid na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: // / mi'i chos bla ma brjod pa'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas de'i phyir bden pa nyid na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The downfall of “speaking of what is beyond human capacity” is incurred when, wishing to speak of what is beyond human capacity, one says, “It is true that…”

original: smra ba'i pham par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa bstan pa gang yin pa de nyid 'dir yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: smra ba'i pham par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa bstan pa gang yin pa de nyid 'dir yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The defeat that would apply here is the same as the one explained above.

original: de ltar na 'dir tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /
translated: The meaning of the words in this downfall is as follows.

original: bdag nyid kyi yul la mi'i chos bla ma dang ldan par smras na gal te bden pa nyid yin na de'i tshe kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi yul la mi'i chos bla ma dang ldan par smras na gal te bden pa nyid yin na de'i tshe kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: If one claims to possess what is beyond human capacity in one’s own domain and this is true, then this downfall is incurred.

original: de'i tshe 'du shes ma bsgyur bar bdag nyid mi'i chos bla ma yod pa dang ldan par smras na mi'i chos bla ma brjod pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'du shes ma bsgyur bar bdag nyid mi'i chos bla ma yod pa dang ldan par smras na mi'i chos bla ma brjod pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If one does not change one’s perception and claims to possess what is beyond human capacity, then one incurs the downfall of “speaking of what is beyond human capacity.”

original: gang zag ci 'dra ba la brjod na zhe na /
analyzed: gang zag ci 'dra ba la brjod na zhe na /
translated: What kind of person is this rule spoken for?

original: de'i phyir bden pa ma mthong ba bsnyen par ma @267b rdzogs pa la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bden pa ma mthong ba bsnyen par ma @267b rdzogs pa la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it says, “To one who has not seen the truth, who is not fully ordained.”

original: gang gis bden pa ma mthong ba de ni bden pa ma mthong ba ste /
analyzed: gang gis bden pa ma mthong ba de ni bden pa ma mthong ba ste /
translated: One who has not seen the truth is one who has not seen the truth.

original: bden pa ma mthong ba'i gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa de la brjod na'o //
analyzed: bden pa ma mthong ba'i gang zag bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa de la brjod na'o //
translated: This rule is spoken for the person who has not seen the truth, who is not fully ordained.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las bden pa mthong ba lta ba phun sum tshogs pa la brjod na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽khyim pa'i mdun du rdzu 'phrul rnam par bstan par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las bden pa mthong ba lta ba phun sum tshogs pa la brjod na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no // khyim pa'i mdun du rdzu 'phrul rnam par bstan par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, some texts say, “If one speaks to one who has seen the truth, who is perfect in view, there is no offense.”🔽One should not display miracles in front of householders.

original: khyim pa'i mdun du rdzu 'phrul rnam par bstan par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyim pa'i mdun du rdzu 'phrul rnam par bstan par mi bya ba'o //
translated: One should not display miracles in front of householders.

original: 'dul ba'i don nyid du na ni ltung ba med de /
analyzed: 'dul ba'i don nyid du na ni ltung ba med de /
translated: If it is for the purpose of taming, there is no offense.

original: steng rgyas 'od srungs la rdzu 'phrul rnam par bstan par bka' stsal ba'i byung ba'i mtha' dag las khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: steng rgyas 'od srungs la rdzu 'phrul rnam par bstan par bka' stsal ba'i byung ba'i mtha' dag las khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The entire story of how he commanded Kāśyapa to display his magical powers should be understood from the Vinaya.

original: dge slong mas ston pa'i spyan sngar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong mas ston pa'i spyan sngar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “A nun should not display her magical powers in the presence of the Teacher” means

original: dge slong mas ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar rdzu 'phrul rnam par bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong mas ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar rdzu 'phrul rnam par bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: that a nun should not display her magical powers in the presence of the Teacher, the Blessed Buddha.

original: rnam pa 'di gnyis ni phran tshegs dag las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di gnyis ni phran tshegs dag las 'byung ngo //
translated: These two types of magical powers are mentioned in the Kṣudraka Collection.

original: mi'i chos bla ma brjod pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: mi'i chos bla ma brjod pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The offense of boasting about a high spiritual power has been explained.🔽The offense of speaking disparagingly

original: // / skur pa 'debs pa'i ltung byid smra bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: // / skur pa 'debs pa'i ltung byid smra bar 'dod nas /
translated: If you wish to speak disparagingly,

original: je dang po kho nar 'dul ba thams cad la nye bar sbyar ba'i dgos pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: je dang po kho nar 'dul ba thams cad la nye bar sbyar ba'i dgos pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: first you should state the purpose of applying the Vinaya in all cases.

original: gal te brtan pa nyid du dgos na gsol ba sngar btang ba'i don bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te brtan pa nyid du dgos na gsol ba sngar btang ba'i don bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is necessary for stability, the purpose of the prior request should be accomplished.

original: gal te 'dul bar gtogs pa'i bya ba brtan pa nyid du dgos pa yod na de'i tshe gsol ba sngon du btang ba'i don gyi las bya'o //
analyzed: gal te 'dul bar gtogs pa'i bya ba brtan pa nyid du dgos pa yod na de'i tshe gsol ba sngon du btang ba'i don gyi las bya'o //
translated: If there is a need for a stable action belonging to the Vinaya, then at that time one should perform the action with a motion made beforehand.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught:

original: gal te gnas ma la stobs pa la sogs pa bsko bar brtan cing mi 'gyur ba nyid du 'dod na gsol ba sngon du gtang bar bya zhing gsol ba byas nas bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te gnas ma la stobs pa la sogs pa bsko bar brtan cing mi 'gyur ba nyid du 'dod na gsol ba sngon du gtang bar bya zhing gsol ba byas nas bsko bar bya'o //
translated: If one desires a stable and unchanging appointment of a monk to give a place to stay, etc., then one should make a motion beforehand and appoint him after the motion.

original: 'dis ni mi g-yo bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa de bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni mi g-yo bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa de bsdus pa yin no //
translated: This includes the statement, “By this he becomes stable.”

original: gang la skur pa 'debs pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang la skur pa 'debs pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If you ask, “With regard to whom does a downfall due to slander occur?”

original: de'i phyir dad pa phul ba la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dad pa phul ba la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it says, “In regard to one who has offered assent.”

original: gang gis blo mthun par byas pa de ni dad pa phul ba ste /
analyzed: gang gis blo mthun par byas pa de ni dad pa phul ba ste /
translated: One who has made an agreement is one who has offered assent.

original: de la'o // 'dir gzhung ni sngar mthun te rung bar byas nas zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de la'o // 'dir gzhung ni sngar mthun te rung bar byas nas zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: In this case, the text previously stated, “Having made an agreement,”

original: de'i rnam par 'byed pa ni dad pa phul nas zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam par 'byed pa ni dad pa phul nas zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and its analysis states, “Having offered assent.”

original: ci zhig byas na skur pa 'debs pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /🔽de'i phyir dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi zas kyi rnyed pa ma yin pa dge slong gis gang zag la log par bsngos pa yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don nyid gzhan la yang @268a * //
analyzed: ci zhig byas na skur pa 'debs pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na / de'i phyir dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi zas kyi rnyed pa ma yin pa dge slong gis gang zag la log par bsngos pa yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don nyid gzhan la yang @268a * //
translated: What is the offense of deprecation?

original: ming ma smos par brjod na yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /🔽dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ming ma smos par brjod na yang ngo zhes bya ba smras te / dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, it is said: “If a monk, without mentioning the name of another, says that the food of the community of monks has been dedicated to an individual by a monk, and it is not true, then too it is an offense of wrong-doing.”🔽The community of monks.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis mnga' ba'i rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis mnga' ba'i rnyed pa'o //
translated: The food of the community of monks is the property of the community of monks.

original: zas kyi rnyed pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zas kyi rnyed pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Not food.

original: zas kyi rnyed pa las gzhan pa gos kyi rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: zas kyi rnyed pa las gzhan pa gos kyi rnyed pa'o //
translated: It is other than food, such as the property of robes.🔽A monk.

original: dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni /🔽gang la skur pa gdab par bya ba'i dge slong gis so //
analyzed: dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni / gang la skur pa gdab par bya ba'i dge slong gis so //
translated: The monk who deprecates.

original: gang zag la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang zag la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: An individual.

original: spyir bstan pa'i tshig yin pas mi'i 'gro par gtogs pa rab tu byung ba'am khyim na gnas pa la'o //
analyzed: spyir bstan pa'i tshig yin pas mi'i 'gro par gtogs pa rab tu byung ba'am khyim na gnas pa la'o //
translated: This is a word of general indication. It is a monk or a layperson who belongs to the human race.

original: log par bsngos pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: log par bsngos pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Misappropriated” means

original: mi rigs par bsngos pa'o //
analyzed: mi rigs par bsngos pa'o //
translated: misused.

original: yang dag par ma yin pa'i don nyid ces bya ba ni /🔽de yang dag pa ma yin pa yang yin la /
analyzed: yang dag par ma yin pa'i don nyid ces bya ba ni / de yang dag pa ma yin pa yang yin la /
translated: “False object” means

original: don kyang yin pas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don to //
analyzed: don kyang yin pas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i don to //
translated: it is not real and it is an object, thus it is a false object.

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid de brdzun gyi don nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid de brdzun gyi don nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Its nature is just that, i.e., it is false, i.e., it is a false object.

original: gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Also in regard to others” means

original: skur pa gdab par bya ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: skur pa gdab par bya ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: not only in regard to the one who is being slandered,

original: nyan pa po gzhan la yang ngo //
analyzed: nyan pa po gzhan la yang ngo //
translated: but also in regard to the other who is listening.

original: ming ma smos par zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ming ma smos par zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Without mentioning the name” means

original: ming nas smos pa 'ba' zhig gis ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ming nas smos pa 'ba' zhig gis ma yin gyi /
translated: not only by mentioning the name,

original: ming ma smos par yang ngo //
analyzed: ming ma smos par yang ngo //
translated: but also without mentioning the name.

original: brjod na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni rnam pa de lta bu brjod na yang skur pa 'debs pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: brjod na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni rnam pa de lta bu brjod na yang skur pa 'debs pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Even if expressed” means even if expressed in that way, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: zas kyi rnyed pa la ni nyes byas te /
analyzed: zas kyi rnyed pa la ni nyes byas te /
translated: There is an offense of wrong conduct for acquiring food.

original: rnam par 'byed pa las zas kyi rnyed pa ma smos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa las zas kyi rnyed pa ma smos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the analysis of the requisites of a monk does not mention the acquisition of food.

original: 'di ltar de nyid las rnyed pa zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de nyid las rnyed pa zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa gnyis te /
translated: The same text states: “Acquisition” means two types of acquisition:

original: gos kyi rnyed pa dang / zas kyi rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: gos kyi rnyed pa dang / zas kyi rnyed pa'o //
translated: acquisition of robes and acquisition of food.

original: don 'dir ni gos kyi rnyed pa yin par dgongs so zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: don 'dir ni gos kyi rnyed pa yin par dgongs so zhes gsungs pas /
translated: In this context, the intended meaning is acquisition of robes.

original: 'dir zas kyi rnyed pa ma yin pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'dir zas kyi rnyed pa ma yin pa zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, the text says “not the acquisition of food.”

original: gang zag la zhes bya ba'i tshig ni gang zag la bdag gis bsngos so zhes bya ba'i tshig de bsal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang zag la zhes bya ba'i tshig ni gang zag la bdag gis bsngos so zhes bya ba'i tshig de bsal ba'i phyir te /
translated: The phrase “in regard to a person” is stated to eliminate the idea that the acquisition is dedicated to a person.

original: 'di ltar bshes ngor byas te zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar bshes ngor byas te zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the text says “in a biased manner.”🔽The Questions of Milinda also says:

original: zhu ba las kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis yang dge slong gang 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa dag gis 'di ltar bshes ngor byas te /
analyzed: zhu ba las kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis yang dge slong gang 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa dag gis 'di ltar bshes ngor byas te /
translated: “Blessed One, if a monk says, ‘Venerables, in a biased manner,

original: dge 'dun gyi rnyed par bsngos pa gang zag la sngo bar byed do zhes zer na zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi rnyed par bsngos pa gang zag la sngo bar byed do zhes zer na zhes gsungs te /
translated: they dedicate to a person the acquisition of the Saṅgha,’ what is the offense?”

original: bshes ngor byas te zhes gsungs pa las ni bdag nyid ces bya ba'i tshig tu brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bshes ngor byas te zhes gsungs pa las ni bdag nyid ces bya ba'i tshig tu brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: The phrase “through partiality” should not be expressed as the word “self.”

original: so sor thar pa'i mdo las tshe dang ldan pa dag gis 'di ltar bshes ngor byas te /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mdo las tshe dang ldan pa dag gis 'di ltar bshes ngor byas te /
translated: The Sūtra on Individual Liberation says, “Venerables, if you say, ‘In this way, through partiality,🔽I have dedicated to a person what was dedicated to the Saṅgha,’ then you have committed a wrong.”

original: 'di ltar dge 'dun gyi rnyed @268b par bsngos pa bdag gis gang zag la bsngos so zhes de skad zer na ltung byed do zhes mang po'i tshig tu byas pa gang yin pa de ni gtso bo ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge 'dun gyi rnyed @268b par bsngos pa bdag gis gang zag la bsngos so zhes de skad zer na ltung byed do zhes mang po'i tshig tu byas pa gang yin pa de ni gtso bo ma yin te /
translated: The word “many” is not the main point.

original: 'di ltar gcig la brjod na yang ltung byed du 'gyur ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gcig la brjod na yang ltung byed du 'gyur ba kho na yin no //
translated: If you say this to one person, you have committed a wrong.

original: dge slong mang po dag la mnyam du brjod na yang dge slong ji snyed la skur ba 'debs par byed pa de rnyed kyi ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong mang po dag la mnyam du brjod na yang dge slong ji snyed la skur ba 'debs par byed pa de rnyed kyi ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say this to many monks, then you have committed a wrong of stealing the amount of the offering that you have slandered.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is the teaching.

original: gal te dge slong gis dang pa byin nas dge slong la skur pa 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: gal te dge slong gis dang pa byin nas dge slong la skur pa 'debs par byed de /
translated: If a monk has received an offering and then slanders a monk,

original: dge slong 'dis dge 'dun gyi rnyed par bsngos pa zas kyi rnyed pa ma gtogs pa'i rnyed pa gzhan mi rigs par 'di ltar bshes ngor byas te ;
analyzed: dge slong 'dis dge 'dun gyi rnyed par bsngos pa zas kyi rnyed pa ma gtogs pa'i rnyed pa gzhan mi rigs par 'di ltar bshes ngor byas te ;
translated: This monk, who has dedicated the gains of the Saṅgha to himself, has dedicated them to a person, saying, “This gain is not suitable for anyone other than me.”

original: gang zag la bsngos so zhes de nyid dam gzhan gyi mdun du ming nas smos kyang rung ming nas ma smos kyang rung ste /
analyzed: gang zag la bsngos so zhes de nyid dam gzhan gyi mdun du ming nas smos kyang rung ming nas ma smos kyang rung ste /
translated: Whether he says this in the presence of that person or in the presence of others, whether he mentions the person’s name or not,

original: brdzun du de skad smras na de la skur pa 'debs pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro //🔽gang zag la zhes smos pa las na dge 'dun gzhan la ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: brdzun du de skad smras na de la skur pa 'debs pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro // gang zag la zhes smos pa las na dge 'dun gzhan la ni nyes byas so //
translated: if he lies, then he commits an offense entailing expulsion.🔽Since the rule says “to a person,” then if it is dedicated to another Saṅgha, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa zhes smos pa las na gang zag gi rnyed pa gzhan la bsngos zhes brjod na yang nyes byas kho na'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa zhes smos pa las na gang zag gi rnyed pa gzhan la bsngos zhes brjod na yang nyes byas kho na'o //
translated: Since the rule says “the gains of the Saṅgha,” then if it is dedicated to another person, it is also an offense of wrong conduct.

original: skur pa 'debs pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: skur pa 'debs pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The class of offenses entailing expulsion has been explained.

original: // / khyad du gsod pa'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: // / khyad du gsod pa'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /
translated: The class of offenses of wrong conduct that are committed in order to disparage

original: 'dul ba dang ldan pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'dul ba dang ldan pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: “You are not in possession of the Vinaya.”

original: so sor thar pa dang de rnam par 'byed pa la sogs par gtogs pa'i tshig gang yin pa'i tshig de la brnyas thabs su gyur pa brjod na khyad du gsod pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: so sor thar pa dang de rnam par 'byed pa la sogs par gtogs pa'i tshig gang yin pa'i tshig de la brnyas thabs su gyur pa brjod na khyad du gsod pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one disparages any words belonging to the Pratimoksha, the Vinaya, and so forth, one commits a downfall of contempt.

original: 'dir brnyas thabs kyi bye brag las ltung ba'i bye brag tu shes par bya'i /
analyzed: 'dir brnyas thabs kyi bye brag las ltung ba'i bye brag tu shes par bya'i /
translated: Here, one should understand that the different downfalls are due to the different degrees of disparagement,

original: 'don pa'i bye brag las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'don pa'i bye brag las ni ma yin te /
translated: but not due to the different ways of reciting them.

original: 'di ltar brnyas thabs su gyur pa'i tshig ji snyed pa de snyed kho na'i ltung bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: 'di ltar brnyas thabs su gyur pa'i tshig ji snyed pa de snyed kho na'i ltung bar 'gyur bas /
translated: Thus, there are as many downfalls as there are disparaging words.

original: de'i phyir tshig gi bye brag gzhan las ltung ba'i bye brag tu shes par bya'i /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig gi bye brag gzhan las ltung ba'i bye brag tu shes par bya'i /
translated: Therefore, one should understand that the different downfalls are due to the different words,

original: 'don pa'i bye brag las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'don pa'i bye brag las ni ma yin no //
translated: but not due to the different ways of reciting them.

original: 'o na so sor thar pa'i mdo las yang dge slong gang zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa na bslab pa khyad du bsad nas zhes gsungs pa des 'dul ba mtha' dag tu gtogs pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi la brnyas thabs byed pa'i kha
analyzed: 'o na so sor thar pa'i mdo las yang dge slong gang zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa na bslab pa khyad du bsad nas zhes gsungs pa des 'dul ba mtha' dag tu gtogs pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi la brnyas thabs byed pa'i kha
translated: If a fully ordained monk disregards the trainings during the confession ceremony held every half month,

original: na ma tho ba 'di ji ltar rnam par gzhag par bya zhe na /🔽so sor thar pa'i mdo las gsungs pa ni 'du la ba lhag ma rnams kyi dpe tsam du zad de /
analyzed: na ma tho ba 'di ji ltar rnam par gzhag par bya zhe na / so sor thar pa'i mdo las gsungs pa ni 'du la ba lhag ma rnams kyi dpe tsam du zad de /
translated: then how is this downfall that disregards the bases of training included in the entire Vinaya to be posited?

original: dge 'dun gyi @269a * //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi @269a * //
translated: The Sravaka Levels states that the confession ceremony is merely an example of the remaining parts of the Vinaya.🔽It states that if one disregards any of the teachings of the Buddha that are included in the Vinaya,

original: 'dul ba dang ldan pa gang ci tsam brjod pa la brnyas thabs su byed na thams cad du ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dul ba dang ldan pa gang ci tsam brjod pa la brnyas thabs su byed na thams cad du ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then one commits a downfall.

original: mdo sde la ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mdo sde la ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Compendium of Determinations mentions a wrong deed for the sutras.

original: 'dul ba dang ldan pa dus ma yin pa'i zas dang / 'bru rlon pa len pa la sogs pa las gzhan pa mdo sder gtogs pa'i brjod pa gzhan la khyad du gsod na nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'dul ba dang ldan pa dus ma yin pa'i zas dang / 'bru rlon pa len pa la sogs pa las gzhan pa mdo sder gtogs pa'i brjod pa gzhan la khyad du gsod na nyes byas so //
translated: If one disparages other statements included in the Sutra Collection, such as the Vinaya, which prohibits eating at improper times and accepting raw grain, and so on, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: chos mngon pa ni 'dul ba dang mdo sde dag las tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chos mngon pa ni 'dul ba dang mdo sde dag las tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: The Abhidharma is not separate from the Vinaya and the Sutra Collection.

original: 'di ltar dge slong gis sdom pa la sogs pa 'dul ba las gsungs pa yang der rnam par dpyod par byed pa la mdo sde'i don dang / mdo sde'i gdar lta bu dang / mdo sde rnam par 'chad pa yang chos mngon pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar dge slong gis sdom pa la sogs pa 'dul ba las gsungs pa yang der rnam par dpyod par byed pa la mdo sde'i don dang / mdo sde'i gdar lta bu dang / mdo sde rnam par 'chad pa yang chos mngon pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the sutras and the sutra basket are like the Abhidharma, because the analysis of the vows of a fully ordained monk and so on, which are taught in the Vinaya, is the Abhidharma.

original: khyad du gsod pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: khyad du gsod pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The natural offense of disparaging has been explained.🔽The natural offense of destroying seeds and crops

original: // / sa bon dang skye ba 'jig pa'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas de bya ba'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / sa bon dang skye ba 'jig pa'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas de bya ba'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: is explained in order to show the method of committing that offense.

original: lag gi blas mchod rten dang dge 'dun gyi don du shing ljon pa gcad par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: lag gi blas mchod rten dang dge 'dun gyi don du shing ljon pa gcad par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The one who is skilled in the work of the Sangha is the one who says, “I will cut down the tree for the sake of the stupa and the Sangha.”

original: dge slong gang las sar pa dag byed pa'i ngang tshul can de ni lag gi bla zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gang las sar pa dag byed pa'i ngang tshul can de ni lag gi bla zhes bya'o //
translated: The one who is skilled in the work of the Sangha is the one who has the nature of doing new work for the Sangha.

original: mchod rten gyi phyir zhes bya ba ni mchog rten gyi rgyur ro //
analyzed: mchod rten gyi phyir zhes bya ba ni mchog rten gyi rgyur ro //
translated: “For the sake of the stupa” means for the sake of the stupa.

original: mchod rten smos pas chos dkon mchog smos pa yin te /
analyzed: mchod rten smos pas chos dkon mchog smos pa yin te /
translated: The mention of the stupa includes the Jewel of the Dharma,

original: mchod rten ni chos kyi sku yin pa'i phyir ro ;🔽/ dge 'dun gyi phyir zhes bya ba ni /🔽dge 'dun gyi yo byad kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mchod rten ni chos kyi sku yin pa'i phyir ro ; / dge 'dun gyi phyir zhes bya ba ni / dge 'dun gyi yo byad kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the stupa is the body of the Dharma.🔽“For the sake of the Sangha” means for the sake of the requisites of the Sangha.

original: gcad pa'i phyir sta gon bya ba smra bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: gcad pa'i phyir sta gon bya ba smra bar 'dod nas /
translated: “For the sake of cutting” means for the sake of cutting down.

original: de'i mdun rol du nyi ma bdun nam brgyad nas de'i drung du dkyil 'khor dang dri dang me tog dang / bdug pa dang mar me dang gtor ma sbyin pa dang / rgyud chags gsum pa gdon pa dang / sbyin pa bshad par byas nas lha gang dag shing ljon pa 'di la gnas pa de dag gnas gzhan tshol cig / shing ljon pa 'dis mchod rten nam dge 'dun gyi bya ba byed par 'gyur ro zhes brjod nas smra ba pos shes par gyis shig ces so
analyzed: de'i mdun rol du nyi ma bdun nam brgyad nas de'i drung du dkyil 'khor dang dri dang me tog dang / bdug pa dang mar me dang gtor ma sbyin pa dang / rgyud chags gsum pa gdon pa dang / sbyin pa bshad par byas nas lha gang dag shing ljon pa 'di la gnas pa de dag gnas gzhan tshol cig / shing ljon pa 'dis mchod rten nam dge 'dun gyi bya ba byed par 'gyur ro zhes brjod nas smra ba pos shes par gyis shig ces so
translated: This tree will be used for a stupa or for the Saṅgha.”

original: zhes bya ba smras te /🔽de'i mdun rol du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te / de'i mdun rol du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Then he should say, “May the speaker understand!”🔽In front of that tree

original: gcad pa de'i mdun rol du'o //🔽nyi ma bdun nam brgyad nas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gcad pa de'i mdun rol du'o // nyi ma bdun nam brgyad nas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: means in front of that tree that is to be cut down.🔽For seven or eight days

original: nyi ma bdun nam nyi ma brgyad kyi mdun rol nas so //🔽de'i drung du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyi ma bdun nam nyi ma brgyad kyi mdun rol nas so // de'i drung du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: means for seven or eight days before the tree is cut down.🔽At its foot

original: shing ljon pa de'i drung du'o //
analyzed: shing ljon pa de'i drung du'o //
translated: means at the foot of that tree.

original: lag gi blas shing ljon pa'i lha'i phyir dkyil 'khor byas te /
analyzed: lag gi blas shing ljon pa'i lha'i phyir dkyil 'khor byas te /
translated: The ritual master should make a mandala for the tree spirit,

original: dri la sogs pa sbyin pa nas sbyin pa @269b bshad pa'i bar dag byas nas 'di skad brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: dri la sogs pa sbyin pa nas sbyin pa @269b bshad pa'i bar dag byas nas 'di skad brjod par bya ste /
translated: and having offered perfumes and so forth, he should say:

original: lha gang dag shing ljon pa 'di la gnas pa de dag gnas gzhan tshol cig ces bya ba la sogs pa brjod nas so //
analyzed: lha gang dag shing ljon pa 'di la gnas pa de dag gnas gzhan tshol cig ces bya ba la sogs pa brjod nas so //
translated: “Whatever spirits live in this tree, seek another dwelling place.”

original: mchod rten nam dge 'dun gyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mchod rten nam dge 'dun gyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Stūpa” means for the sake of the stūpa,🔽and “saṃgha” means for the sake of the saṃgha.

original: de gnyis kyi don gyi ched nyid du bya ba byed par 'gyur ro zhes brjod nas gcod du gzhug par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi don gyi ched nyid du bya ba byed par 'gyur ro zhes brjod nas gcod du gzhug par bya ba'o //
translated: Having said, “I will do this work,” he should have it cut down.

original: ji ltar gcod du gzhug par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar gcod du gzhug par bya zhe na /
translated: How should it be cut down?

original: de'i phyir dge slong lag gi bla smra ba pos rang gi lag dar te mi gcad par khyim pa shing mkhan la sogs pa dag la shes par gyis shig ces zur gyis bsgo ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong lag gi bla smra ba pos rang gi lag dar te mi gcad par khyim pa shing mkhan la sogs pa dag la shes par gyis shig ces zur gyis bsgo ste /
translated: The ritual master should not cut it with his own hand, but should have a layman, a carpenter, and so forth, do it.

original: gcod du gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: gcod du gzhug par bya'o //
translated: He should have it cut down, saying, “Understand this.”

original: gal te me 'byung ba'am khrag 'dzag pa 'am /
analyzed: gal te me 'byung ba'am khrag 'dzag pa 'am /
translated: If fire appears, blood flows,

original: yan lag 'gul ba'am /
analyzed: yan lag 'gul ba'am /
translated: or a limb moves,

original: lo ma lhags pa la sogs pa rnam par 'gyur ba ston na des zhing la sbyin pa dang / ser sna dag gi bsngags pa dang bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lo ma lhags pa la sogs pa rnam par 'gyur ba ston na des zhing la sbyin pa dang / ser sna dag gi bsngags pa dang bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it shows a change, such as the falling of leaves, then he should praise generosity and criticize stinginess with regard to that field.

original: de ltar shing ljon pa de gcod du bcug pa na /
analyzed: de ltar shing ljon pa de gcod du bcug pa na /
translated: Thus, when that tree is being cut down,

original: gal te me 'byung ba la sogs pa rnam par 'gyur ba ston na de'i tshe lag gi bla des zhes bya ba la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: gal te me 'byung ba la sogs pa rnam par 'gyur ba ston na de'i tshe lag gi bla des zhes bya ba la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: if it shows a change, such as the appearance of fire, then at that time the hand-servant should do as stated in the verse.

original: zhing la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhing la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: With regard to the field,

original: bsod nams kyi zhing mchod rten dang dge 'dun la'o //🔽de la sbyin pa dang ser sna dag byed pa ni /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi zhing mchod rten dang dge 'dun la'o // de la sbyin pa dang ser sna dag byed pa ni /
translated: it is the field of merit, the caitya and the Saṅgha.🔽 With regard to generosity and stinginess,

original: de dag nyid de sbyin pa'i bsngags pa dang / ser sna'i bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid de sbyin pa'i bsngags pa dang / ser sna'i bsngags pa ma yin pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: he should praise generosity and criticize stinginess.

original: 'di skad bstan te ;
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te ;
translated: This is taught as follows.

original: sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun gyi bdag nyid kyi zhing la sbyin pa'i bsngags pa brjod par bya zhing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun gyi bdag nyid kyi zhing la sbyin pa'i bsngags pa brjod par bya zhing /
translated: The praise of generosity should be expressed with regard to the field of the nature of the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha.

original: ser sna'i bsngags pa ma yin pa yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ser sna'i bsngags pa ma yin pa yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should also speak in praise of generosity.

original: mi gtong na gcad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi gtong na gcad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it does not let go, it should not be cut down.

original: de ltar byas kyang me 'byung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba mi gtong na shing ljon pa de gcad par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar byas kyang me 'byung ba la sogs pa'i rnam par 'gyur ba mi gtong na shing ljon pa de gcad par mi bya ste /
translated: If it does not let go of its transformation into fire, etc., even though it is treated in this way, that tree should not be cut down.

original: shing ljon pa mi gcad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shing ljon pa mi gcad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that the tree should not be cut down.

original: shes gtso bo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shes gtso bo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The mind is the chief factor.

original: 'dir yang shes gtso bo'o zhes bya ba'i ming dang / 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba'i ming can du sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: 'dir yang shes gtso bo'o zhes bya ba'i ming dang / 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba'i ming can du sbyor bar byed do //
translated: Here, the term “chief factor” is also applied to the term “mind” and to the term “the one who makes perception predominate.”

original: gang la 'du shes byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang la 'du shes byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
translated: With regard to what is the one who makes perception?

original: de'i phyir ma nyams pa nyid la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma nyams pa nyid la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “in the case of non-loss.”

original: gal te ma nyams pa nyid kyi yul la yongs su shes pa yin na'o //
analyzed: gal te ma nyams pa nyid kyi yul la yongs su shes pa yin na'o //
translated: If there is complete knowledge of the object of non-loss.

original: gang gis ma nyams pa nyid la zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis ma nyams pa nyid la zhe na /
translated: By what is there non-loss?

original: de'i phyir sa bon dang khye'u kha 'thon par rung bar ma byas pa dag gi'o zhes bya ba smras te /🔽me la sogs pa gang gis sa bon dang khye'u kha @270a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir sa bon dang khye'u kha 'thon par rung bar ma byas pa dag gi'o zhes bya ba smras te / me la sogs pa gang gis sa bon dang khye'u kha @270a * //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “of seeds and a child who is not fit to work.”

original: 'thon pa dag rung bar ma byas pa de ni sa bon dang khye'u kha 'thon pa rung bar ma byas pa dag go //
analyzed: 'thon pa dag rung bar ma byas pa de ni sa bon dang khye'u kha 'thon pa rung bar ma byas pa dag go //
translated: By what, such as fire, seeds and a child who is not fit to work are not rendered fit, that is seeds and a child who is not fit to work.

original: sa bon dang khye'u kha 'thon pa rung bar ma byas pa dag ni sa bon dang khye'u kha 'thon pa rung ba ma byas pa ste de dag gi'o //
analyzed: sa bon dang khye'u kha 'thon pa rung bar ma byas pa dag ni sa bon dang khye'u kha 'thon pa rung ba ma byas pa ste de dag gi'o //
translated: Seeds and a child who is not fit to work are seeds and a child who is not fit to work.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught:

original: sa bon dang khye'u kha 'thon pa rung bar ma byas pa dag gi ma nyams pa nyid shes na'o //
analyzed: sa bon dang khye'u kha 'thon pa rung bar ma byas pa dag gi ma nyams pa nyid shes na'o //
translated: If one knows the non-expiration of seeds and a child who is not fit to work.

original: khye'u kha 'thon pa zhes smos pa ni /
analyzed: khye'u kha 'thon pa zhes smos pa ni /
translated: The mention of a child who is not fit to work

original: rtsva la sogs pa skye ba dag gzung ngo //
analyzed: rtsva la sogs pa skye ba dag gzung ngo //
translated: includes the arising of grass, etc.

original: rung bar ma byas pa zhes smos pas ni sa bon rung bar ma byas pa ma nyams pa dag nyams par byas pa la ltung ba med par ston to //
analyzed: rung bar ma byas pa zhes smos pas ni sa bon rung bar ma byas pa ma nyams pa dag nyams par byas pa la ltung ba med par ston to //
translated: The mention of not fit to work shows that there is no offense in damaging seeds and a child who is not fit to work that are not fit to work and have not expired.

original: ci zhig rjes su sgrub na de la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig rjes su sgrub na de la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: It is the one who is the principal perceiver of that which is to be done.

original: de'i phyir tha na rtsa rgyun yan chad nyams par byas na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha na rtsa rgyun yan chad nyams par byas na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “even if the root or the stem is damaged.”

original: 'dir mngon par khyab par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir mngon par khyab par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to make this clear,

original: tha na zhes bya ba smras so //🔽rtsa rgyun zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tha na zhes bya ba smras so // rtsa rgyun zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “even if” is said.

original: rtsa ba dang 'brel pa'i rgyun phra mo'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba dang 'brel pa'i rgyun phra mo'o //
translated: “Root or stem” means a subtle continuum connected to a root.

original: tha na de yan chad nyams par byas na'o //
analyzed: tha na de yan chad nyams par byas na'o //
translated: “Even if” means if the root or the stem is damaged.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: sa bon dang khye'u kha 'thon pa dag dngos nyams par byas pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: sa bon dang khye'u kha 'thon pa dag dngos nyams par byas pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Not only is the seed or the infant’s speech damaged,

original: de dag gi rtsa rgyun yan chad nyams par byed na'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rtsa rgyun yan chad nyams par byed na'o //
translated: but if the root or the stem of those is damaged,

original: 'dir gzhung ni shing ljon pa'i rtsa rgyun 'thog par byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni shing ljon pa'i rtsa rgyun 'thog par byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: the text here says that if the root or the stem of a tree is cut, a minor offense is committed.

original: ji ltar nyams par byed na zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar nyams par byed na zhe na /
translated: How is it damaged?

original: de'i phyir ji ltar yang rung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar yang rung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “in any way.”

original: rnam pa gang yang rung bas so //
analyzed: rnam pa gang yang rung bas so //
translated: By any means whatsoever.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir sprugs pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir sprugs pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says, “By shaking it as well.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis shing tog dag sprug cing klog par bgyid na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis shing tog dag sprug cing klog par bgyid na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: Here the scripture states, “Venerable, if a monk shakes fruit and reads, what is the offense?”

original: gal te shing tog smin pa dag yin na ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: gal te shing tog smin pa dag yin na ni nyes byas so //
translated: If the fruit is ripe, it is a minor offense.

original: ji ste ma yin pa dag yin na ni ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ste ma yin pa dag yin na ni ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If it is not, it is a downfall.”

original: rtsva dang 'dam rdzab dang sa rdul la sogs pa dag gis mnan nas kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rtsva dang 'dam rdzab dang sa rdul la sogs pa dag gis mnan nas kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “By trampling on grass, mud, dust, and so forth”

original: gal te nyams par byed na ltung byed do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gal te nyams par byed na ltung byed do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: means that if one damages them, it is a downfall.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis ran nam 'dam rdzab bam sa rdul dag gis shing ljon pa nyams par gyur cig / rnam par nyams par gyur cig ces gnon par bgyid na ltung ba cir 'gyur nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis ran nam 'dam rdzab bam sa rdul dag gis shing ljon pa nyams par gyur cig / rnam par nyams par gyur cig ces gnon par bgyid na ltung ba cir 'gyur nyes byas so //
translated: Here the scripture states, “Venerable, if a monk tramples on a tree, thinking, ‘May it wither! May it wither!’ or, ‘May it be destroyed! May it be destroyed!’ what is the offense?” It is a minor offense.

original: btsun pa dge slong gis ran sngon pos rdul lam bye ma'am gzhan gang yang rung bas 'debs par bgyid na ltung ba cir 'gyur nyes @270b byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis ran sngon pos rdul lam bye ma'am gzhan gang yang rung bas 'debs par bgyid na ltung ba cir 'gyur nyes @270b byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If a monk, Venerable, sprinkles with blue dye, or with dust, sand, or anything else, what is the offense? It is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'dir sbyor ba tsam la dgongs nas nyes byas su gsungs par zad kyi gal te nyams par byed na ni ltung byed kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba tsam la dgongs nas nyes byas su gsungs par zad kyi gal te nyams par byed na ni ltung byed kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, it is said that it is an offense of wrong conduct with the intention of just the application. But if it is damaged, it is only a downfall.

original: 'dir 'dam rdzab ces bya ba ni 'jim pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'dam rdzab ces bya ba ni 'jim pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, mud should be understood as clay.

original: khu tshan la sogs pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khu tshan la sogs pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Also with urine, etc.

original: khu tshan zhes bya ba ni 'u sha la sogs pa'i khu ba tsha ba gtor ba'o //
analyzed: khu tshan zhes bya ba ni 'u sha la sogs pa'i khu ba tsha ba gtor ba'o //
translated: Urine is the sprinkling of hot liquid such as lye.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras 'chag pa dang / yal ga la sogs pa 'dren pa dang / dkyil 'khor dang skyad nul la sogs pa dag kyang bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras 'chag pa dang / yal ga la sogs pa 'dren pa dang / dkyil 'khor dang skyad nul la sogs pa dag kyang bsdu'o //
translated: The word etc. includes walking, pulling branches, and so on, and also drawing mandalas and sprinkling.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa sngo'i phyogs su 'u sha tsha ba 'thor na zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa sngo'i phyogs su 'u sha tsha ba 'thor na zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text is: Venerable, if one sprinkles hot lye on the blue side, and so on.

original: rlung dang nya ma la 'jog pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni sa bon nyams par byed na ni ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rlung dang nya ma la 'jog pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni sa bon nyams par byed na ni ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not destroy the seeds, it is a downfall.

original: gal te ma yin na ni sbyor ba tsam gyis nyes byas so //
analyzed: gal te ma yin na ni sbyor ba tsam gyis nyes byas so //
translated: If one does not destroy them, it is a minor infraction for the mere preparation.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong ma'i rnam par 'byed pa las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong ma'i rnam par 'byed pa las /
translated: Here is the source text from the Bhikṣuṇī Vibhaṅga:

original: dge slong mas sa bon gyi rigs lnga po 'di dag nyams par gyur cig ces rlung dang nyi ma la 'jog par byed na /
analyzed: dge slong mas sa bon gyi rigs lnga po 'di dag nyams par gyur cig ces rlung dang nyi ma la 'jog par byed na /
translated: If a bhikṣuṇī places these five types of seeds in the wind and sun, thinking, “May they be destroyed,”

original: gal te sa bon rnam par nyams na ni ltung byed do //
analyzed: gal te sa bon rnam par nyams na ni ltung byed do //
translated: if the seeds are destroyed, it is a downfall.

original: rnam par ma nyams na ni nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽sa gzhi skam por yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par ma nyams na ni nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no // sa gzhi skam por yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If they are not destroyed, it is a minor infraction.🔽Also, on dry ground.

original: 'jog pas kyang ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'jog pas kyang ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Also, it is said that if one places them there, it is the same.🔽Here is the source text from the Bhikṣu Vibhaṅga:

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis sa bon gyi rigs lnga po dag nyams par gyur cig ces sa gzhi skam por 'jog par byed na /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis sa bon gyi rigs lnga po dag nyams par gyur cig ces sa gzhi skam por 'jog par byed na /
translated: If a bhikṣu places these five types of seeds on dry ground, thinking, “May they be destroyed,”

original: gal te sa bon rnam par nyams na ni ltung byed lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sa bon rnam par nyams na ni ltung byed lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: if the seeds are destroyed, it is five downfalls.

original: gal te rnam par ma nyams na ni nyes byas lngar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te rnam par ma nyams na ni nyes byas lngar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If it is not damaged, then there are five misdeeds.

original: bsam pa ji lta bus she na /
analyzed: bsam pa ji lta bus she na /
translated: With what kind of thought?

original: de'i phyir der 'dun pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir der 'dun pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “with the intention to damage it.”

original: nyams par 'dun pas so //
analyzed: nyams par 'dun pas so //
translated: With the intention to damage it.

original: ci rang kho nas sam zhe na /
analyzed: ci rang kho nas sam zhe na /
translated: Is it only by oneself?

original: de'i phyir rang ngam gzhan gyis kyang rung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang ngam gzhan gyis kyang rung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “by oneself or by another.”

original: rang gi lag gis sam /
analyzed: rang gi lag gis sam /
translated: By one’s own hand,

original: gzhan gyi lag dag gis so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan gyi lag dag gis so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: or by the hands of another.

original: gnas skabs gang la ltung ba ji lta bu dag 'byung zhe na /🔽de'i phyir nyams par gyur na /
analyzed: gnas skabs gang la ltung ba ji lta bu dag 'byung zhe na / de'i phyir nyams par gyur na /
translated: In what situation do what kind of downfalls occur?

original: dngos gzhi dag go zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dngos gzhi dag go zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “if it is damaged, then the actual basis.”

original: nyams par gyur pa na dngos gzhi'i ltung ba dag 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nyams par gyur pa na dngos gzhi'i ltung ba dag 'byung ngo //
translated: If it is damaged, then downfalls of the actual basis occur.

original: de'i sbyor ba la ni nyes byas dag go //
analyzed: de'i sbyor ba la ni nyes byas dag go //
translated: In its preparation, there are misdeeds.

original: gal te sbyor ba gcig gi dbang gis sa bon mang po dag nyams par byed na ci sbyor ba gcig gi dbang yin pas ltung ba'ang @271a * //🔽gcig kho nar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: gal te sbyor ba gcig gi dbang gis sa bon mang po dag nyams par byed na ci sbyor ba gcig gi dbang yin pas ltung ba'ang @271a * // gcig kho nar 'gyur ram /
translated: If many seeds are destroyed by the power of one action, then is there only one downfall by the power of one action?

original: 'on te nyams par bya ba'i grangs kyi dbang gis ltung ba yang mang por 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te nyams par bya ba'i grangs kyi dbang gis ltung ba yang mang por 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Or is there a multitude of downfalls by the power of the number of things destroyed?

original: de'i phyir nyams par bya ba'i grangs dag gi'o zhes bya ba smras te /🔽nyams par bya ba'i grangs dag gis ltung ba'i grangs kyang rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba sbyar te ;
analyzed: de'i phyir nyams par bya ba'i grangs dag gi'o zhes bya ba smras te / nyams par bya ba'i grangs dag gis ltung ba'i grangs kyang rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba sbyar te ;
translated: Therefore it is said, “By the number of things destroyed.”🔽The number of downfalls is also established by the number of things destroyed.

original: nyams par bya ba dag gi grangs ji snyed pa de snyed kyi ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyams par bya ba dag gi grangs ji snyed pa de snyed kyi ltung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: As many downfalls as there are things to be destroyed.

original: nyams par bya bdag gi grangs kyi ltung ba rnam par gzhag par bstan na ci lo ma dang yal gdang 'dab ma las grangs rnam par gzhag par bya'am zhe na /
analyzed: nyams par bya bdag gi grangs kyi ltung ba rnam par gzhag par bstan na ci lo ma dang yal gdang 'dab ma las grangs rnam par gzhag par bya'am zhe na /
translated: If it is taught that downfalls are established by the number of things destroyed, then is the number of downfalls established by the number of leaves, branches, and twigs?

original: de'i phyir sdong bu las so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sdong bu las so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is from the trunk.

original: shing ljon pa drung bar gyur pa'i sdong bu las bcad na yal ga dang yal ga phra mo dang 'dab ma la sogs pa du ma nyid yod du zin kyang de lta mod kyi ltung ba gcig kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: shing ljon pa drung bar gyur pa'i sdong bu las bcad na yal ga dang yal ga phra mo dang 'dab ma la sogs pa du ma nyid yod du zin kyang de lta mod kyi ltung ba gcig kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: If the trunk of a tree is cut down in the middle of a forest, although many branches, twigs and leaves exist, still only one downfall is accrued.

original: shing ljon pa'i sdong bu gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shing ljon pa'i sdong bu gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the trunk of the tree is one.

original: de bzhin du yal ga dag rang gi sdong bu las bcad pa la yal ga phra mo dang 'dab ma mang po nyid yod pa dang / yal ga phra mo dag rang gi sdong bu las bcad pa la 'dab ma mang po nyid yod pa dang /🔽'dab ma dag rang gi sdong bu las bcad pa la 'dab ma bdun pa ltar 'dab ma mang po nyid yod pa dang / ae randa'i 'dab ma ltar yal ga mang po nyid yod du zin kyang de lta mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du yal ga dag rang gi sdong bu las bcad pa la yal ga phra mo dang 'dab ma mang po nyid yod pa dang / yal ga phra mo dag rang gi sdong bu las bcad pa la 'dab ma mang po nyid yod pa dang / 'dab ma dag rang gi sdong bu las bcad pa la 'dab ma bdun pa ltar 'dab ma mang po nyid yod pa dang / ae randa'i 'dab ma ltar yal ga mang po nyid yod du zin kyang de lta mod kyi /
translated: Similarly, if the branches are cut from their trunk, although many twigs and leaves exist, and if the twigs are cut from their trunk, although many leaves exist,

original: ltung byed gcig kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ltung byed gcig kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: and if the leaves are cut from their trunk, although many leaves exist like the seven leaves of the Indian elm, and although many branches exist like the leaves of the eranda plant, still only one downfall is accrued.

original: sdong bu zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sdong bu zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The trunk is the example of the lower part.

original: 'og ma'i cha'i dpe yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'og ma'i cha'i dpe yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the trunk is the example of the lower part.

original: de lta bas na 'dab ma'i yal ga gcad pa dang / lcug ma'i mgo lcogs bcad na yang ltung byed do //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dab ma'i yal ga gcad pa dang / lcug ma'i mgo lcogs bcad na yang ltung byed do //
translated: Therefore, if one cuts off a branch or a shoot, there is a fall.

original: sdong bu'i ngos nas cung zad brtsegs pa dang / 'dab ma'i rim pa nas cung zad brtsegs pa ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas so //
analyzed: sdong bu'i ngos nas cung zad brtsegs pa dang / 'dab ma'i rim pa nas cung zad brtsegs pa ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas so //
translated: If one cuts off a little of the trunk or a little of the leaf-row, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: dge slong gis shing ljon pa gcig sbyor ba gcig gis gcod na nyes byas gcig dang ltung byed gcig go //
analyzed: dge slong gis shing ljon pa gcig sbyor ba gcig gis gcod na nyes byas gcig dang ltung byed gcig go //
translated: If a bhikṣu cuts down a tree with one effort, there is one offense of wrong conduct and one offense entailing confession.

original: dge slong gis shing ljon pa gcig sbyor ba gnyis kyis gcod na nyes byas gnyis dang ltung byed gcig go zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong gis shing ljon pa gcig sbyor ba gnyis kyis gcod na nyes byas gnyis dang ltung byed gcig go zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If a bhikṣu cuts down a tree with two efforts, there are two offenses of wrong conduct and one offense entailing confession.

original: skye ba'i phyir mdo rnam par bshad nas mdo de nyid sa bon gyi phyir rnam par bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: skye ba'i phyir mdo rnam par bshad nas mdo de nyid sa bon gyi phyir rnam par bshad par bya ste /
translated: In order to explain this, the sūtra should be explained as the seed.

original: nyams par bya ba'i grangs dag gi'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyams par bya ba'i grangs dag gi'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is said, For the purpose of decay, for the purpose of counting.🔽Here is the text:

original: sa bon gyi rigs ni rnam pa lnga ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: sa bon gyi rigs ni rnam pa lnga ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: There are five types of seeds:

original: rtsa ba'i sa @271b bon dang / sdong bu'i sa bon dang / tho gu'i sa bon dang / 'gas pa'i sa bon dang / sa bon gyi sa bon no //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i sa @271b bon dang / sdong bu'i sa bon dang / tho gu'i sa bon dang / 'gas pa'i sa bon dang / sa bon gyi sa bon no //
translated: root seeds, stem seeds, joint seeds, cutting seeds, and sprout seeds.

original: de la rtsa ba'i sa bon la sogs pa lnga po thams cad la gzugs ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad 'dir sdong bu nyid kyi rnam par bshad par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la rtsa ba'i sa bon la sogs pa lnga po thams cad la gzugs ji snyed yod pa de dag thams cad 'dir sdong bu nyid kyi rnam par bshad par rig par bya ste /
translated: In all five types of seeds, root seeds and so on, all the forms that exist are explained as being stems.

original: de'i phyir sa bon du gyur pa'i gzugs gcig la sdong bu ji snyed yod pa de snyed kyi ltung ba'i dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir sa bon du gyur pa'i gzugs gcig la sdong bu ji snyed yod pa de snyed kyi ltung ba'i dngos gzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, in one seed form, as many stems as there are become the actual basis of a downfall.

original: de lta bas na gang bu zhes bya ba'i sbubs gang dag na til dang sran ma la sogs pa'i 'bru ji snyed pa yod pa dang / yal ga'i tho gu gang dag ni go snyod dang ci tshe la sogs pa'i 'bru ji snyed yod pa de dag ni /
analyzed: de lta bas na gang bu zhes bya ba'i sbubs gang dag na til dang sran ma la sogs pa'i 'bru ji snyed pa yod pa dang / yal ga'i tho gu gang dag ni go snyod dang ci tshe la sogs pa'i 'bru ji snyed yod pa de dag ni /
translated: Thus, in the husks called “pods,” as many seeds of sesame, beans, and so on exist, and in the joints of the branches, as many seeds of cumin, coriander, and so on exist.

original: 'bru'i phyir gzugs tha dad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'bru'i phyir gzugs tha dad pa yin gyi /
translated: These are different forms for the sake of the seeds.

original: sbubs kyi phyir gzugs gcig pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: sbubs kyi phyir gzugs gcig pa yang ma yin la /
translated: It is not the same form as the husk.

original: tho gu'i phyir gzugs gcig pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tho gu'i phyir gzugs gcig pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the same form as the stalk.

original: de lta bas na sbubs dang tho gu dag la 'bru ji snyed rnam par gnas pa de dag ni sdong bu zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis gcig pa nyid du gnas par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bas na sbubs dang tho gu dag la 'bru ji snyed rnam par gnas pa de dag ni sdong bu zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis gcig pa nyid du gnas par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the number of grains that are present in the husk and the stalk are not present as a single entity called a stalk.

original: 'di ltar sbubs de na 'bru'i rdzas ji snyed yod pa dang / tho gu dang snye ma la 'bru'i rdzas ji snyed yod pa de kho na snyed kyi dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar sbubs de na 'bru'i rdzas ji snyed yod pa dang / tho gu dang snye ma la 'bru'i rdzas ji snyed yod pa de kho na snyed kyi dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the amount of grain substance that is in the husk and the amount of grain substance that is in the stalk and the ear of corn is the amount that constitutes the basic downfall.

original: sbyor ba la ni 'bru'i gzugs gcig la sbyor ba du brtsams pa de snyed kyi nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba la ni 'bru'i gzugs gcig la sbyor ba du brtsams pa de snyed kyi nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: In the preparatory stage, as many misdeed are committed as there are preparations for the use of a single grain of corn.

original: sbyor ba la ni nyes byas dag tu'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba la ni nyes byas dag tu'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the preparatory stage, there are misdeed.

original: sa bon dang skye ba'i rdzas gcig la sbyor ba du brtsams pa de snyed kyi nyes byas dag tu 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sa bon dang skye ba'i rdzas gcig la sbyor ba du brtsams pa de snyed kyi nyes byas dag tu 'gyur ba'o //
translated: As many misdeed are committed as there are preparations for the use of a single substance of seed or sprout.

original: 'di la bsnun pa re re las de tha dad pa yin gyi dngos po las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'di la bsnun pa re re las de tha dad pa yin gyi dngos po las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It is distinct for each blow, not for the thing.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni bsnun pa'i spyod pa nyid kyis 'jug pa 'di la'o //🔽bsnun pa re re la de tha dad pa yin gyi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni bsnun pa'i spyod pa nyid kyis 'jug pa 'di la'o // bsnun pa re re la de tha dad pa yin gyi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here means in this activity of striking.

original: sa bon dang skye ba nyams par bya ba dang / spyad par bya ba'i phyir gtun bu dang sta re la sogs pas bsnun pa re re la sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i nyes byas tha dad pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sa bon dang skye ba nyams par bya ba dang / spyad par bya ba'i phyir gtun bu dang sta re la sogs pas bsnun pa re re la sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i nyes byas tha dad pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: It is distinct for each blow means that for each blow with a hammer, axe, and so on, in order to destroy seeds and sprouts and to use them, one should understand that a distinct offense called preparation arises.

original: dngos po la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dngos po la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not for the thing means

original: sa bon dang skye ba'i dngos po gcig yin pas sbyor ba gcig tu 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sa bon dang skye ba'i dngos po gcig yin pas sbyor ba gcig tu 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: that since the thing seed and sprout is one, preparation would be one,

original: bsnun pa ji snyed pa de kho na snyed kyi sbyor ba dag tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsnun pa ji snyed pa de kho na snyed kyi sbyor ba dag tu 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: but as many blows as there are, there are that many preparations.

original: bton na bskyed par bya ba nyid yin du zin kyang mtha' nyid do zhes bya ba ni /🔽shing ljon pa la sogs pa rang gi gnas nas rtsa thon du bton pa la @272a * //
analyzed: bton na bskyed par bya ba nyid yin du zin kyang mtha' nyid do zhes bya ba ni / shing ljon pa la sogs pa rang gi gnas nas rtsa thon du bton pa la @272a * //
translated: If it is uprooted, it is uprooted even if it is to be replanted.🔽If a tree and so on is uprooted by the method of pulling it out from its place,

original: sogs pa'i rnam pas bton na bton pa de gnas gzhan du bskyed par bya ba nyid yin du zin kyang 'don pa'i sbyor ba'i grangs kyang sngar bstan pa bzhin la bton zin pa na /
analyzed: sogs pa'i rnam pas bton na bton pa de gnas gzhan du bskyed par bya ba nyid yin du zin kyang 'don pa'i sbyor ba'i grangs kyang sngar bstan pa bzhin la bton zin pa na /
translated: even if it is to be replanted in another place, the act of uprooting is complete.

original: dngos gzhi yang mtha' nyid de ltung byed nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos gzhi yang mtha' nyid de ltung byed nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The actual basis is also an extreme limit, that is, a downfall.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught as follows.

original: gal te shing ljon pa la sogs pa rang gi gnas nas rtsa thon du 'don par gyur na 'di ltar skyer rung ba'i chos nyid yod du zin kyang de lta mod kyi rang gi gnas nas bton cing phyung ba de nyid bshig cing nyams par byas pa yin🔽par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te shing ljon pa la sogs pa rang gi gnas nas rtsa thon du 'don par gyur na 'di ltar skyer rung ba'i chos nyid yod du zin kyang de lta mod kyi rang gi gnas nas bton cing phyung ba de nyid bshig cing nyams par byas pa yin🔽par rig par bya'o //
translated: If a tree and so on is uprooted from its place, even if it has the nature to grow again, it is still uprooted and destroyed.

original: de phyin chad gnas gzhan du rtsa ba ma zug gi bar du ni yal ga dang 'dab ma dang me tog la sogs pa btogs pa la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de phyin chad gnas gzhan du rtsa ba ma zug gi bar du ni yal ga dang 'dab ma dang me tog la sogs pa btogs pa la nyes pa med do //
translated: After that, there is no offense in plucking the branches, leaves, flowers, etc. until the plant has rooted in another place.

original: nya lcibs dang nya tshang dag chu nas bton pa ni de nyid do zhes bya ba ni /🔽nya tshang ni chu'i rtsa nya lcibs 'dra ba zhig ste /
analyzed: nya lcibs dang nya tshang dag chu nas bton pa ni de nyid do zhes bya ba ni / nya tshang ni chu'i rtsa nya lcibs 'dra ba zhig ste /
translated: The eggs and the fish-trap are just as they are in the water.🔽The fish-trap is a water plant that resembles a fish-trap.

original: nya lcibs dang nya tshang dag chu nas bton pa ni de nyid de bton pa nyid do //
analyzed: nya lcibs dang nya tshang dag chu nas bton pa ni de nyid de bton pa nyid do //
translated: The eggs and the fish-trap are just as they are in the water.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: nya lcibs dang / nya tshang dag chu nas bton par gyur na skyer rung ba'i chos nyid yin du zin kyang de dag bton pa na bcad pa nyid yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: nya lcibs dang / nya tshang dag chu nas bton par gyur na skyer rung ba'i chos nyid yin du zin kyang de dag bton pa na bcad pa nyid yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Even though the eggs and the fish-trap are by nature suitable for growth when they are taken out of the water, when they are taken out, they should be understood to be cut.

original: kha na ma tho ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The complete offense is incurred.

original: tshi gu ma bcem par ril mid byed pa ni phyed do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshi gu ma bcem par ril mid byed pa ni phyed do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one swallows a pill without breaking the container, it is half.

original: rgya shug gi tshi gu dang / kham tshigs dang / star ga dang / 'bra go'i rus ba la sogs pa'i tshi gu so dag gis ma bcem ma dkrum par ril mid du gra rdeg byed pa ni sa bon nyams par bya ba'i bya ba byed pa yin pas de ni phyed de nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgya shug gi tshi gu dang / kham tshigs dang / star ga dang / 'bra go'i rus ba la sogs pa'i tshi gu so dag gis ma bcem ma dkrum par ril mid du gra rdeg byed pa ni sa bon nyams par bya ba'i bya ba byed pa yin pas de ni phyed de nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The seeds of jujube, sesame, and so on, and the seeds of grapes, bamboo, and so on, if the seeds are not crushed or broken, but are swallowed whole, then this is the action of destroying seeds. Therefore, it is said that this is a half-transgression, meaning it is a minor offense.

original: thams cad du yang ltung ba'i skabs nas phyed ces bya ba'i tshig smos pa ni nyes byas yin par go bar byed do //
analyzed: thams cad du yang ltung ba'i skabs nas phyed ces bya ba'i tshig smos pa ni nyes byas yin par go bar byed do //
translated: In all cases, the word half in the context of a downfall indicates that it is a minor offense.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis rgya shug gi tshi gu ma bcem par ril mid bgyid na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong gis rgya shug gi tshi gu ma bcem par ril mid bgyid na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: Here, the text says, Venerable, if a monk swallows a jujube seed whole without crushing it, what downfall does he incur?

original: nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽gal te 'di bcad par gyur na legs so zhes smras na bton pa'i 'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no // gal te 'di bcad par gyur na legs so zhes smras na bton pa'i 'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is a minor offense.🔽If someone were to cut down this tree, it would be good.

original: dge slong gis gal te shing ljon pa 'di la la zhig gis bcad par gyur na legs so //
analyzed: dge slong gis gal te shing ljon pa 'di la la zhig gis bcad par gyur na legs so //
translated: If a monk were to say, If someone were to cut down this tree, it would be good,
