original: stes so zhes bya ba smras na gzhogs kyis bcol ba de'i tshe na sngar bton pa zhes bya ba dngos gzhir bshad pa de'i phyed de sbyor ba'i nyes byas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: stes so zhes bya ba smras na gzhogs kyis bcol ba de'i tshe na sngar bton pa zhes bya ba dngos gzhir bshad pa de'i phyed de sbyor ba'i nyes byas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If he says, “By chance,” and then cuts it, it is a serious offense at the time of the first blow, and it is explained that the first blow is the actual basis. The second blow is a serious offense, and it is called a “secondary offense.”

original: gzhi de las bcad par gyur na ni mtha'i dngos gzhi nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhi de las bcad par gyur na ni mtha'i dngos gzhi nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: If he cuts it from that basis, it should be understood that it is the actual basis of the second blow.

original: 'dir @272b gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa dge slong gis 'di skad ces 'dis shing ljon pa 'di bcad bar gyur na legs so stes so zhes mchi zhing des de 'gums par bgyid na ltung ba cir 'gyur nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir @272b gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa dge slong gis 'di skad ces 'dis shing ljon pa 'di bcad bar gyur na legs so stes so zhes mchi zhing des de 'gums par bgyid na ltung ba cir 'gyur nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text of the Vinaya says, “Venerables, if a monk says, ‘It would be good if this tree were cut down by chance,’ and if he causes it to be cut down, what is the offense?’ ‘It is a minor offense.’”

original: rdzu 'phrul gyis ni ma byas pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyis ni ma byas pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not an actual basis if it is done by supernatural power.

original: dge slong gis rdzu 'phrul gyis shing ljon pa 'di gcod par byed na ltung ba ma byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: dge slong gis rdzu 'phrul gyis shing ljon pa 'di gcod par byed na ltung ba ma byas pa nyid do //
translated: If a monk cuts down a tree by supernatural power, it is not an actual basis of a downfall.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa dge slong gis rdzu 'phrul gyis shing ljon pa 'gums par mos par bgyid na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa dge slong gis rdzu 'phrul gyis shing ljon pa 'gums par mos par bgyid na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: Here the text is: “If a monk, intending to kill a tree by supernatural power, would he commit an offense?”

original: nye ba 'khor ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽sa bon la sa bon gzhan nyid du 'du shes pa ni de dang 'dra ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no // sa bon la sa bon gzhan nyid du 'du shes pa ni de dang 'dra ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Upāli, he would not commit an offense.”🔽The perception of a seed as something other than a seed is similar to it.

original: sdong bu ni sdong bu'i sa bon la sogs pa la rtsa ba'i sa bon nyid du 'du shes pa ni de dang 'dra ba nyid do //
analyzed: sdong bu ni sdong bu'i sa bon la sogs pa la rtsa ba'i sa bon nyid du 'du shes pa ni de dang 'dra ba nyid do //
translated: The perception of a sprout as a seed, etc., is similar to it.

original: sdong bu'i sa bon la sogs pa dang 'dra ba nyid de phyed nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: sdong bu'i sa bon la sogs pa dang 'dra ba nyid de phyed nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is similar to a seed, etc., but it is not half of it.

original: de bzhin du skye ba la sa bon du 'du shes pa yang skye ba dang 'dra ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du skye ba la sa bon du 'du shes pa yang skye ba dang 'dra ba nyid yin la /
translated: Similarly, the perception of arising as a seed is similar to arising.

original: sa bon la skye bar 'du shes pa yang sa bon dang 'dra ba nyid de phyed nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: sa bon la skye bar 'du shes pa yang sa bon dang 'dra ba nyid de phyed nyid ma yin te /
translated: The perception of a seed as arising is similar to a seed. It is not half of it.

original: thams cad la sa bon la sogs pa nyams par bya ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad la sa bon la sogs pa nyams par bya ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all seeds, etc., are destroyed.

original: dge slong sa bon la sogs pa nyams par bya ba'i 'du shes yod na bzlog pa'i bsam pas nyams par byed du zin kyang dngos gzhi kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong sa bon la sogs pa nyams par bya ba'i 'du shes yod na bzlog pa'i bsam pas nyams par byed du zin kyang dngos gzhi kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If a fully ordained monk has the perception that seeds and so on are to be destroyed and he destroys them with the intention to do so, then he commits the actual basis alone.

original: shun pa dang phri dang 'dab ma skya bo dang me tog kha bye ba dang 'bras bu smin pa rnams ni phyed shi ba nyid du rjes su tha snyad gdags so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shun pa dang phri dang 'dab ma skya bo dang me tog kha bye ba dang 'bras bu smin pa rnams ni phyed shi ba nyid du rjes su tha snyad gdags so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The bark, the sap, the yellow leaves, the opened flowers and the ripe fruit are called half dead.

original: shun pa dang phri dang 'dab ma skya bo dang / me tog kha bye ba dang 'bras bu smin pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te ;
analyzed: shun pa dang phri dang 'dab ma skya bo dang / me tog kha bye ba dang 'bras bu smin pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te ;
translated: The bark, the sap, the yellow leaves, the opened flowers and the ripe fruit are called half dead.🔽Since these are renowned in the world as half dead, here they are called half dead in accordance with that renown.

original: de rnams ni phyed shi ba nyid du 'jig rten na grags pa yin pas 'dir yang grags pa de'i rjes su phyed shi ba nyid ces bya bar tha snyad gdags te phyed shi ba nyid de dag bshig cing nyams par byas pa la ni nyes byas su 'gyur
analyzed: de rnams ni phyed shi ba nyid du 'jig rten na grags pa yin pas 'dir yang grags pa de'i rjes su phyed shi ba nyid ces bya bar tha snyad gdags te phyed shi ba nyid de dag bshig cing nyams par byas pa la ni nyes byas su 'gyur
translated: If one destroys and damages them, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: ro // de dag gi rtsa bar gyur pa rang bzhin las ma bye ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: ro // de dag gi rtsa bar gyur pa rang bzhin las ma bye ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: They are not unseparated from the root, which is the actual basis.

original: shun pa la sogs pa de dag gi rtsa bar gyur pa gang yin pa dngos kyi rang bzhin las gal te ma bye ba ma bral ba yin na de dag gi rtsa bar gyur pa rang bzhin las ma bye ma bral ba de ni phyed shi ba de
analyzed: shun pa la sogs pa de dag gi rtsa bar gyur pa gang yin pa dngos kyi rang bzhin las gal te ma bye ba ma bral ba yin na de dag gi rtsa bar gyur pa rang bzhin las ma bye ma bral ba de ni phyed shi ba de
translated: If the root of those such as the bark is unseparated or not divorced from the actual basis, then the root of those is unseparated or not divorced from the actual basis.

original: nyid du rjes su tha snyad gdags pa ma yin te /🔽de dag phyogs de nas phye zhing phral na dngos gzhi @273a * //
analyzed: nyid du rjes su tha snyad gdags pa ma yin te / de dag phyogs de nas phye zhing phral na dngos gzhi @273a * //
translated: That is not designated as the same as the half dead.

original: kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are separated and removed from that place, they become the actual basis.

original: 'dir shun pa'i gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir shun pa'i gzhung ni /
translated: Here, the text on bark states:

original: shun pa 'chu bar byed na snying po dang 'brel pa 'chu bar byed na ni ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shun pa 'chu bar byed na snying po dang 'brel pa 'chu bar byed na ni ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If you peel the bark, if it is connected to the core, then it is a downfall.

original: snying po dang ma 'brel pa 'chu bar byed na ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: snying po dang ma 'brel pa 'chu bar byed na ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: If it is not connected to the core, then it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: phri dang 'dab ma skya po dang / me tog kha bye ba dang / 'bras bu smin pa rnams la yang 'di nyid rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: phri dang 'dab ma skya po dang / me tog kha bye ba dang / 'bras bu smin pa rnams la yang 'di nyid rnam par gzhag go //
translated: This is also the case for the roots, stems, leaves, flowers, and fruits.

original: de la me tog dang 'bras bu rnams kyi rtsa ba dag dang / chu ba ni de dag nyid dang lhan cig chos mtshungs pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de la me tog dang 'bras bu rnams kyi rtsa ba dag dang / chu ba ni de dag nyid dang lhan cig chos mtshungs pa nyid yin te /
translated: The roots and stems of flowers and fruits are similar to them in terms of their characteristics.

original: smin pa rnams kyi ni smin pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: smin pa rnams kyi ni smin pa nyid yin la /
translated: Those that are ripe are ripe.

original: ma smin pa rnams kyi ni ma smin pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: ma smin pa rnams kyi ni ma smin pa nyid yin te /
translated: Those that are not ripe are not ripe.

original: de dag nyid kyi phyogs gcig tu gyur pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi phyogs gcig tu gyur pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: You should understand that they are a part of them.

original: me tog gi chu ba ni me tog nyid kyi khongs su gtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: me tog gi chu ba ni me tog nyid kyi khongs su gtogs pa yin la /
translated: The stems of flowers are included in the flowers themselves.

original: rtsa ba dag ni de'i rtsa ba las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba dag ni de'i rtsa ba las rig par bya'o //
translated: The roots are to be understood as the roots of those.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: zhu ba las cig car 'byung ste /🔽chu ba gcod na nyes byas so //
analyzed: zhu ba las cig car 'byung ste / chu ba gcod na nyes byas so //
translated: “When they are cut, they grow back immediately.🔽If you cut the stems, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: pha bong gi dreg pa las 'chu na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: pha bong gi dreg pa las 'chu na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If you cut the bark, it is an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: 'dir chu ba zhes bya ba'i sgras ni autpa la la sogs pa kha bye ba'i chu ba dang 'dab ma'i chu ba bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir chu ba zhes bya ba'i sgras ni autpa la la sogs pa kha bye ba'i chu ba dang 'dab ma'i chu ba bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the term “stalk” should be understood to include the stalk of an open lotus flower, etc., and the stalk of a leaf.

original: 'dir pha bong gi dreg pa zhes bya ba ni rdo'i dreg pa yin par rig par bya'i sru sru ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir pha bong gi dreg pa zhes bya ba ni rdo'i dreg pa yin par rig par bya'i sru sru ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, the term “sediment of stone” should be understood to mean the sediment of rock, not the sediment of a woman.

original: sa bon gyi khams btab pa la rtsa ba ma skyes pa ni phyed skyes pa nyid du'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sa bon gyi khams btab pa la rtsa ba ma skyes pa ni phyed skyes pa nyid du'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The seed element that has been planted, but the root of which has not yet arisen, is considered to be half-arisen.

original: sa bon gyi khams btab pa la da dung rtsa ba ma skyes pa lhag lhog tsam du rtsabs su gyur pa ni phyed skyes pa nyid du rjes su tha snyad gdags te /
analyzed: sa bon gyi khams btab pa la da dung rtsa ba ma skyes pa lhag lhog tsam du rtsabs su gyur pa ni phyed skyes pa nyid du rjes su tha snyad gdags te /
translated: The seed element that has been planted, but the root of which has not yet arisen, but which has become a sprout, is considered to be half-arisen.

original: de la ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The offense is a minor offense.

original: sa 'bus pa dang / sha mo dang / sha bal dang / snod dang gos la sogs pa'i rlam rnams ni byed skyes pa nyid du'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sa 'bus pa dang / sha mo dang / sha bal dang / snod dang gos la sogs pa'i rlam rnams ni byed skyes pa nyid du'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The sprouts of the earth, mushrooms, moss, and the like, as well as vessels, clothing, and so on, are considered to be fully arisen.

original: rjes su tha snyad gdags so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rjes su tha snyad gdags so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The offense is a serious offense.

original: sa 'bus pa dang / sha mo dang / sha bal dang / snod kyi rlam dang / gos kyi rlam dang / sogs pa'i sgras khur ba la sogs pa'i rlam bsdus te /🔽de rnams ni phyed skyes pa nyid du rjes su tha snyad gdags te /🔽de dag bshig cing nyams par byas na nyes byas so //🔽'u sha'i khu tshan la sogs pa dbo ba dang / 'chag pa dang / yal ga la sogs pa 'dres ba dang / dkyil 'khor dang / skyang nul dang / de dag gi bsam pa nyid @273b la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sa 'bus pa dang / sha mo dang / sha bal dang / snod kyi rlam dang / gos kyi rlam dang / sogs pa'i sgras khur ba la sogs pa'i rlam bsdus te / de rnams ni phyed skyes pa nyid du rjes su tha snyad gdags te / de dag bshig cing nyams par byas na nyes byas so // 'u sha'i khu tshan la sogs pa dbo ba dang / 'chag pa dang / yal ga la sogs pa 'dres ba dang / dkyil 'khor dang / skyang nul dang / de dag gi bsam pa nyid @273b la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The etc. includes the value of the field, the value of the cloth, the value of the vessel, the value of the garment, and so forth.🔽These are designated as half-born.🔽If one destroys or damages them, it is an offense of wrong conduct.🔽There is no offense if one digs up the roots of grass and so forth, or if one breaks branches and so forth, or if one draws a mandala or smears it with cow dung, or if one has the intention to do these things.🔽🔽

original: 'u sha'i khu tshan la sogs pa'i sngo'i steng du 'bo na dbo ba la sogs pa'i bsam pa nyid la ni ltung ba med do //🔽de bzhin du 'chag pa la sogs pa dag la yang 'chag pa la sogs pa'i bsam pa nyid la ni ltung ba med do //

original: sdo la sogs pa gzhig cing nyams par bya ba'i bsam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdo la sogs pa gzhig cing nyams par bya ba'i bsam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no intention to destroy or damage the grass, etc.

original: phongs pa'i tshe rtsva ku sha la sogs pas bcings pa des mi thar na bcad na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phongs pa'i tshe rtsva ku sha la sogs pas bcings pa des mi thar na bcad na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: When in distress, if one is bound by kusha grass, etc., there is no offense if one cuts it in order to escape.

original: rtsva ku sha la sogs pa bcad na yang ltung ba med do //
analyzed: rtsva ku sha la sogs pa bcad na yang ltung ba med do //
translated: If one cuts the kusha grass, etc., there is no offense.

original: gang gi tshe zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhe na /
translated: When?

original: de'i phyir phongs pa'i tshe zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir phongs pa'i tshe zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “when in distress.”

original: phongs pa'i dus kyi tshe'o //
analyzed: phongs pa'i dus kyi tshe'o //
translated: When in a time of distress.

original: phongs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phongs pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show distress,

original: rtsva ku sha la sogs pas bcings pa zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rtsva ku sha la sogs pas bcings pa zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said, “if one is bound by kusha grass, etc.”

original: gal te dge slong rtsva ku sha la sogs pa des bcings pa'o //
analyzed: gal te dge slong rtsva ku sha la sogs pa des bcings pa'o //
translated: If a bhikṣu is bound by kusha grass, etc.

original: dge slong gang gis bcad na ltung ba med ce na /
analyzed: dge slong gang gis bcad na ltung ba med ce na /
translated: By which bhikṣu is it cut? There is no offense.

original: de'i phyir des zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir des zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “by that.”

original: rtsva ku sha la sogs pas bdag nyid bcings pa'i dge slong des so //
analyzed: rtsva ku sha la sogs pas bdag nyid bcings pa'i dge slong des so //
translated: By that bhikṣu who is bound by kusha grass, etc. himself.

original: ci gnas skabs thams cad du ltung ba med dam zhe na /
analyzed: ci gnas skabs thams cad du ltung ba med dam zhe na /
translated: Is there no offense in all circumstances?

original: ma yin te de'i phyir mi thar na zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ma yin te de'i phyir mi thar na zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: No, it is said, “if he is not freed by that means.”

original: gal te thabs gzhan gang gis kyang mi thar na'o //
analyzed: gal te thabs gzhan gang gis kyang mi thar na'o //
translated: If he is not freed by any other means.

original: de ltar ji skad du bstan pa'i rnam pa de lta bus phongs pa'i tshe dge slong gis rtsva ku sha la sogs pa bcad na yang ltung ba med do //
analyzed: de ltar ji skad du bstan pa'i rnam pa de lta bus phongs pa'i tshe dge slong gis rtsva ku sha la sogs pa bcad na yang ltung ba med do //
translated: Thus, when in such a situation as has been described, a monk cuts kusha grass, etc., there is no offense.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught.

original: gal te chom rkun pa dag gis rtsva ku sha la sogs pa drung ma phyung ba dge slong bcings par gyur la /
analyzed: gal te chom rkun pa dag gis rtsva ku sha la sogs pa drung ma phyung ba dge slong bcings par gyur la /
translated: If thieves have not pulled up kusha grass, etc., and a monk is bound by them,

original: thar pa'i thabs gzhan 'ga' yang med na /
analyzed: thar pa'i thabs gzhan 'ga' yang med na /
translated: and there is no other means of escape,

original: dge slong bcings pa des rtsva ku sha la sogs pa bcad na yang ltung ba med do //
analyzed: dge slong bcings pa des rtsva ku sha la sogs pa bcad na yang ltung ba med do //
translated: then that bound monk cuts the kusha grass, etc., and there is no offense.

original: gal te rtsva ku sha dag gis dge slong mang po dag bcings par gyur na ci de'i tshe thams cad kyis gcad par bya'am zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rtsva ku sha dag gis dge slong mang po dag bcings par gyur na ci de'i tshe thams cad kyis gcad par bya'am zhe na /
translated: If many monks are bound by kusha grass, etc., should they all cut it at that time?

original: ma yin te de'i phyir du ma nyid yin na de las gzhan gcig gis so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ma yin te de'i phyir du ma nyid yin na de las gzhan gcig gis so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: No, it is said, “if it is not for that purpose, then another of them should.”

original: dge slong bcings pa du ma nyid yin na mi thar pa de las dge slong gcig gis gcad par bya zhing des gzhan yang dgrol bar bya'i /
analyzed: dge slong bcings pa du ma nyid yin na mi thar pa de las dge slong gcig gis gcad par bya zhing des gzhan yang dgrol bar bya'i /
translated: If there are many monks who are bound, then one monk should cut the rope, and he should free the others.

original: thams cad kyis gcad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyis gcad par mi bya'o //
translated: But all should not cut it.

original: sa bon gyi chos med pa ni nyes pa med pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sa bon gyi chos med pa ni nyes pa med pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The absence of the nature of seed is not a fault.

original: rung ba lnga po phyung ba dang / dkrum pa dang / bkas pa dang / gcad pa dang / sa bon gyi chos nyid med pa @274a * //
analyzed: rung ba lnga po phyung ba dang / dkrum pa dang / bkas pa dang / gcad pa dang / sa bon gyi chos nyid med pa @274a * //
translated: The five permitted actions are: uprooting, cutting, burning, chopping, and the absence of the nature of seed.

original: ni lnga pa yin te /
analyzed: ni lnga pa yin te /
translated: The fifth is the absence of the nature of seed.

original: rung ba lnga po de bsdu ba'i phyir mdo 'di byas so //
analyzed: rung ba lnga po de bsdu ba'i phyir mdo 'di byas so //
translated: This sūtra was composed in order to include these five permitted actions.

original: gang la sa bon gyi chos nyid med pa de ni nyams par byas kyang nyes par byed pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gang la sa bon gyi chos nyid med pa de ni nyams par byas kyang nyes par byed pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: That which lacks the nature of seed is not a fault even if it is damaged.

original: dper na ga gon la sogs pa sa bon du ma red pa nyid dag lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na ga gon la sogs pa sa bon du ma red pa nyid dag lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the bamboo and so on, which are not seeds.

original: mes reg pa dang mtshon dang sen mo dang ne tso dag gis rma phyung ba dang / rnying pa dang / phyur ba dang / dkrum pa dang / bkas pa dang / bcad pa lta bu dag ni rung ba'o zhes bya ba ni dgu po de dag ni rung ba ste /
analyzed: mes reg pa dang mtshon dang sen mo dang ne tso dag gis rma phyung ba dang / rnying pa dang / phyur ba dang / dkrum pa dang / bkas pa dang / bcad pa lta bu dag ni rung ba'o zhes bya ba ni dgu po de dag ni rung ba ste /
translated: The nine types of fruit that are suitable to be eaten are those that are touched by fire, cut by a knife, cut by a fingernail, pecked by a parrot, old, rotten, broken, split, or cut.

original: mes reg pa zhes bya ba ni shing tog la sogs pa mes reg par byas pa'o //
analyzed: mes reg pa zhes bya ba ni shing tog la sogs pa mes reg par byas pa'o //
translated: “Touched by fire” means fruit that has been touched by fire.

original: mtshon gyis rma phyung ba dang / sen mos rma phyung ba dang / ne tso dag gis rma phyung ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshon gyis rma phyung ba dang / sen mos rma phyung ba dang / ne tso dag gis rma phyung ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Cut by a knife,” “cut by a fingernail,” and “pecked by a parrot” means

original: shing tog la sogs pa de dag gis rma phyung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: shing tog la sogs pa de dag gis rma phyung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: fruit that has been cut by these.

original: 'dir mtshon la sogs pa smos pa ni mtshon pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: 'dir mtshon la sogs pa smos pa ni mtshon pa tsam du zad de /
translated: Here, the mention of a knife and so on is merely an illustration.

original: shing la sogs pas rma phyung ba gang yin pa yang rung ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: shing la sogs pas rma phyung ba gang yin pa yang rung ba kho na yin no //
translated: Any fruit that has been cut by a stick and so on is also suitable to be eaten.

original: rnying pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnying pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Old” means

original: rgun skam la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: rgun skam la sogs pa dag go //
translated: dried grapes and so on.

original: phyung ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyung ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Rotten” means

original: drung nas phyung ba ste /
analyzed: drung nas phyung ba ste /
translated: fruit that has become rotten from being stored for a long time.🔽“Broken” means fruit that has been broken by birds and so on.🔽“Split” means fruit that has split open by itself.🔽“Cut” means fruit that has been cut by a knife and so on.

original: dper na la phug la sogs pa rtsa thon du phyung ba lta bu dag ste /
analyzed: dper na la phug la sogs pa rtsa thon du phyung ba lta bu dag ste /
translated: For example, it is like a radish, etc., that has been pulled out by the root.

original: de ni brtag pa gzhan gyis rung bar bya ba la ltos mi dgos so //
analyzed: de ni brtag pa gzhan gyis rung bar bya ba la ltos mi dgos so //
translated: That does not need to depend on being made suitable by another examination.

original: dkrum ba zhes bya ba ni brdungs pa ste /
analyzed: dkrum ba zhes bya ba ni brdungs pa ste /
translated: That which is called crushed is pounded.

original: mchig la sogs pas sran ma la sogs pa phyed tshal du dkrum pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mchig la sogs pas sran ma la sogs pa phyed tshal du dkrum pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a bean, etc., that is crushed in half with a mortar, etc.

original: bkas pa zhes bya ba ni gas par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: bkas pa zhes bya ba ni gas par gyur pa ste /
translated: That which is called split is split.

original: de yang bal po se'u la sogs pa lta bu rang gas pa nyid gang yin pa de ni rung ba nyid ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de yang bal po se'u la sogs pa lta bu rang gas pa nyid gang yin pa de ni rung ba nyid ma yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, that which is itself split, like a mango, etc., is not suitable.

original: gzhan dag gis byas pa ni rung ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis byas pa ni rung ba nyid yin no //
translated: But that done by another is suitable.

original: gcad pa zhes bya ba ni brdas pa ste /
analyzed: gcad pa zhes bya ba ni brdas pa ste /
translated: That which is called cut is cut.

original: dper na lcang ma la sogs pa'i yal ga bcad zin pa de la so shing la sogs pa bya ba la brtag pa gzhan gyis rung bar bya mi dgos pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na lcang ma la sogs pa'i yal ga bcad zin pa de la so shing la sogs pa bya ba la brtag pa gzhan gyis rung bar bya mi dgos pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like a branch of bamboo, etc., that has already been cut. That does not need to be made suitable by another examination for use as a toothpick, etc.

original: rung ba byed pa ni sa bon ma yin pa nyid du gyur gyi bar du ltos par bya mi dgos pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rung ba byed pa ni sa bon ma yin pa nyid du gyur gyi bar du ltos par bya mi dgos pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not necessary to wait until it is fit, until it is not a seed.

original: brtag pas rung bar byed pa ni ji srid du sa bon ma yin pa nyid du gyur gyi bar de srid du de la bsdad par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: brtag pas rung bar byed pa ni ji srid du sa bon ma yin pa nyid du gyur gyi bar de srid du de la bsdad par mi bya ba'o //
translated: One should not wait until it is not a seed, until it is fit by the test.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: mon sran sde'u la sogs pa dag me la sogs pa'i brtag pas rung bar bya'o zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mon sran sde'u la sogs pa dag me la sogs pa'i brtag pas rung bar bya'o zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching that peas, etc., are made fit by the test of fire, etc.,

original: ji srid du mon sran sde'u la sogs pa de dag sa bon ma yin pa nyid du gyur gyi bar de srid du brtag par mi bya ste /
analyzed: ji srid du mon sran sde'u la sogs pa de dag sa bon ma yin pa nyid du gyur gyi bar de srid du brtag par mi bya ste /
translated: means that one should not wait until they are not seeds, until they are fit by the test.

original: 'di ltar dge slong gis brtag pa yin pa'i phyir me la sogs pas reg pa tsam kho nas brtags shing rung ba yin @274b par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar dge slong gis brtag pa yin pa'i phyir me la sogs pas reg pa tsam kho nas brtags shing rung ba yin @274b par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be understood that the monk is made fit by the test of fire, etc., merely by the contact with fire, etc., because of the test.

original: 'di la rlangs pa ni me ma yin pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di la rlangs pa ni me ma yin pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, it is not the case that steam is not fire.

original: brtag pas rung bar bya ba 'di la rlangs pa ni me ma yin pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: brtag pas rung bar bya ba 'di la rlangs pa ni me ma yin pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: The steam is not not fire,

original: 'di ltar me nyid dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar me nyid dang 'dra'o //
translated: because it is like fire itself.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is the explanation.

original: brtag pas rung bar bya ba 'di la rlangs pas bdugs pa nyid kyang mes reg pa nyid dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: brtag pas rung bar bya ba 'di la rlangs pas bdugs pa nyid kyang mes reg pa nyid dang 'dra ste /
translated: The steam that moistens this food to be made suitable by heating is like the contact of fire.

original: 'di ltar me dang / rlangs pas reg na mon sran sde'u la sogs pa dag rung ba nyid du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar me dang / rlangs pas reg na mon sran sde'u la sogs pa dag rung ba nyid du gyur pa yin no //
translated: Because when it is touched by fire and steam, the beans and so on become suitable to eat.🔽Here, the text of those two sūtras states:

original: 'dir mdo de gnyis kyi gzhung ni dge slong dag sa bon gyi rigs mi tshos pa zhes bya ba yod pas de'i phyir rlangs pas brlan te bza' bar rjes su gnang gis 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir mdo de gnyis kyi gzhung ni dge slong dag sa bon gyi rigs mi tshos pa zhes bya ba yod pas de'i phyir rlangs pas brlan te bza' bar rjes su gnang gis 'di la 'gyod par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Monks, since there is a type of seed that is not destroyed by fire, therefore I allow you to eat food moistened by steam. Do not regret this.”

original: 'bras bu dag mes rung bar bya ba la spyi'i tshoms ni gtso cher bya ba yang dag pa'i grangs nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu dag mes rung bar bya ba la spyi'i tshoms ni gtso cher bya ba yang dag pa'i grangs nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The general rule is that the fruit is made suitable by fire.

original: rgun 'bru la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dag me'i brtag pas rung bar bya ba la spyi'i tshoms spyi bungs su bcer ba ni gtso cher bya ba gtso bor bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: rgun 'bru la sogs pa'i 'bras bu dag me'i brtag pas rung bar bya ba la spyi'i tshoms spyi bungs su bcer ba ni gtso cher bya ba gtso bor bstan pa yin te /
translated: The general rule that grapes and so on are purified by fire is taught as the primary rule, because the general rule is applied to the individual.

original: de ni yang dag pa yin pa'i grangs nyid du 'gro bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa yin pa'i grangs nyid du 'gro bar rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as the number of correct applications.

original: 'di ltar spyi la rung bar byas na /
analyzed: 'di ltar spyi la rung bar byas na /
translated: Thus, when the general rule is applied,

original: de'i yan lag thams cad du rung ba nyid yin par yid la snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yan lag thams cad du rung ba nyid yin par yid la snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it is understood that all its parts are purified.🔽Here is the text:🔽“Monks, since you are delayed by purifying each fruit individually,

original: 'dir gzhung ni 'di ltar dge slong dag 'bras bu rnams re re nas rung bar byed pas ring du thogs pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni 'di ltar dge slong dag 'bras bu rnams re re nas rung bar byed pas ring du thogs pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: the Blessed One said:

original: phung por byas nas mes gnas gnyis sam gsum dag tu reg par byas na thams cad du rung ba nyid do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: phung por byas nas mes gnas gnyis sam gsum dag tu reg par byas na thams cad du rung ba nyid do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: ‘If you make a pile and touch it with fire in two or three places, it is all purified.’”

original: phyogs gcig nas ni spyi'i rung ba mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyogs gcig nas ni spyi'i rung ba mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Purification of the general rule does not occur from one part.

original: mes phyogs gcig nas reg pa la ni phung po thams cad kyi spyi'i brtag par byas pa zhes bya ba'i rung ba mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mes phyogs gcig nas reg pa la ni phung po thams cad kyi spyi'i brtag par byas pa zhes bya ba'i rung ba mi 'byung ngo //
translated: When it is touched by fire on one side, the general examination of all the heaps is not suitable.

original: 'dis ni de lta bas nas spyi ngos thams cad la mes phyogs gnyis sam gsum dag tu reg par bya'o zhes gsungs pa de bsdus pa yin no //🔽dge slong gis rung ba dag byas pa nyid ni byas pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dis ni de lta bas nas spyi ngos thams cad la mes phyogs gnyis sam gsum dag tu reg par bya'o zhes gsungs pa de bsdus pa yin no // dge slong gis rung ba dag byas pa nyid ni byas pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, this is the summary of the statement that fire should touch two or three sides of the general examination.🔽The monk’s examination is just the examination.

original: dge slong gis brtags pas rung ba dag byas pa ni /🔽dge slong gis rung ba dag byas pa ste /
analyzed: dge slong gis brtags pas rung ba dag byas pa ni / dge slong gis rung ba dag byas pa ste /
translated: The monk’s examination is the monk’s examination.

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
translated: The monk’s examination is just the monk’s examination.

original: de la ni mes rung bar byas bam gtogs pa gzhan gyis rung bar byas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la ni mes rung bar byas bam gtogs pa gzhan gyis rung bar byas pa nyid yin no //
translated: In that case, it is just the examination by fire, not the other examinations.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis zhugs kyis sam sen mos sam mtshon gyis sa bon gyi rigs lnga po dag rung bar bgyis pa zhes bgyi 'am nye ba @275a * //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis zhugs kyis sam sen mos sam mtshon gyis sa bon gyi rigs lnga po dag rung bar bgyis pa zhes bgyi 'am nye ba @275a * //
translated: Here is the text: “Venerable, is it said that the monk’s examination is the five types of seeds examined by fire, by nails, or by weapons?”

original: 'khor rung bar byas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'khor rung bar byas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called “making suitable.

original: nye ba 'khor mes rung bar byas pa ma gtogs pa lhag ma rnams bzar rung ste /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor mes rung bar byas pa ma gtogs pa lhag ma rnams bzar rung ste /
translated: ” Upāli, except for making suitable by fire, the remainder is suitable to eat.

original: bza' bar bya ba dag yin no //
analyzed: bza' bar bya ba dag yin no //
translated: It is suitable to eat.

original: gang rung bar byed na sa bon gyi tshogs 'jig pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang rung bar byed na sa bon gyi tshogs 'jig pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one makes suitable, there is an offense of wrongdoing for destroying the collection of seeds.

original: gang rung bar byed na zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni 'dir rung bar byed pa ni 'byung po'i tshogs 'jig par byed pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang rung bar byed na zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni 'dir rung bar byed pa ni 'byung po'i tshogs 'jig par byed pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The words “if one makes suitable” indicate that here, making suitable is understood to be the destruction of the collection of life.

original: de lta ma yin du zin na sa bon gyi tshogs 'jig pa las ltung byed kyi tshig tu mi gsung bar nyes byas su gsungs pa'i rigs na de skad ma gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta ma yin du zin na sa bon gyi tshogs 'jig pa las ltung byed kyi tshig tu mi gsung bar nyes byas su gsungs pa'i rigs na de skad ma gsungs so //
translated: If that were not so, then it would be reasonable to say that the offense is wrong conduct, not an offense for destroying the collection of seeds, but it does not say that.

original: 'dir nye ba 'khor mas rung bar byas pa ma gtogs pa zhes gsungs pa des ni mes rung bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir nye ba 'khor mas rung bar byas pa ma gtogs pa zhes gsungs pa des ni mes rung bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the words “except for making suitable by fire” indicate that one should make suitable by fire.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If that were not so,

original: de'i phyir mdo de ni dge slong gis btsos pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo de ni dge slong gis btsos pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: then that sūtra would be from the perspective of a monk who cooks.

original: de mi bza' ba nyid bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de mi bza' ba nyid bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this is taught to be not to be eaten.

original: sa rung ba ma yin par yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sa rung ba ma yin par yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Also on an unsuitable surface.

original: rung ba'i khang pa ma yin pa'i sa rung ba ma yin par 'bru la sogs pa gzhag ste /
analyzed: rung ba'i khang pa ma yin pa'i sa rung ba ma yin par 'bru la sogs pa gzhag ste /
translated: On a surface that is not a suitable place, such as a house that is not suitable, grains and so on are placed.

original: mes rung bar byas pa gang yin pa de yang rung bar byas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: mes rung bar byas pa gang yin pa de yang rung bar byas pa nyid yin no //
translated: That which is made suitable by fire is also made suitable.

original: zhag bdun pa dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba chu grang mos ma gtor bar bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhag bdun pa dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba chu grang mos ma gtor bar bza' bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not eat the seven-day medicine and the lifetime medicine without sprinkling them with cold water.

original: de rung bar bya ba dang 'brel ba yin pas 'dir mdor bris te /
analyzed: de rung bar bya ba dang 'brel ba yin pas 'dir mdor bris te /
translated: Since this is connected with making suitable, it is written here in brief.

original: sman zhag bdun pa dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba dag chu grang mos ma btab ma gtor bar bza' bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: sman zhag bdun pa dang / 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba dag chu grang mos ma btab ma gtor bar bza' bar mi bya'o //
translated: The seven-day medicine and the lifetime medicine should not be eaten without sprinkling them with cold water.

original: rung bar bya ba ni gang gis dus su byas kyang rung ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: rung bar bya ba ni gang gis dus su byas kyang rung ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: Making suitable means that if done at the proper time, it is suitable.

original: bza' ba'i dus kho nar bya ba ni ma nges so //
analyzed: bza' ba'i dus kho nar bya ba ni ma nges so //
translated: But it is not certain that it should be done only at the time of eating.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa btung ba brgyad po tso tsa'i 'bras bu las byung ba dang / chu shing gi 'bras bu las byung ba dang / rgya shug las byung ba dang / 'bra go las byung ba dang / rtsub 'gyur las byung ba dang /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa btung ba brgyad po tso tsa'i 'bras bu las byung ba dang / chu shing gi 'bras bu las byung ba dang / rgya shug las byung ba dang / 'bra go las byung ba dang / rtsub 'gyur las byung ba dang /
translated: “Are the eight types of beverages, which are made from the fruit of the jujube tree, the fruit of the plantain tree, jujube, grapes, pomegranates,

original: rgun dang au dum b'a ra las byung ba dang / n+ya gro dha las byung ba dang / khyab gnas las byung ba gang dag lags pa de dag rtsa ba'i khu ba'am /🔽sdong bu'i khu ba'am /
analyzed: rgun dang au dum b'a ra las byung ba dang / n+ya gro dha las byung ba dang / khyab gnas las byung ba gang dag lags pa de dag rtsa ba'i khu ba'am / sdong bu'i khu ba'am /
translated: dates, udumbara fruit, or nyagrodha fruit, suitable to drink if they are mixed with the juice of their roots,🔽the juice of their trunks,

original: 'dab ma'i khu ba'am /
analyzed: 'dab ma'i khu ba'am /
translated: the juice of their leaves,

original: me tog gi khu ba dang bsres shing sbyar na 'tshal du rung ngam /
analyzed: me tog gi khu ba dang bsres shing sbyar na 'tshal du rung ngam /
translated: or the juice of their flowers?”

original: gal te mi skyur ba dang myos bar mi 'gyur ba dang / mi bska ba dag yin na btung du rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te mi skyur ba dang myos bar mi 'gyur ba dang / mi bska ba dag yin na btung du rung ngo //
translated: “If they are not laxatives, intoxicants, or astringents, then they are suitable to drink.

original: de las lhag pa chus btab pa dag ni zhag bdun pa'am /
analyzed: de las lhag pa chus btab pa dag ni zhag bdun pa'am /
translated: If they are mixed with water, then they are suitable to drink for seven days.

original: 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba dag yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba dag yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Or they are suitable to drink for as long as one lives.”

original: thun tshod du rung ba yang des ma gtor bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thun tshod du rung ba yang des ma gtor bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Also, that which is suitable for seven days should not be drunk without sprinkling it with that.

original: thun tshod du rung ba'i rdzas @275b gro 'ja' la sogs pa yang chu grang mo des ma gtor ma btab par btung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: thun tshod du rung ba'i rdzas @275b gro 'ja' la sogs pa yang chu grang mo des ma gtor ma btab par btung bar mi bya'o //
translated: Also, substances suitable for seven days, such as molasses, should not be drunk without sprinkling them with cold water.

original: mar srub pa'i tshe dang 'bru mar 'tshor ba'i tshe na yang chu grang mos gdab dgos mod kyi /
analyzed: mar srub pa'i tshe dang 'bru mar 'tshor ba'i tshe na yang chu grang mos gdab dgos mod kyi /
translated: When churning butter or heating oil, one must sprinkle it with cold water.

original: 'on kyang de'i tshe na btab pa ni rung ma byas pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i tshe na btab pa ni rung ma byas pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: However, sprinkling at that time is not considered to be the act of rendering it suitable.

original: sbyor ba de ni ma grub pa'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽mar dang 'bru mar dag ni grub pa la rung bar bya bar bzhed do //
analyzed: sbyor ba de ni ma grub pa'i gnas skabs yin pa'i phyir ro // mar dang 'bru mar dag ni grub pa la rung bar bya bar bzhed do //
translated: Because that preparation is a stage of non-establishment.🔽It is accepted that butter and oil are rendered suitable for use when they are established.

original: bu ram yang mes bskol ba na chu grang mos gdab par bya ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: bu ram yang mes bskol ba na chu grang mos gdab par bya ba yin mod kyi /
translated: Also, when boiling molasses, one must sprinkle it with cold water.

original: de'i tshe chus btab pa des rung bar byas pa nyid du mi chud do //
analyzed: de'i tshe chus btab pa des rung bar byas pa nyid du mi chud do //
translated: However, sprinkling it at that time is not considered to be the act of rendering it suitable.

original: zhag bdun pa la ni mes rung bar bya ba mi srid de /
analyzed: zhag bdun pa la ni mes rung bar bya ba mi srid de /
translated: It is impossible to render suitable by fire for the seven-day medicine.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: The text says:

original: de nas spre'u de phyogs gcig tu song ste /
analyzed: de nas spre'u de phyogs gcig tu song ste /
translated: Then the monkey went to one side,

original: sprang rtsi'i lhung bzed de chu grang mos gtor nas bcom ldan 'das la phul ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis de bzhes te rung bar byas pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sprang rtsi'i lhung bzed de chu grang mos gtor nas bcom ldan 'das la phul ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis de bzhes te rung bar byas pa'i phyir ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: poured cold water into the begging bowl of molasses, and offered it to the Blessed One. The Blessed One accepted it and made it suitable.

original: de lta bas na thams cad du yang chu ni grang mo nyid yin par khas blang ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na thams cad du yang chu ni grang mo nyid yin par khas blang ngo //
translated: Therefore, in all cases, water is accepted as being cold.

original: sa bon dang skye ba 'jig pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: sa bon dang skye ba 'jig pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The downfalls of seeds and of birth have been explained.

original: // /'phya ba'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: // /'phya ba'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /
translated: The downfall of mockery is incurred when one wishes to speak

original: gang zag bcu gnyis po dag byed pa po nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gang zag bcu gnyis po dag byed pa po nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: and says that the twelve individuals are the agents.

original: 'phya ba'i ltung byed 'di la gnas khang bsko ba la sogs pa gang zag bcu gnyis po dag byed pa po dag yin te /
analyzed: 'phya ba'i ltung byed 'di la gnas khang bsko ba la sogs pa gang zag bcu gnyis po dag byed pa po dag yin te /
translated: In this downfall of mockery, the twelve individuals who assign the dwellings and so on are the agents.

original: de dag gi yul la 'phyan ltung byed 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi yul la 'phyan ltung byed 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The downfall is incurred when one speaks of their objects.

original: gang zag bcu gnyis po dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zag bcu gnyis po dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the twelve individuals?

original: gnas khang zas la bsko ba gnyis //🔽thug pa bag chos 'brim pa gnyis //🔽phran tshegs 'brim par byed pa dang // snod spyad 'brub dang gos kyi gnyis //
analyzed: gnas khang zas la bsko ba gnyis // thug pa bag chos 'brim pa gnyis // phran tshegs 'brim par byed pa dang // snod spyad 'brub dang gos kyi gnyis //
translated: Two are appointed to the dwelling and to food.🔽Two are appointed to distribute gruel and baked barley flour.🔽Two are appointed to distribute minor articles, to distribute vessels, and to distribute robes.🔽Two are appointed to distribute the rainy season retreat robes and to distribute the robes.

original: dbyar gyi ras chen sped dang 'ged //🔽mngag gzhug pa dang mdzes chos te //
analyzed: dbyar gyi ras chen sped dang 'ged // mngag gzhug pa dang mdzes chos te //
translated: Two are appointed to be messengers and to be the religious.

original: gang zag bcu dang gnyis po dag / ston pas yang dag bshad pa yin //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zag bcu dang gnyis po dag / ston pas yang dag bshad pa yin // zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The Teacher has correctly explained these ten and two individuals.

original: de dag ni dge 'dun gyi las byed pa bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i dpe tsam du zad kyi /
analyzed: de dag ni dge 'dun gyi las byed pa bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i dpe tsam du zad kyi /
translated: These are merely examples of fully ordained monks who perform the duties of the saṅgha.

original: 'dir shing tog 'brim pa la sogs pa dag kyang bsdu'o //
analyzed: 'dir shing tog 'brim pa la sogs pa dag kyang bsdu'o //
translated: Here, those who distribute fruit and so on are also included.

original: ma bskos pa dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba yang byed pa po nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ma bskos pa dag kyang ngo zhes bya ba yang byed pa po nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Those who are not appointed are also agents.

original: kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras ni /
analyzed: kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras ni /
translated: The word also includes

original: bskos pas dag kyang byed pa po nyid yin par bsdu'o //
analyzed: bskos pas dag kyang byed pa po nyid yin par bsdu'o //
translated: those who are appointed as agents.

original: 'di skad bstan te ;
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te ;
translated: This is taught.

original: gal te dge 'dun gyi las byed pa'i dge slong bskos kyang rung ma bskos kyang rung ba ste /
analyzed: gal te dge 'dun gyi las byed pa'i dge slong bskos kyang rung ma bskos kyang rung ba ste /
translated: Whether or not a monk has been appointed to do the work of the Saṅgha,

original: de la 'phya'am gzhogs 'phyas byed na ltung byed do //
analyzed: de la 'phya'am gzhogs 'phyas byed na ltung byed do //
translated: if one disparages or ridicules him, one commits an offense entailing confession.

original: sbyor ba dag bag yangs su byas pa yang ngo zhes bya ba yang byed pa po nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //🔽yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra ni sngar kyang ngo zhes smos pa'i rjes @276a * //
analyzed: sbyor ba dag bag yangs su byas pa yang ngo zhes bya ba yang byed pa po nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro // yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra ni sngar kyang ngo zhes smos pa'i rjes @276a * //
translated: “Also when the preparations have been made” also applies to “the one who does it.”

original: bsnyags pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bsnyags pa'i phyir te /
translated: The word “also” is used because it is a continuation of what was said above.

original: sbyor ba dag bag yangs su ma byas pa yang byed pa po nyid yin par bsdu'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba dag bag yangs su ma byas pa yang byed pa po nyid yin par bsdu'o //
translated: “Also when the preparations have not been made” is included in “the one who does it.”

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: dge 'dun gyis las kyi sbyor ba btang ba yang rung ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis las kyi sbyor ba btang ba yang rung ste /
translated: Whether or not the Saṅgha has made preparations for the work,

original: ma btang ba yang rung ste /
analyzed: ma btang ba yang rung ste /
translated: whether or not they have been made,

original: de la 'phya 'am gzhogs 'phyas byed na ltung byed do //
analyzed: de la 'phya 'am gzhogs 'phyas byed na ltung byed do //
translated: if one disparages or ridicules him, one commits an offense entailing confession.

original: 'dir mdo de gnyis kyi gzhung ni mdo snga ma ni gang zag bcu gnyis su ma bskos pa sbyor ba ma btang ba dag la 'phya ba dang gzhogs 'phyas byed na ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir mdo de gnyis kyi gzhung ni mdo snga ma ni gang zag bcu gnyis su ma bskos pa sbyor ba ma btang ba dag la 'phya ba dang gzhogs 'phyas byed na ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the text of those two sūtras is as follows: The former sūtra states: If one criticizes and slanders those who have not been appointed as one of the twelve types of monks and who have not given up their training, then one commits an offense.

original: mdo 'og ma shos kyi ni bskos pa sbyor ba btang ba dag la 'phya ba dang / gzhogs 'phyas byed na ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mdo 'og ma shos kyi ni bskos pa sbyor ba btang ba dag la 'phya ba dang / gzhogs 'phyas byed na ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The latter sūtra states: If one criticizes and slanders those who have been appointed and who have given up their training, then one commits an offense.

original: ci zhig rjes su sgrub na de dag byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig rjes su sgrub na de dag byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
translated: What is it that they accomplish that makes them agents?

original: de'i phyir bdag dang 'brel pa'i don gyis thos par 'phya 'ang rung zur gyis gzhogs 'phyas byed kyang rung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag dang 'brel pa'i don gyis thos par 'phya 'ang rung zur gyis gzhogs 'phyas byed kyang rung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said: “It is suitable to criticize what is heard and to slander indirectly, because of the meaning of being related to oneself.”

original: rung ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras kha gnyis su smos pa ni phyogs de gnyis gang byas kyang rung ngo zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rung ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras kha gnyis su smos pa ni phyogs de gnyis gang byas kyang rung ngo zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “suitable” is stated twice because it teaches that it is suitable to do either of those two.

original: bdag dang 'brel pa'i don gyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdag dang 'brel pa'i don gyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The meaning of being related to oneself is as follows.

original: bdag nyid kyi dgos pas 'phya 'am gzhogs 'phyas byed pa'o //🔽'dir gzhung ni gzhan gyi don du 'phya 'am /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi dgos pas 'phya 'am gzhogs 'phyas byed pa'o // 'dir gzhung ni gzhan gyi don du 'phya 'am /
translated: One mocks or sneers at another by means of one's own needs.

original: gzhogs 'phyas byed na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhogs 'phyas byed na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text says, If one mocks or sneers at another for the sake of another, then there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: thos par zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thos par zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One hears when one hears it with one's own ears.

original: ci nas kyang dpyas bya ba'i dge slong gis mngon sum du thos par 'gyur ba de ltar 'phya 'am gzhogs 'phyas byed pa'o //🔽'phya zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ci nas kyang dpyas bya ba'i dge slong gis mngon sum du thos par 'gyur ba de ltar 'phya 'am gzhogs 'phyas byed pa'o // 'phya zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One mocks or sneers at another by means of one's own needs, so that the monk who is being mocked hears it.

original: ming nas 'byin cing thos par dor 'phya ba'i rang bzhin go bar byed pa'o //🔽zur gyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ming nas 'byin cing thos par dor 'phya ba'i rang bzhin go bar byed pa'o // zur gyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One sneers at another by means of one's own needs, so that the monk who is being mocked hears it.

original: gang la dpyas bya ba de'i ming nas mi 'byin par 'phya ba ste /🔽kha cig 'di ltar byed do zhes zer ba'o //
analyzed: gang la dpyas bya ba de'i ming nas mi 'byin par 'phya ba ste / kha cig 'di ltar byed do zhes zer ba'o //
translated: One sneers at another by means of one's own needs, so that the monk who is being mocked hears it.🔽One sneers at another by means of one's own needs, so that the monk who is being mocked hears it.

original: gzhogs 'phyas zhes bya ba ni ming nas mi 'byin par gzhan la brjod pa'i tshul gyis thos par 'phya ba'i rang bzhin go bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhogs 'phyas zhes bya ba ni ming nas mi 'byin par gzhan la brjod pa'i tshul gyis thos par 'phya ba'i rang bzhin go bar byed pa'o //
translated: One sneers at another by means of one's own needs, so that the monk who is being mocked hears it.🔽One sneers at another by means of one's own needs, so that the monk who is being mocked hears it.🔽One sneers at another by means of one's own needs, so that the monk who is being mocked hears it.

original: 'phya ba dang gzhogs 'phyas byed pa de gnyis kyang gal te bskur bar gyur pa yin na /
analyzed: 'phya ba dang gzhogs 'phyas byed pa de gnyis kyang gal te bskur bar gyur pa yin na /
translated: If both the ridicule and the sidelong remarks are insults,🔽

original: de'i tshe kha na ma tho ba 'dir 'gyur gyi bden pa yin na ni mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gang zag yang ngo zhes bya ba yang nyes byas te /
