original: gang zag gis gnas mal bla gab med par gzhag pa char pa la sogs pas phan phun du gyur na de ltar na yang nyes byas kho na'o //
analyzed: gang zag gis gnas mal bla gab med par gzhag pa char pa la sogs pas phan phun du gyur na de ltar na yang nyes byas kho na'o //
translated: If a person sets up a bed or seat in the open air and it is damaged by rain, etc., then it is also an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las gang zag gi gnas mal yin la /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las gang zag gi gnas mal yin la /
translated: Here the text of the Questions of Upāli states:🔽“If it is a person’s bed or seat,

original: de dge slong gis 'ding du bcug nas dge slong 'dug pa la ma bcol bar de nas 'gro na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dge slong gis 'ding du bcug nas dge slong 'dug pa la ma bcol bar de nas 'gro na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If a fully ordained monk spreads it, and then leaves without asking a fully ordained monk who is staying there to guard it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de nyid bslab pa'i gzhi 'og ma bzhi la yang 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bslab pa'i gzhi 'og ma bzhi la yang 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To show that the same applies to the four lower rules of training,

original: 'og ma bzhi la yang ngo zhis bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'og ma bzhi la yang ngo zhis bya ba smras te /
translated: the text says, “The same applies to the four lower rules.”

original: bslab pa'i gzhi 'di'i 'og ma bslab pa'i gzhi bzhi po 'ding ba dang / skrod pa dang / phyis gnon 'byung ba dang / rtsa ba 'byung ba la 'dug pa zhes bya ba dag la yang gang zag gi gnas su ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi 'di'i 'og ma bslab pa'i gzhi bzhi po 'ding ba dang / skrod pa dang / phyis gnon 'byung ba dang / rtsa ba 'byung ba la 'dug pa zhes bya ba dag la yang gang zag gi gnas su ni nyes byas so //
translated: The four lower rules of training are spreading, expelling, stepping over, and roots.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las gang zag gis gtsug lag khang du 'ding na nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las gang zag gis gtsug lag khang du 'ding na nyes byas so //
translated: The text says, “If a monk spreads a mat in a temple, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gang zag gi gnas mal nas skrod na nyes byas so //
analyzed: gang zag gi gnas mal nas skrod na nyes byas so //
translated: If he expels someone from a sleeping place, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: gang zag gi gtsug lag khang yin la /
analyzed: gang zag gi gtsug lag khang yin la /
translated: If it is a temple belonging to an individual,

original: der dge slong gis phyis gnon byas te /
analyzed: der dge slong gis phyis gnon byas te /
translated: and a monk steps over it,

original: gnas mal bca' na nyes byas so //
analyzed: gnas mal bca' na nyes byas so //
translated: he commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: gang zag gi gtsug lag khang gi steng gi nam mkha' la yang tog byas pa ljid kyis phab ste /
analyzed: gang zag gi gtsug lag khang gi steng gi nam mkha' la yang tog byas pa ljid kyis phab ste /
translated: and the weight of the pinnacle of the temple of the person was lowered into the sky.

original: 'dug gam nyal na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dug gam nyal na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one sits or lies down, there is an offense.

original: reg par bya ba ma yin pa nyid la ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: reg par bya ba ma yin pa nyid la ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not so for what is not to be touched.

original: gser la sogs pa las byas pa'i khri la sogs pa dge slong gis reg par bya ba ma yin pa nyid ni bla gab med par bzhag ste /
analyzed: gser la sogs pa las byas pa'i khri la sogs pa dge slong gis reg par bya ba ma yin pa nyid ni bla gab med par bzhag ste /
translated: A monk should not touch a throne, etc. made of gold, etc. which is not to be touched.

original: ma brtul lam /
analyzed: ma brtul lam /
translated: It is not to be moved

original: brtul du ma bcug par de nas song na nyes byas su yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: brtul du ma bcug par de nas song na nyes byas su yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: or not to be moved. If one goes from there, there is no offense.

original: de dag brling bas rlung la sogs pas phan phun du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag brling bas rlung la sogs pas phan phun du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those are heavy, they are not moved by wind, etc.🔽Here, the text of the question is:

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las dge slong gis khri 'am khri'u bla gab ma mchis bar bzhag ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las dge slong gis khri 'am khri'u bla gab ma mchis bar bzhag ste /
translated: “Is there any offense for a monk who places a throne or bench outside,

original: ma brtul lam brtul du ma stsal bar de nas gzhan du @281a * //🔽mchis na ltung bar mi 'gyur ba 'ga' mchis sam /
analyzed: ma brtul lam brtul du ma stsal bar de nas gzhan du @281a * //🔽mchis na ltung bar mi 'gyur ba 'ga' mchis sam /
translated: and then goes elsewhere without moving it or not moving it?

original: yod de rin po che las byas pa yin na'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yod de rin po che las byas pa yin na'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is, if it is made of precious substances.

original: bsdu bar bya ba bting ste bsod snyoms la zhugs ba na gal te rlung dang char pa 'ong na gtsug lag khang na 'khod pa rnams kyis bsdu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsdu bar bya ba bting ste bsod snyoms la zhugs ba na gal te rlung dang char pa 'ong na gtsug lag khang na 'khod pa rnams kyis bsdu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: When one has set out the bedding to be gathered and has gone for alms, if wind and rain come, those who are in the monastery should gather it.

original: bsdu bar bya ba gnas mal te dge slong gis bla gab med bar bting ste bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na de'i tshe gal te rlung dang char pa 'ong na dge slong gtsug lag khang na 'khod pa rnams kyis gnas mal de dag bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: bsdu bar bya ba gnas mal te dge slong gis bla gab med bar bting ste bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na de'i tshe gal te rlung dang char pa 'ong na dge slong gtsug lag khang na 'khod pa rnams kyis gnas mal de dag bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: The bedding to be gathered is the bedding. If a monk sets out bedding in the open and then goes for alms, if wind and rain come, the monks who are in the monastery should gather that bedding.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught:

original: gal te dge slong gis bla gab med par gnas mal 'jog cing rang yang bsod snyoms la 'gro ba la /
analyzed: gal te dge slong gis bla gab med par gnas mal 'jog cing rang yang bsod snyoms la 'gro ba la /
translated: If a monk sets out bedding in the open and then goes for alms,

original: de'i tshe rlung dang char ba 'ong na gtsug lag khang na 'khod pa'i dge slong rnams kyis gnas mal de dag brtul bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe rlung dang char ba 'ong na gtsug lag khang na 'khod pa'i dge slong rnams kyis gnas mal de dag brtul bar bya'o //
translated: if wind and rain come, the monks who are in the monastery should gather that bedding.

original: bsod snyoms la zhugs pa'i dge slong de nyid kyis kyang /
analyzed: bsod snyoms la zhugs pa'i dge slong de nyid kyis kyang /
translated: And the monk who has entered for alms

original: rlung dang char pa mthong nas gus par byas te /
analyzed: rlung dang char pa mthong nas gus par byas te /
translated: should, seeing wind and rain, respectfully

original: myur du phyir 'ong bar bya'o //
analyzed: myur du phyir 'ong bar bya'o //
translated: return quickly.

original: de'i don nyid la nges pa med pa dang na smad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i don nyid la nges pa med pa dang na smad pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The meaning of this is not that there is no certainty, and it is not that there is no blame.

original: bsod snyoms kyi don nyid du bsod snyoms kyi dgos pa'i dbang gis song ba la ni nyes pa med pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: bsod snyoms kyi don nyid du bsod snyoms kyi dgos pa'i dbang gis song ba la ni nyes pa med pa yang ma yin la /
translated: It is not that there is no fault for one who has gone for the purpose of alms, by the power of the need for alms.

original: na smad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: na smad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not that there is no blame.

original: 'di ltar kha na ma tho ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ngo ;
analyzed: 'di ltar kha na ma tho ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ngo ;
translated: Because in this way the complete form of the offense would occur.

original: /'dir gzhung ni brtul bar bya ba bting ste bsod snyoms la 'jug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: /'dir gzhung ni brtul bar bya ba bting ste bsod snyoms la 'jug par mi bya'o //
translated: Here the text is to be interpreted as follows: One should not enter for alms without having spread out the sitting mat.

original: 'jug na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jug na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one enters, one becomes guilty of an offense.

original: gal te brjed pas lam ring du 'das sam phyis dran pa rnyed na phyin chad 'di ltar mi bya'o zhes sems bskyed par bya zhing tshig tu yang brjod par yang bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te brjed pas lam ring du 'das sam phyis dran pa rnyed na phyin chad 'di ltar mi bya'o zhes sems bskyed par bya zhing tshig tu yang brjod par yang bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If, through forgetfulness, one goes far away and later regains mindfulness, one should arouse the thought and say, “From now on, I will not do this.”

original: gal te brjed pas yul gzhan du 'gro zhing lam ring du 'das par gyur tam /
analyzed: gal te brjed pas yul gzhan du 'gro zhing lam ring du 'das par gyur tam /
translated: If, through forgetfulness, one goes to another place and goes far away on the road,

original: gnas su phyin nas bdag gis bla gab med par gnas mal bzhag par gyur to snyam du dran pa rnyed na phyin chad 'di ltar mi bya'o zhes bya ba yang dang yang du 'di ltar mi bya'o zhes sems bskyed par bya zhing tshig tu brjod par yang bya'o
analyzed: gnas su phyin nas bdag gis bla gab med par gnas mal bzhag par gyur to snyam du dran pa rnyed na phyin chad 'di ltar mi bya'o zhes bya ba yang dang yang du 'di ltar mi bya'o zhes sems bskyed par bya zhing tshig tu brjod par yang bya'o
translated: or if, having arrived at one’s dwelling, one regains mindfulness and thinks, “I have set up my bedding and seat in the open air,” one should repeatedly arouse the thought and say, “From now on, I will not do this.”

original: // gal te lam ring por ma phyin par dran pa rnyed na ni dge slong des phyir ldog par bya'o //
analyzed: // gal te lam ring por ma phyin par dran pa rnyed na ni dge slong des phyir ldog par bya'o //
translated: If one regains mindfulness before going far on the road, that monk should turn back.

original: gal te dge slong lam nas tshur 'ong ba zhig dang phrad par gyur na bsdu ba'i phyir de la bcol bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te dge slong lam nas tshur 'ong ba zhig dang phrad par gyur na bsdu ba'i phyir de la bcol bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one meets a monk coming on the road, one should entrust oneself to him in order to be taken back.

original: gal te dge slong de phar 'gro ba na dge slong lam nas tshur 'ong @281b ba zhig dang mngon sum du phrad par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dge slong de phar 'gro ba na dge slong lam nas tshur 'ong @281b ba zhig dang mngon sum du phrad par gyur na /
translated: If that monk is going away, and a monk who is coming along the path meets him face to face,

original: gnas mal brjed de bla gab med pa nas ma bsdus pa de bsdu ba'i phyir tshur 'ong ba de la bcol bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas mal brjed de bla gab med pa nas ma bsdus pa de bsdu ba'i phyir tshur 'ong ba de la bcol bar bya'o //
translated: he should entrust the forgotten bedding to the one who is coming, in order to collect it from the uncovered place.

original: khas blangs pas son pa nyid na de bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khas blangs pas son pa nyid na de bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The act is done just by arriving at the agreement.

original: tshur 'ong ba'i dge slong gang gis 'di skad ces kho bo der phyin nas bsdu bar bya'o zhes khas blangs pa des gnas mal gyi gnas su son pa nyid na gnas mal bsdu ba de bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: tshur 'ong ba'i dge slong gang gis 'di skad ces kho bo der phyin nas bsdu bar bya'o zhes khas blangs pa des gnas mal gyi gnas su son pa nyid na gnas mal bsdu ba de bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: The monk who is coming should say, “I will go there and collect it.” The act of collecting the bedding is done just by arriving at the place where the bedding is kept.🔽The text here says,

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong des kyang dge slong de la khas blangs nas gus par byas te bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong des kyang dge slong de la khas blangs nas gus par byas te bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: “That monk should also agree to do it, and then he should collect it respectfully.

original: gal te sdud par mi byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te sdud par mi byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If he does not collect it, he becomes guilty of an offense.”

original: lam nas tshur 'ongs pa zhes smos pa ni mtshon pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: lam nas tshur 'ongs pa zhes smos pa ni mtshon pa tsam du zad de /
translated: The phrase “coming from the road” is merely an illustration,

original: gzhan la yang rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la yang rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is also appropriate for others.

original: gnas nas 'phags par 'gyur ba na nyam nga ba dang phrad par mi 'gyur ba lta na gnas mal bsdu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnas nas 'phags par 'gyur ba na nyam nga ba dang phrad par mi 'gyur ba lta na gnas mal bsdu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If, when leaving the monastery, you do not encounter danger, then you may leave your bedding.

original: dge slong gnas nas 'phags par 'gyur ba na nyam nga ba dang phrad pa tshul khrims dang srog la sogs pa'i bar chad du 'gyur ba med pa lta na /🔽gnas mal skyabs yod pa na 'dug kyang rung ngo //
analyzed: dge slong gnas nas 'phags par 'gyur ba na nyam nga ba dang phrad pa tshul khrims dang srog la sogs pa'i bar chad du 'gyur ba med pa lta na / gnas mal skyabs yod pa na 'dug kyang rung ngo //
translated: If, when a monk leaves the monastery, he does not encounter danger that would create an obstacle to his morality, life, and so forth,🔽then he may leave his bedding in a sheltered place.

original: bla gab med pa na 'dug kyang rung ste bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: bla gab med pa na 'dug kyang rung ste bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: He may also leave it in an unsheltered place.

original: 'dir gzhung ni phran tshegs dag las dge slong gis gnas mal bsdus nas 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni phran tshegs dag las dge slong gis gnas mal bsdus nas 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: The text states: “A monk should take his bedding when he leaves.

original: mi sdud na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mi sdud na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If he does not, he becomes guilty of an offense.”

original: nyam nga ba dang phrad par mi 'gyur ba lta na zhes smos pa ni /
analyzed: nyam nga ba dang phrad par mi 'gyur ba lta na zhes smos pa ni /
translated: The phrase “if, when leaving the monastery, you do not encounter danger”🔽means that if you encounter danger, you should not leave your bedding.

original: gnas mal sdud par byed pa na 'phyis pa'i dbang gis gal te na srog gi bar chad la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas mal sdud par byed pa na 'phyis pa'i dbang gis gal te na srog gi bar chad la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to avoid the danger that, because of the delay, there might be an obstacle to life, etc.

original: gal te dri ma can du gyur na sprug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te dri ma can du gyur na sprug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it becomes soiled, it should be shaken out.

original: 'gro bas gal te gnas mal sa rdul la sogs pas dri ma can du gyur na phyi rol rlung kha la sogs par sprug par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gro bas gal te gnas mal sa rdul la sogs pas dri ma can du gyur na phyi rol rlung kha la sogs par sprug par bya'o //
translated: If the bedding becomes soiled with dust, etc., it should be shaken out in the wind, etc.

original: 'dir gzhung ni ma mo las dge slong 'gro bar chas pa zhes bya ba nas gnas mal dri ma can du gyur na sprug par bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni ma mo las dge slong 'gro bar chas pa zhes bya ba nas gnas mal dri ma can du gyur na sprug par bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text in the Mūlasarvâstivāda Vinaya says, “A monk who is about to go away should put away the bedding, etc.,” up to “If the bedding becomes soiled, it should be shaken out.”

original: de 'bul bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de 'bul bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It should be returned.

original: dge slong 'gro bar chas pas dge 'dun nam gang zag gzhan gyi gnas mal bdag spyod spyod pa de gal te dus kyis thub cing nyam nga ba dang phrad par mi 'gyur ba lta na khungs su phyir dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong 'gro bar chas pas dge 'dun nam gang zag gzhan gyi gnas mal bdag spyod spyod pa de gal te dus kyis thub cing nyam nga ba dang phrad par mi 'gyur ba lta na khungs su phyir dbul bar bya'o //
translated: If a monk who is about to go away has used the bedding of the Saṅgha or of another person, if he is able to do so, he should return it to its original place.

original: yang na bcol bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang na bcol bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Or he should entrust it to someone.

original: gal te dus kyis mi thub cing nyam nga ba dang phrad par 'gyur ba @282a * //
analyzed: gal te dus kyis mi thub cing nyam nga ba dang phrad par 'gyur ba @282a * //
translated: If he is unable to do so because of the time or because of a danger that has arisen,

original: lta na gnas mal gzhan la bcol bar bya'o //
analyzed: lta na gnas mal gzhan la bcol bar bya'o //
translated: he should entrust the bedding to another place.

original: su la zhe na /
analyzed: su la zhe na /
translated: To whom?

original: de'i phyir dge slong la'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong la'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is said: to a monk.

original: de med na dge tshul la'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de med na dge tshul la'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If he is not available, to a novice monk.

original: dge slong med na dge tshul la de bcol bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong med na dge tshul la de bcol bar bya'o //
translated: If a monk is not available, he should entrust it to a novice monk.

original: de yang med na khyim bdag la'o zhes bya ba dang dge tshul de yang med na khyim bdag de la bcol bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang med na khyim bdag la'o zhes bya ba dang dge tshul de yang med na khyim bdag de la bcol bar bya'o //
translated: If he is not available, to a householder. If a novice monk is not available, he should entrust it to a householder.

original: thams cad med na phyogs bzhir rnam par bltas te lde mig sbas nas 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad med na phyogs bzhir rnam par bltas te lde mig sbas nas 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If all are not available, he should look in the four directions, hide the key, and go.

original: bcol bar bya ba thams cad med na 'gro ba'i phyir phyogs bzhir bltas te /
analyzed: bcol bar bya ba thams cad med na 'gro ba'i phyir phyogs bzhir bltas te /
translated: If all those to whom it can be entrusted are not available, he should look in the four directions in order to go.

original: lde mig kyog po la sogs pa gzhan gyis ma mthong bar sbas te 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: lde mig kyog po la sogs pa gzhan gyis ma mthong bar sbas te 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: He should hide the key in a place where it will not be seen by others, such as a bent stick, and go.

original: gal te lam khar dge slong mthong na phyogs de la brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gal te lam khar bdag gis gnas der gtogs pa'i dge slong tshur 'ong ba mthong na phyogs gang du lde mig sbas pa'i phyogs de lam khar phrad pa'i dge slong de🔽la brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te lam khar dge slong mthong na phyogs de la brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gal te lam khar bdag gis gnas der gtogs pa'i dge slong tshur 'ong ba mthong na phyogs gang du lde mig sbas pa'i phyogs de lam khar phrad pa'i dge slong de la brjod par bya'o //
translated: If one sees a monk coming to that place who belongs to that residence, one should tell the monk one meets on the road the direction in which the key is hidden.

original: gal te 'ongs pa na khyi ma gzhan du mgron du bos shing sgo bcad par gyur na rtsig drung ngam shing ljon pa'i drung du stan bzhag ste 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te 'ongs pa na khyi ma gzhan du mgron du bos shing sgo bcad par gyur na rtsig drung ngam shing ljon pa'i drung du stan bzhag ste 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If he comes and the dog is invited elsewhere and the door is closed, one should enter after placing one’s seat near the wall or near a tree.

original: gal te dge slong song ba de'i phyir 'ongs pa na dge slong rnams yon bdag gi khyim gzhan du mgron du bos shing gtsug lag khang gi sgo bcad par gyur na dge slong des gtsug lag khang gi nyen kor gyi rtsig drung ngam shing ljon pa'i drung du🔽rang gi stan bzhag ste /
analyzed: gal te dge slong song ba de'i phyir 'ongs pa na dge slong rnams yon bdag gi khyim gzhan du mgron du bos shing gtsug lag khang gi sgo bcad par gyur na dge slong des gtsug lag khang gi nyen kor gyi rtsig drung ngam shing ljon pa'i drung du🔽rang gi stan bzhag ste /
translated: If the monk who went there returns and the monks have been invited to another patron’s house and the door of the temple is closed, that monk should place his seat near the wall or near a tree in the vicinity of the temple.

original: dge slong rnams gang mgron du bos pa'i khyim gzhan der zan gyi phyir 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong rnams gang mgron du bos pa'i khyim gzhan der zan gyi phyir 'jug par bya'o //
translated: The monks should enter the other house where they have been invited for the sake of food.

original: rtsig drung ngam shing ljon pa'i drung zhes smos pa ni /
analyzed: rtsig drung ngam shing ljon pa'i drung zhes smos pa ni /
translated: The words “near a wall or near a tree”

original: nyin mtshan bskyab pa'i dpe de tsam du zad de /
analyzed: nyin mtshan bskyab pa'i dpe de tsam du zad de /
translated: are just examples for protection during the day and night.

original: gar 'os pa'i phyogs gzhan du yang bzhag tu rung ngo //
analyzed: gar 'os pa'i phyogs gzhan du yang bzhag tu rung ngo //
translated: It is suitable to place the bowl wherever is appropriate.

original: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las rtsig drung ngam /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las rtsig drung ngam /
translated: In this way, the text here says, “Near a wall or

original: gang du nyi mas chud zos par mi 'gyur bar gzhag par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang du nyi mas chud zos par mi 'gyur bar gzhag par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: wherever the sun will not cause it to melt.”

original: der stan dag g-yar por spyin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: der stan dag g-yar por spyin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “They should borrow seats there”

original: dge slong dag mgron du 'bod pa'i khyim gzhan der gtsug lag khang dang 'brel ba'i stan dag g-yar por sbyin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag mgron du 'bod pa'i khyim gzhan der gtsug lag khang dang 'brel ba'i stan dag g-yar por sbyin no //
translated: means that the monks should borrow seats connected to the monastery in that other house where they have been invited.

original: rang gis bskur bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang gis bskur bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “They should not send them back themselves”

original: dge slong dag rang gi khyim gzhan de nas stan de dag phyir bskur bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag rang gi khyim gzhan de nas stan de dag phyir bskur bar mi bya'o //
translated: means that the monks should not send those seats back themselves from that other house.

original: de ni khyim pa dang dge tshul dag gi'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni khyim pa dang dge tshul dag gi'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the duty of the householders and novices.

original: stan bskur ba de ni khyim pa dang dge tshul dag gi las kho na yin no //
analyzed: stan bskur ba de ni khyim pa dang dge tshul dag gi las kho na yin no //
translated: This is the duty of the householders and novices.

original: 'di @282b skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di @282b skad bstan te /
translated: This is the meaning of the teaching.

original: khyim pa dang dge tshul dag gis gtsug lag khang du stan de dag bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyim pa dang dge tshul dag gis gtsug lag khang du stan de dag bskur bar bya'o //
translated: The householders and novices should carry the seats to the monastery.

original: med na bskyal ba'i phyir khyim pa la bcol te 'dong bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: med na bskyal ba'i phyir khyim pa la bcol te 'dong bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If they are not there, they should be entrusted to the householders for carrying.

original: khyim pa dang dge tshul dag med na stan dag bskyal ba'i phyir khyim bdag la bcol te /
analyzed: khyim pa dang dge tshul dag med na stan dag bskyal ba'i phyir khyim bdag la bcol te /
translated: If the householders and novices are not there, the seats should be entrusted to the householders for carrying.

original: dge slong rnams gtsug lag khang du 'dong bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge slong rnams gtsug lag khang du 'dong bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The monks should go to the monastery. This is the meaning.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag zan zos nas stan rang nyid kyi mchan khung nas blangs te /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag zan zos nas stan rang nyid kyi mchan khung nas blangs te /
translated: Here is the text: The monks, having eaten, took the seats from under their armpits

original: 'gro ba na bram ze dang khyim bdag dag ci 'phags pa dag rol mo dag 'dong ngam zhes co 'dri bar byed nas /
analyzed: 'gro ba na bram ze dang khyim bdag dag ci 'phags pa dag rol mo dag 'dong ngam zhes co 'dri bar byed nas /
translated: and went. The Brahmins and householders said, Noble ones, are you going to the entertainment?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽Monks, you should not carry seats in this way.

original: rang gis stan bskur bar mi bya bar khyim pa dang / dge tshul dag gis bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: rang gis stan bskur bar mi bya bar khyim pa dang / dge tshul dag gis bskur bar bya'o //
translated: One should not carry one’s own seat, but a householder or novice should carry it.

original: gal te khyim pa dang dge tshul med na khyim bdag de nyid la bcol te 'dong bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te khyim pa dang dge tshul med na khyim bdag de nyid la bcol te 'dong bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If there are no householders or novices, then one should entrust it to the householder and leave.

original: bdag cag gis bskyal lo zhes zer na bzhag ste 'dong bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bdag cag gis bskyal lo zhes zer na bzhag ste 'dong bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If they say, “We will carry it,” then one should leave it and go.

original: gal te khyim bdag dag 'di skad ces bdag cag gis bskyal bar bya'o zhes zer na dge slong rnams kyis stan dag bzhag ste 'dong bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te khyim bdag dag 'di skad ces bdag cag gis bskyal bar bya'o zhes zer na dge slong rnams kyis stan dag bzhag ste 'dong bar bya'o //
translated: If the householders say, “We will carry it,” then the monks should leave their seats and go.

original: de dag gis ma bskyal na gnas par byed pa dag gis blang par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag gis ma bskyal na gnas par byed pa dag gis blang par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If they do not carry it, those who are staying there should take it.

original: khyim pa de dag gis bskya la bar khas blangs su zin kyang ma bskyal na gnas par byed pa nye gnas dag gis stan de dag blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyim pa de dag gis bskya la bar khas blangs su zin kyang ma bskyal na gnas par byed pa nye gnas dag gis stan de dag blang bar bya'o //
translated: Even if those householders agree to carry it, if they do not carry it, then those who are staying there, the attendants, should take the seats.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: gal te khyim bdag gis stan de dag ma bskyal na gnas par byed pa dag gis blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te khyim bdag gis stan de dag ma bskyal na gnas par byed pa dag gis blang bar bya'o //
translated: If the householder does not bring the seats, the attendants should take them.

original: med na rang gis bya'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽gnas par byed pa dag kyang med na rang gis blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: med na rang gis bya'o zhes bya ba ni / gnas par byed pa dag kyang med na rang gis blang bar bya ste /
translated: If they are not available, one should do it oneself.🔽This means that if the attendants are not available, one should take them oneself.

original: gnas brtan de dag dang dge slong rnams kyis rang gis blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnas brtan de dag dang dge slong rnams kyis rang gis blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The elders and the monks should take them themselves.

original: thams cad kyis na gand'i brdung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad kyis na gand'i brdung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In all cases, one should strike the gandi.

original: gal te dge slong thams cad kyis blang bar bya dgos pa zhig yin na /
analyzed: gal te dge slong thams cad kyis blang bar bya dgos pa zhig yin na /
translated: This means that if all the monks are required to take them,

original: de'i tshe thams cad 'dus te len du 'dong ba'i phyir gand'i brdung bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe thams cad 'dus te len du 'dong ba'i phyir gand'i brdung bar bya'o //
translated: then, in order to go and take them all together, one should strike the gandi.

original: 'di skad bstan te /🔽gal te dag slong thams cad kyis bri bkol med par stan de dag blang dgos na de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / gal te dag slong thams cad kyis bri bkol med par stan de dag blang dgos na de'i tshe /
translated: This is what is taught.🔽If all the monks are required to take those seats without any difficulty,

original: thams cad kyis stan blang ba'i phyir gand'i brdung bar bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyis stan blang ba'i phyir gand'i brdung bar bya'o //
translated: then, in order for all to take the seats, one should strike the gandi.

original: yon bdag gis gtsug lag khang du rang gi don du stan dag g-yar po byed na sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽gal te yon bdag dag gtsug lag khang du @283a * //
analyzed: yon bdag gis gtsug lag khang du rang gi don du stan dag g-yar po byed na sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni / gal te yon bdag dag gtsug lag khang du @283a * //
translated: If the benefactors borrow the seats for their own purposes in the monastery, they should be given.

original: lhags te / gtsug lag khang du yon bdag dag rang gi don du dge 'dun gyi gdan cha dag g-yar po byed na dge 'dun gyis de dag la g-yar por spyin par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lhags te / gtsug lag khang du yon bdag dag rang gi don du dge 'dun gyi gdan cha dag g-yar po byed na dge 'dun gyis de dag la g-yar por spyin par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If the benefactors come to the monastery and borrow the seats of the Saṅgha in the monastery for their own purposes, the Saṅgha should give them in loan, this is the meaning.

original: de dag bsrung ba'i phyir dge slong yang gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag bsrung ba'i phyir dge slong yang gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: For the sake of protecting them, a monk should also be placed.

original: gtsug lag khang du yon bdag la g-yar ba'i gdan cha de dag bsrung ba'i phyir dge slong rnams kyis dge slong cig gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du yon bdag la g-yar ba'i gdan cha de dag bsrung ba'i phyir dge slong rnams kyis dge slong cig gzhag par bya'o //
translated: For the sake of protecting those seats borrowed by the benefactors in the monastery, the monks should place a monk.

original: des phyogs gcig tu bsdad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des phyogs gcig tu bsdad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should sit in one place.

original: dge slong srung mar gzhag pa des khyim bdag bza' btung byed cing gtam zer ba'i nang du mi 'jug par pha zad tsam du phyogs gcig tu yangs kyis bsdad par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong srung mar gzhag pa des khyim bdag bza' btung byed cing gtam zer ba'i nang du mi 'jug par pha zad tsam du phyogs gcig tu yangs kyis bsdad par bya'o //
translated: The monk who is appointed as the caretaker should not enter into the householder’s conversation while he is eating and drinking, but should sit off to one side.

original: rang gi las bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang gi las bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should do his own work.

original: dge slong des rang gi las bsam gtan dang / kha don dang klog 'dri la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag kyang bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong des rang gi las bsam gtan dang / kha don dang klog 'dri la sogs pa gang yin pa de dag kyang bya'o //
translated: The monk should do whatever work he has, such as meditation, recitation, reading, and writing.

original: sems gtad pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems gtad pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should also be attentive.

original: dge slong phyogs gcig na sdong pa des gdan cha de dag la sems gtad cing ye rig che bar bya ba'o //🔽dong na bsdu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong phyogs gcig na sdong pa des gdan cha de dag la sems gtad cing ye rig che bar bya ba'o // dong na bsdu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The monk who is sitting in one place should be attentive to those seats and should be very aware.🔽When the patron leaves, he should put them away.

original: yon bdag dong na gdan cha de dag bsdu bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: yon bdag dong na gdan cha de dag bsdu bar bya ba'o //
translated: When the patron has left, he should put the seats away.

original: ma rung ba dag byi dor bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ma rung ba dag byi dor bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He should repair any that are damaged.

original: gdan cha khyim pas ma rung bar byas pa dag dge skos la sogs pas byi dor bya'o //
analyzed: gdan cha khyim pas ma rung bar byas pa dag dge skos la sogs pas byi dor bya'o //
translated: The monk who is the caretaker should repair any seats that have been damaged by householders.

original: chang gis na chu dag gis so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chang gis na chu dag gis so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is beer, with water.

original: chang gi snyigs mas ma rung bar gyur na chu dag gis bkru zhing byi dor bya'o //
analyzed: chang gi snyigs mas ma rung bar gyur na chu dag gis bkru zhing byi dor bya'o //
translated: If the robe is spoiled by the dregs of beer, it should be washed and cleaned with water.

original: snum gyis na chal gyis so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snum gyis na chal gyis so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is oil, with ashes.

original: snum gyis ma rung bar gyur na 'dag pa'i chal gyis byi dor bya'o //
analyzed: snum gyis ma rung bar gyur na 'dag pa'i chal gyis byi dor bya'o //
translated: If it is spoiled by oil, it should be cleaned with ashes.

original: mi gtsang bas na sa'am 'dag rdzas sam lcibs so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi gtsang bas na sa'am 'dag rdzas sam lcibs so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is filth, with earth, ashes, or cowdung.

original: gdan cha dag mi gtsang bas ma rung bar gyur na sa 'am 'dag rdzas sam lci bas byi dor bya'o //
analyzed: gdan cha dag mi gtsang bas ma rung bar gyur na sa 'am 'dag rdzas sam lci bas byi dor bya'o //
translated: If the robe is spoiled by filth, it should be cleaned with earth, ashes, or cowdung.

original: gal te thags ma mi gtsang bar gyur pa 'dag rdzas kyis dag par ma gyur na de'i tshe ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: gal te thags ma mi gtsang bar gyur pa 'dag rdzas kyis dag par ma gyur na de'i tshe ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: If the cloth is spoiled by filth and is not cleaned with ashes, what should be done then?

original: de'i phyir thags ma ma dag na gcad par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir thags ma ma dag na gcad par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said: If the cloth is not clean, it should be cut.

original: 'breng bu la sogs pa las byas pa'i thags ma ma dag na gcad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'breng bu la sogs pa las byas pa'i thags ma ma dag na gcad par bya'o //
translated: If the cloth made of thread from strips of cloth and so on is not clean, it should be cut.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gal te re zhig sbyang bar nus na de lta na legs /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gal te re zhig sbyang bar nus na de lta na legs /
translated: Here the text says: If it can be cleaned, it is good.

original: gal te mi nus na 'breng bu bcad de dor bar bya zhing 'breng bu sar pa dag gis yang bslang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽khyim pa 'dug 'dug pa'i stan ma bsdus pa mthong na bsdu bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /🔽khyim pa 'dug 'dug pa zhes bya ba @283b khyim pas stan du bting ba'i gdan cha ma bsdus pa mthong na gang sus mthong yang rung ste /
analyzed: gal te mi nus na 'breng bu bcad de dor bar bya zhing 'breng bu sar pa dag gis yang bslang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no // khyim pa 'dug 'dug pa'i stan ma bsdus pa mthong na bsdu bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni / khyim pa 'dug 'dug pa zhes bya ba @283b khyim pas stan du bting ba'i gdan cha ma bsdus pa mthong na gang sus mthong yang rung ste /
translated: If one is unable to do so, one should cut the thread and leave it, and then take it up again with a new thread.🔽If one sees a seat that a layperson has used and not put away, one should put it away.

original: de nyid kyis bsdu bar bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid kyis bsdu bar bya ba nyid do //
translated: “A layperson has used” means that a layperson has spread out a seat. If one sees that the seat has not been put away, then whoever sees it should put it away.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is meant.

original: gdan cha gang dag la khyim pa dag 'khod 'khod pa'i gdan cha de dag gal te ma bsdus pa gyur na dge slong gang gis de dag mthong ba de nyid kyis bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: gdan cha gang dag la khyim pa dag 'khod 'khod pa'i gdan cha de dag gal te ma bsdus pa gyur na dge slong gang gis de dag mthong ba de nyid kyis bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: If the seat that a layperson has used has not been put away, then whoever sees it should put it away.

original: gal te rgas pa dad na ba yin na dge skos kyis so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te rgas pa dad na ba yin na dge skos kyis so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one is old or sick, the duties should be done by the novice attendant.

original: gal te mthong ba rgas pa'am na ba yin na dge skos kyis bsdu bar bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: gal te mthong ba rgas pa'am na ba yin na dge skos kyis bsdu bar bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: If the one who sees is old or sick, the duty of gathering the seats belongs to the monk who is the rector.

original: des sbran par bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni rgan po'am /
analyzed: des sbran par bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni rgan po'am /
translated: The sick monk should inform the rector.

original: nad pa des gdan cha ma bsdus pa mthong ba de dge skos la sbran par bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: nad pa des gdan cha ma bsdus pa mthong ba de dge skos la sbran par bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: The sick monk, whether old or young, should inform the rector if he sees that the seats have not been gathered.

original: thams cad kyis nad pa blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: thams cad kyis nad pa blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: All should visit the sick.

original: mtshams der gtogs pa'i dge slong mi na ba thams cad kyis nad pa blta bar bya'o //🔽'dug ste'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽'dug ste nad par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: mtshams der gtogs pa'i dge slong mi na ba thams cad kyis nad pa blta bar bya'o // 'dug ste'o zhes bya ba ni / 'dug ste nad par blta bar bya'o //
translated: All monks who are not sick and who belong to that monastery should visit the sick.🔽They should visit the sick while sitting.

original: 'greng ste ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'greng ste ni ma yin no //
translated: They should visit the sick while sitting, not while standing.

original: der stan thogs te 'gro bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: der stan thogs te 'gro bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They should not go there carrying their seats.

original: nad pa blta ba der rang gi stan thogs te 'gro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: nad pa blta ba der rang gi stan thogs te 'gro bar mi bya'o //
translated: They should not go there carrying their own seats.

original: nad pa'i nad g-yog gis der stan dag bsham par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nad pa'i nad g-yog gis der stan dag bsham par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The attendants of the sick should set out seats there.

original: nad pa'i nang g-yog gis gang na nad pa 'dug pa der dge slong dag 'khod pa'i stan bsham par bya'o //
analyzed: nad pa'i nang g-yog gis gang na nad pa 'dug pa der dge slong dag 'khod pa'i stan bsham par bya'o //
translated: The attendant of a sick person should prepare seats for the monks where the sick person is.

original: mkhan po 'am slob dpon dge ba'i phyogs la 'gro na /
analyzed: mkhan po 'am slob dpon dge ba'i phyogs la 'gro na /
translated: If the preceptor or teacher is going to a virtuous place,

original: gal te gzhan gyi dge ba'i phyogs mi 'phel na phyi bzhin 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi dge ba'i phyogs mi 'phel na phyi bzhin 'gro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: if the virtuous side of others does not increase, he should go after them.

original: mkhan po 'am slob dpon dge ba'i phyogs la 'gro na /
analyzed: mkhan po 'am slob dpon dge ba'i phyogs la 'gro na /
translated: If the preceptor or teacher is going to a virtuous place,

original: gal te slob ma dang nye gnas dag gis phyi bzhin 'gro ba ma gtogs par gzhan gyi dge ba'i phyogs mi 'phel ba lta na mkhan po'am slob dpon de'i phyi bzhin 'gro bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te slob ma dang nye gnas dag gis phyi bzhin 'gro ba ma gtogs par gzhan gyi dge ba'i phyogs mi 'phel ba lta na mkhan po'am slob dpon de'i phyi bzhin 'gro bar bya ba'o //
translated: if the virtuous side of others does not increase except for the disciples and attendants going after them, then the preceptor or teacher should go after them.

original: de'i phyir rang gis stan bskur bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mkhan po'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gis stan bskur bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mkhan po'am /
translated: Therefore, they should give up their own seats.

original: slob dpon de'i 'dug par bya ba'i phyir slob ma'am nye gnas dag gis rang gi stan bskur bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: slob dpon de'i 'dug par bya ba'i phyir slob ma'am nye gnas dag gis rang gi stan bskur bar bya ba'o //
translated: For the sake of the preceptor or teacher sitting down, the disciples or attendants should give up their own seats.

original: 'gro ba ma zhus par mi bskur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'gro ba ma zhus par mi bskur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They should not give up without asking.

original: slob ma'am nye gnas des bdag nyid phyi bzhin 'gro ba ma zhus par stan mi bskur ba'o //
analyzed: slob ma'am nye gnas des bdag nyid phyi bzhin 'gro ba ma zhus par stan mi bskur ba'o //
translated: The disciple or pupil should not carry the teacher’s or preceptor’s seat without being asked to do so.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: bdag kyang slad bzhin mchi'o zhes ma zhus par mkhan po'am slob dpon gyi stan mi bskur ro //
analyzed: bdag kyang slad bzhin mchi'o zhes ma zhus par mkhan po'am slob dpon gyi stan mi bskur ro //
translated: One should not carry the seat of the preceptor or teacher without being asked to do so, saying, “I will follow behind.”

original: de rang nyid kyis bskur ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de rang nyid kyis bskur ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “He should carry it himself” means

original: stan slob ma la sogs pas phar khyer ba de slob dpon la sogs pa rang nyid kyis phyir bskur bar bya ba'o //🔽bla @284a * //🔽gab med par chos nyan pa na rlung dang char pa byung na bsdu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: stan slob ma la sogs pas phar khyer ba de slob dpon la sogs pa rang nyid kyis phyir bskur bar bya ba'o // bla @284a * // gab med par chos nyan pa na rlung dang char pa byung na bsdu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: that if the seat is carried away by the disciple and so on, the preceptor or teacher should carry it back himself.🔽“If the Dharma is being listened to in the open air, it should be put away if wind or rain occurs.”

original: bla gab med par chos nyan du bcug pa na rlung ngam char pa 'ong na gang gis stan gang yin pa de nyid kyis de gnas mal du bskur bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: bla gab med par chos nyan du bcug pa na rlung ngam char pa 'ong na gang gis stan gang yin pa de nyid kyis de gnas mal du bskur bar bya ba'o //
translated: If one is made to listen to the Dharma in the open air, if wind or rain occurs, the seat should be carried back to the dwelling by the one who brought it.

original: rgan po rnams kyi lci ba nyid kyi phyir rang gis mi nus na gzhon nu rnams dang lhan cig brje bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgan po rnams kyi lci ba nyid kyi phyir rang gis mi nus na gzhon nu rnams dang lhan cig brje bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If the elders are unable to carry it themselves, they should exchange it with the young.

original: rgan po rnams kyi gnas mal lci ba nyid kyi phyir rang gis brtul mi nus na gzhon nu rnams dang / rgan po rnams phan tshun lci ba yang brjes te bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgan po rnams kyi gnas mal lci ba nyid kyi phyir rang gis brtul mi nus na gzhon nu rnams dang / rgan po rnams phan tshun lci ba yang brjes te bskur bar bya'o //
translated: If the elders are unable to carry the bedding themselves because it is heavy, they should exchange it with the young.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: gzhon nu rnams kyi gnas mal gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: gzhon nu rnams kyi gnas mal gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The bedding of the young

original: yang ba'i phyir rgan po rnams kyis bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang ba'i phyir rgan po rnams kyis bskur bar bya'o //
translated: should be carried by the elders because it is light.

original: rgan po rnams kyi ni lci ba'i phyir gzhon nu rnams kyis bskur bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgan po rnams kyi ni lci ba'i phyir gzhon nu rnams kyis bskur bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The bedding of the elders should be carried by the young because it is heavy.

original: mthun pa dang mthun par gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mthun pa dang mthun par gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It should be placed in a proper and suitable manner.

original: gnas mal mthun pa dang / mthun par lhan cig gzhag par bya'i /
analyzed: gnas mal mthun pa dang / mthun par lhan cig gzhag par bya'i /
translated: The bedding should be placed in a proper and suitable manner,

original: mi mthun pa dang lhan cig gzhag par mi bya ba ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa dang lhan cig gzhag par mi bya ba ste /
translated: not in an improper and unsuitable manner.

original: dper na gor bu yang gor bu dag dang / dbyam po yang dbyam mo dag dang / khri la sogs pa yang khri la sogs pa dag dang mthun mthun du bzhag pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na gor bu yang gor bu dag dang / dbyam po yang dbyam mo dag dang / khri la sogs pa yang khri la sogs pa dag dang mthun mthun du bzhag pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, lead is placed with lead, silver with silver, and so on, and a thousand with a thousand, and so on.

original: gtsug lag khang gzhan du gdan cha dang rdzas rnyed na bskur bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gzhan du gdan cha dang rdzas rnyed na bskur bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one finds bedding and other articles in another monastery, one should send them.

original: gtsug lag khang gzhan du dge slong dag gdan cha dang / mchod pa'i rdzas dag rnyed na dge 'dun du gyur pa'i dge slong dag gis g-yar por bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gzhan du dge slong dag gdan cha dang / mchod pa'i rdzas dag rnyed na dge 'dun du gyur pa'i dge slong dag gis g-yar por bskur bar bya'o //
translated: If a monk finds bedding and other articles for worship in another monastery, the monks who are part of the saṃgha should send them.

original: gal te char 'bab pa dang char 'bab tu dogs pa med na'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te char 'bab pa dang char 'bab tu dogs pa med na'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If there is no rain or fear of rain,

original: de'i tshe char 'bab pa dang de'i 'og tu char 'bab tu dogs pa med na bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe char 'bab pa dang de'i 'og tu char 'bab tu dogs pa med na bskur bar bya'o //
translated: then at that time, if there is no rain or fear of rain afterwards, one should send them.

original: gal te lam kar rlung dang char pa byung na shing ljon pa'am rtsig drung du bcer bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te lam kar rlung dang char pa byung na shing ljon pa'am rtsig drung du bcer bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If there is wind and rain on the road, one should enter a tree or a wall.

original: gal te lam khar rlung ngam char pa byung na /
analyzed: gal te lam khar rlung ngam char pa byung na /
translated: If wind or rain should occur on the road,

original: de'i tshe dge slong srung ba dag gis shing ljon pa'i drung ngam rtsig drung du gdan dang mchod pa'i rdzas de dag phung por bcer bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe dge slong srung ba dag gis shing ljon pa'i drung ngam rtsig drung du gdan dang mchod pa'i rdzas de dag phung por bcer bar bya'o //
translated: then the monks who are the guardians should pile up the seats and offering substances near a tree or a wall.

original: rdzas ngan pa gcig gis g-yogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdzas ngan pa gcig gis g-yogs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They should be covered with a single bad cloth.

original: srung ba dag gis de dag rdzas thams cad kyi nang na rnying pa dag ngan pa gcig gis g-yogs par bya'o //🔽gtsug lag khang du phyin nas rdzas @284b rnams bskam par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: srung ba dag gis de dag rdzas thams cad kyi nang na rnying pa dag ngan pa gcig gis g-yogs par bya'o // gtsug lag khang du phyin nas rdzas @284b rnams bskam par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The guardians should cover them with a single bad cloth, the oldest and worst of all their cloths.🔽Having gone to the monastery, the substances should be dried.

original: gtsug lag khang du phyin nas rdzas gsher ba rnams bskam par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du phyin nas rdzas gsher ba rnams bskam par bya ba'o //
translated: Having gone to the monastery, the wet substances should be dried.

original: 'dir gzhung ni khyim bdag cig la gtsug lag khang grong mtha' ba dang dgon pa pa gnyis yod nas dge slong dgon pa pa dag gis dge slong grong mtha' rnams las rdzas dang gnas mal dag brnyas pa dang de dag gis ma ster nas /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni khyim bdag cig la gtsug lag khang grong mtha' ba dang dgon pa pa gnyis yod nas dge slong dgon pa pa dag gis dge slong grong mtha' rnams las rdzas dang gnas mal dag brnyas pa dang de dag gis ma ster nas /
translated: The text here is this: A householder had two monasteries, one in the village and one in the forest. The monks in the forest monastery disparaged the monks in the village monastery, and they did not give them goods and bedding.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: brnyan par bya'o //
analyzed: brnyan par bya'o //
translated: “You should give them.”

original: de dag gis bskur ba dang char 'bab pas rdzas kha dog sna tshogs dag ma rung bar gyur nas /
analyzed: de dag gis bskur ba dang char 'bab pas rdzas kha dog sna tshogs dag ma rung bar gyur nas /
translated: They gave them, and the goods were ruined by the rain.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: gal te char 'bab bam char 'bab tu dogs pa na bskur bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gal te char 'bab bam char 'bab tu dogs pa na bskur bar mi bya'o //
translated: “If it is raining or you fear it will rain, you should not give them.

original: gal te lam khar char 'bab na shing ljon pa'i drung du gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te lam khar char 'bab na shing ljon pa'i drung du gzhag par bya'o //
translated: If it rains on the road, you should place them under a tree.

original: gtsug lag khang du son nas rdzas rnams bskam par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du son nas rdzas rnams bskam par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: When you reach the monastery, you should dry the goods.”

original: me shor tam chu byung na dge 'dun gyi yang gdon par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: me shor tam chu byung na dge 'dun gyi yang gdon par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If a fire starts or water appears, you should also take the Saṅgha’s goods.

original: me shor tam chu byung na dang por gang zag gi rdzas gdon par bya zhing /
analyzed: me shor tam chu byung na dang por gang zag gi rdzas gdon par bya zhing /
translated: If a fire or flood occurs, first the property of the individual should be removed.

original: phyis dge 'dun gyi yang gdon par bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyis dge 'dun gyi yang gdon par bya ba'o //
translated: Later, the Saṅgha’s property should be removed.

original: gang gi tshe zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhe na /
translated: When?

original: de'i phyir rang gi lhung bzed dang chos gos thon zin na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi lhung bzed dang chos gos thon zin na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “when one’s own begging bowl and robes have been removed.”

original: rang gi chos gos dang lhung bzed dag thon zin na de'i 'og tu dge 'dun gyi yang gdon par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi chos gos dang lhung bzed dag thon zin na de'i 'og tu dge 'dun gyi yang gdon par bya'o //
translated: If one’s own robes and begging bowl have been removed, then after that the Saṅgha’s should be removed.

original: je dang por rang gi lhung bzed dang / chos gos gdon par bya zhing de'i 'og tu dge 'dun gyi yang gdon par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: je dang por rang gi lhung bzed dang / chos gos gdon par bya zhing de'i 'og tu dge 'dun gyi yang gdon par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The meaning is that first one’s own begging bowl and robes should be removed, and after that the Saṅgha’s should be removed.

original: gang zag ni phongs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang zag ni phongs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because the individual would be impoverished,

original: dge 'dun ni phongs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun ni phongs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: but the Saṅgha would not be impoverished.

original: bton zin ba bsrung ba'i phyir dge slong chen po mi nus pa gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bton zin ba bsrung ba'i phyir dge slong chen po mi nus pa gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “A great monk who is unable should be left behind in order to protect what has been removed.”

original: me dang chu'i nang nas rdzas bton zin pa bsrung ba'i phyir dge slong chen po mi nus pa zhes bya ba gdon pa'i las kyi 'os su rung ba ma yin pa gzhag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: me dang chu'i nang nas rdzas bton zin pa bsrung ba'i phyir dge slong chen po mi nus pa zhes bya ba gdon pa'i las kyi 'os su rung ba ma yin pa gzhag par bya ba'o //
translated: In order to protect the goods that have been removed from the fire or water, the monk who is called “the great monk who is unable” is not suitable to be the one who performs the rite of relinquishment.

original: mi bzod pa nyid du 'jug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi bzod pa nyid du 'jug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not enter into what is not tolerated.

original: me dang chu mi bzod pa khyad du bsad du mi rung ba'i nang du rdzas gdon pa'i ched du 'jug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: me dang chu mi bzod pa khyad du bsad du mi rung ba'i nang du rdzas gdon pa'i ched du 'jug par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not enter into the fire or water that is not tolerated, that is, that is not suitable to be disregarded, for the purpose of relinquishing the goods.

original: gnas mal gyi ltung byed do zhes bya ba de @285a * //
analyzed: gnas mal gyi ltung byed do zhes bya ba de @285a * //
translated: It is a downfall to be confessed by a monk who is in charge of bedding.

original: bshad zin to /
analyzed: bshad zin to /
translated: This has been explained.

original: // /'ding ba'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /🔽khyim gzhan du 'ding bar byas pa khyim bdag la dris te dor bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /🔽khyim pa'i khyim gzhan du rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa'i gding ba rang gis byas sam /
analyzed: // /'ding ba'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas / khyim gzhan du 'ding bar byas pa khyim bdag la dris te dor bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te / khyim pa'i khyim gzhan du rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa'i gding ba rang gis byas sam /
translated: If one wishes to speak about the downfall of spreading out a mat,🔽one should ask the householder and then discard it.

original: gzhan 'ding du bcug pa 'gro khar khyim bdag la dris te dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan 'ding du bcug pa 'gro khar khyim bdag la dris te dor bar bya'o //
translated: If one spreads out a mat of grass, leaves, and so forth in the house of a householder, either by oneself or by having someone else do it, one should ask the householder when one is about to leave and then discard it.

original: dgon par ni yang na glong bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dgon par ni yang na glong bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the wilderness, one should either roll it up or put it away.

original: gal te dgon par gding ba byas par gyur na yang glong bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te dgon par gding ba byas par gyur na yang glong bar bya'o //
translated: If one has spread it out in the wilderness, one should either roll it up or put it away.

original: yang na gnas de nas gzhan du dor bar bya ste /
analyzed: yang na gnas de nas gzhan du dor bar bya ste /
translated: Or one should move it from that place.

original: yang na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni tha dad par brtag pa'i don to //🔽de ni mgo 'am mjug bzlog pa byas pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba'i sgra ni tha dad par brtag pa'i don to // de ni mgo 'am mjug bzlog pa byas pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The word “or” indicates an alternative.🔽One should know that it is considered to be rolled up or put away if the mat is turned upside down or right side up.

original: slong ba de ni rtsva la sogs pa'i mgo 'am mjug bzlog pa tsam byas pa nyid na byas pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: slong ba de ni rtsva la sogs pa'i mgo 'am mjug bzlog pa tsam byas pa nyid na byas pa nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that it is considered to be rolled up or put away if the mat is turned upside down or right side up.

original: 'dir gzhung ni de dag ji srid du 'ding ba 'dor bar byed pa dang / chom rkun pa dag gis bcom mo //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni de dag ji srid du 'ding ba 'dor bar byed pa dang / chom rkun pa dag gis bcom mo //
translated: Here is the text: “As long as they were putting away the mats, they were robbed by thieves.

original: thams cad glong bar byed pa na de dag la nyes dmigs su gyur nas /
analyzed: thams cad glong bar byed pa na de dag la nyes dmigs su gyur nas /
translated: When they rolled up the mats, they were harmed.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: mgo 'am mjug bzlog pas glong bar bya ste /
analyzed: mgo 'am mjug bzlog pas glong bar bya ste /
translated: ‘You should roll up the mats by turning them upside down or right side up.

original: 'gro bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gro bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: You should go.’

original: gos dag bskam pa'i phyir rtsva bting ba yang dor bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gos dag bskam pa'i phyir rtsva bting ba yang dor bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The grass spread out for drying clothes should also be discarded.

original: gos dag bskam pa'i phyir gos dag bskam pa'i gcal du rtsva bting ba byas pa de yang dor bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: gos dag bskam pa'i phyir gos dag bskam pa'i gcal du rtsva bting ba byas pa de yang dor bar bya ba ste /
translated: The grass spread out for drying clothes should be discarded.

original: de yang dor bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽slong ba la dor bar khas len na sbyin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de yang dor bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // slong ba la dor bar khas len na sbyin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This means that it should also be discarded.🔽If one promises to give to a beggar, one should give.

original: rtsva dag bting ba gang zag 'ga' zhig gal te slong na de la sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: rtsva dag bting ba gang zag 'ga' zhig gal te slong na de la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: If someone asks for the grass spread out, one should give it.

original: khyad par ci lta bu can zhig la zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ci lta bu can zhig la zhe na /
translated: What kind of person?

original: dor bar khas len pa ste /
analyzed: dor bar khas len pa ste /
translated: One who promises to discard.

original: gang gis rang gi dgos pa bsgrubs nas dor bar khas len pa de ni dor bar khas len pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis rang gi dgos pa bsgrubs nas dor bar khas len pa de ni dor bar khas len pa ste /
translated: One who promises to discard after fulfilling one's purpose is one who promises to discard.🔽To that kind of person.

original: de la'o // 'chags dag tu rkang mthil gnyis la rtsub na rtsva dag gding bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la'o // 'chags dag tu rkang mthil gnyis la rtsub na rtsva dag gding bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If the soles of the feet are rough in the cold season, one should spread out grass.

original: dge slong yun ring du 'chag pas dge ba'i phyogs rgya cher byed pa dag gis 'chag sa dag tu rkang mthil gnyis la rtsub na rtsva dag gding bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong yun ring du 'chag pas dge ba'i phyogs rgya cher byed pa dag gis 'chag sa dag tu rkang mthil gnyis la rtsub na rtsva dag gding bar bya ba'o //
translated: Monks who have been walking for a long time and who are doing much that is virtuous should spread grass on the walking paths if their feet are sore.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is the teaching:

original: gal te dge slong 'chag pa'i rkang mthil dag la rtsub na de'i tshe 'chags dag tu rtsva dag gding bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te dge slong 'chag pa'i rkang mthil dag la rtsub na de'i tshe 'chags dag tu rtsva dag gding bar bya'o //
translated: If the feet of a monk are sore while he is walking, then he should spread grass on the walking paths.

original: de dag kyang dor bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag kyang dor bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: And those should be discarded.

original: 'chag sar bting ba'i rtsva de dag kyang dor bar bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'chag sar bting ba'i rtsva de dag kyang dor bar bya ba nyid do //
translated: And those grasses that are spread on the walking paths should be discarded.

original: gtong na dor bar bya ba ma yin @285b pa nyid du ma gyur pa dor bar bya ba'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gtong na dor bar bya ba ma yin @285b pa nyid du ma gyur pa dor bar bya ba'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: If they are not discarded, they become not to be discarded.

original: gtong na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gtong na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If they are discarded means

original: 'chag sa btang ba'i dus la bab cing gud du 'gro ba'i dus la nye bar gnas par gyur na'o //
analyzed: 'chag sa btang ba'i dus la bab cing gud du 'gro ba'i dus la nye bar gnas par gyur na'o //
translated: if the time has come to give up the walking path and the time has come to go elsewhere.

original: dor bar bya ba zhes bya ba ni 'chag sar rtsva la sogs pa bkram pa'o //
analyzed: dor bar bya ba zhes bya ba ni 'chag sar rtsva la sogs pa bkram pa'o //
translated: They should be discarded means the grass and so on that are spread on the walking paths.

original: bya ba ma yin pa nyid du ma gyur pa zhes bya ba la bya ba ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: bya ba ma yin pa nyid du ma gyur pa zhes bya ba la bya ba ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: It is not something that should not be done.

original: yang dgram du rung ba nyid ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: yang dgram du rung ba nyid ma yin pa ste /
translated: Something that should not be done is not suitable to be spread out.

original: rdog chags la sogs pas phye mar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rdog chags la sogs pas phye mar gyur pa'o //
translated: It is reduced to dust by trampling and so forth.

original: gal te de ltar gyur na ni de'i tshe sa rdul dang 'dra bar gnas pas /
analyzed: gal te de ltar gyur na ni de'i tshe sa rdul dang 'dra bar gnas pas /
translated: If that were the case, then it would be like earth dust,

original: de la brten nas srog chags dag mi skye ba'i phyir de ni dor bar bya mi dgos pas de'i phyir bya ba ma yin pa nyid du ma gyur pa zhes smos te ;
analyzed: de la brten nas srog chags dag mi skye ba'i phyir de ni dor bar bya mi dgos pas de'i phyir bya ba ma yin pa nyid du ma gyur pa zhes smos te ;
translated: and since living beings would not be born in dependence on it, it would not be necessary to discard it. Therefore, it is said, “it is not something that should not be done.”

original: de ltar sa rdul dang 'dra bar ma gyur cing dgram du rung ba nyid yin pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar sa rdul dang 'dra bar ma gyur cing dgram du rung ba nyid yin pa ste /
translated: It is not like earth dust, but is suitable to be spread out.

original: rtsva la sogs pa dngos po ma nyams par 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: rtsva la sogs pa dngos po ma nyams par 'dug pa'o //
translated: It is grass and so forth that remains without being damaged.

original: de las ni srog chags dag skye ba'i phyir de ni dor bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de las ni srog chags dag skye ba'i phyir de ni dor bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Since living beings are born from it, it should be discarded.

original: gzhan gyi tshe na dus dus su so sor brtag pa dang bsgyur log bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe na dus dus su so sor brtag pa dang bsgyur log bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: At other times, it should be examined from time to time and turned over.

original: gtang ba'i dus las gzhan pa'i tshe mi gtong ba'i dus dag tu ni /
analyzed: gtang ba'i dus las gzhan pa'i tshe mi gtong ba'i dus dag tu ni /
translated: At times other than the time for relinquishing, he should not relinquish.🔽From time to time, he should examine whether or not there are living beings in the grass, etc.

original: rtsva la sogs pa de dag la srog chags yod dam med pa dus dus su so sor brtag pa dang / srog chags mi skye bar bya ba'i phyir dus dus su bsgyur log bya'o //

translated: And from time to time, he should turn over the soil in order to prevent the arising of living beings.🔽If the soil is oily or sweet, then daily.🔽In a place where the soil is oily or sweet, he should turn it over daily.

original: sa snum pa dang mngar ba ni nyin re zhing ngo zhes bya ba la yul gang na sa snum pa dang ; mngar bal gzhan pa yod pa de ni sa snum pa dang mngar ba ste /🔽yul der ni nyin re zhing lan re bsgyur log bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: sa snum pa dang mngar ba ni nyin re zhing ngo zhes bya ba la yul gang na sa snum pa dang ; mngar bal gzhan pa yod pa de ni sa snum pa dang mngar ba ste / yul der ni nyin re zhing lan re bsgyur log bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: This is to be supplied.

original: srin bal la sogs pa srog chags 'phel ba'i nyes pa spang ba'i phyir ro //🔽gzhan du ni zla ba phyed phyed cing ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: srin bal la sogs pa srog chags 'phel ba'i nyes pa spang ba'i phyir ro // gzhan du ni zla ba phyed phyed cing ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In order to prevent the fault of increasing living beings, such as worms, etc.🔽In other places, every half-month.

original: sa snum pa dang mngar ba las gzhan pa'i yul du ni zla ba phyed phyed cing lan re bsgyur log bya'o //
analyzed: sa snum pa dang mngar ba las gzhan pa'i yul du ni zla ba phyed phyed cing lan re bsgyur log bya'o //
translated: In a place other than where the soil is oily or sweet, he should turn it over once every half-month.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gal te sa phyogs snum pa dang mngar ba yin na bting ba nyin re zhing bsgyur log bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gal te sa phyogs snum pa dang mngar ba yin na bting ba nyin re zhing bsgyur log bya'o //
translated: Here the text says: “If the ground is oily and sweet, then the bedding should be turned over every day.

original: 'on te sa phyogs snum pa dang mngar ba ma yin na ni zla ba phyed phyed cing bsgyur log bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on te sa phyogs snum pa dang mngar ba ma yin na ni zla ba phyed phyed cing bsgyur log bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: But if the ground is not oily and sweet, then it should be turned over every half month.”

original: 'chags dag tu rtsva'i chun po dag thag pas bcings te shing ljon pa la dpyangs shing gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'chags dag tu rtsva'i chun po dag thag pas bcings te shing ljon pa la dpyangs shing gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: 'chag sa dag tu 'chag sar dgram pa'i theb tu rtsva'i chun po dag thag pas bcings te shing ljon pa la dpyangs shing gzhag par bya'o //

original: lci ba gyo mor gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lci ba gyo mor gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: 'dag rdzas kyi rgyu lci ba bum pa la sogs pa @286a * //

analyzed: 'chag pa'i gyo mo'i steng du gzhag par bya'o //
translated: should be placed on the ground of the walking area.

original: gnas nas 'phags par 'gyur ba na zhes bya ba yan chad sngar thal ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnas nas 'phags par 'gyur ba na zhes bya ba yan chad sngar thal ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The earlier passage is the first part of the sutra that states:🔽When you rise from your seat, if you are not going to a dangerous place, then you should gather your bedding.🔽The earlier passage is the first part of the sutra that states:

analyzed: sngar mdo las gnas nas 'phags par 'gyur ba na nyam ngab dang phrad par mi 'gyur ba lta na gnas mal bsdu bar bya'o zhes smos pa de yan chad du gnas mal gyi bslab pa'i gzhir gtogs pa bslab pa'i gzhi de dang 'brel ba gang ji snyed gong
translated: When you rise from your seat, if you are not going to a dangerous place, then you should gather your bedding.

analyzed: du smos pa de dag thams cad 'ding ba'i bslab pa'i gzhi 'dir ci 'os su sbyar bar rig par bya ste /
translated: All the bases of training that are included in the training on bedding that are mentioned above should be applied to this training on bedding as appropriate.

analyzed: de las khri la sogs pa smos pa ni 'dir sbyar bar mi bya'i /
translated: The mention of thrones and so on should not be applied here.🔽The statement, “Up to forty-nine

analyzed: 'di ltar 'dom bzhi bcu rtsa dgu tshun chad ni de'i nyen kor ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ni 'dir yang 'dra bar sbyar ro //

translated: Just as the training precept on bedding states, “Except in extenuating circumstances, if a monk does not request permission to sit on a seat, he commits an offense,” the extensive presentation of the bases of training on bedding should be applied to this training precept on spreading bedding.

original: cig car spyod spyod pa ni 'dra ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni cig car spyod na thams cad kyis dor ba la sogs pa bya bar 'dra ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: cig car spyod spyod pa ni 'dra ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni cig car spyod na thams cad kyis dor ba la sogs pa bya bar 'dra ba nyid yin no //
translated: The phrase “the conduct is similar” means that if they use the bedding simultaneously, the conduct of all is similar in that they must discard the bedding and so on.

analyzed: 'ding ba ni so sor longs spyad pa'i yan lag yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: de lta bas na 'di la ni cha gang la cha gang gis longs spyad pa de de nyid kyis dor bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di la ni cha gang la cha gang gis longs spyad pa de de nyid kyis dor bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the portion of the robe that was used by a certain part of the body should be discarded by that same part of the body.

analyzed: dge 'dun gyi ma yin par ni gnas de'i bdag po rnams la 'dri bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gnas ma yin par 'ding bdor ba ni /

analyzed: gnas de'i bdag po rnams la dri bar bya zhing dor bar bya ba nyid yin no //

analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //

analyzed: sa gzhir zhes bya ba ni /

translated: The monastery from which one is expelled is the monastery of the Saṅgha if it is the monastery of the Saṅgha.

analyzed: ci bsam pa thams cad kyis de gnyis byed pa po nyid yin nam zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: Are these two the instigators of this transgression?

original: gal te de la gnod pa dang / dge 'dun 'khrug pa skye ba nye bar zhi bar mi 'gyur ba'i gnyen por 'dod pa ma yin na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gal te de la gnod pa dang / dge 'dun 'khrug pa skye ba nye bar zhi bar mi 'gyur ba'i gnyen por 'dod pa ma yin na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If the instigator does not wish to calm the harm done and the schism in the Saṅgha.

analyzed: de la gnod pa dang dge 'dun 'khrug pa ni de la gnod pa dang / dge 'dun 'khrug pa gnyis so //

analyzed: de gnyis skye ba dang nye bar zhi bar mi 'gyur ba ni /
translated: The non-arising and the non-pacification of these two are

analyzed: gal te de'i gnyen por 'dod pa ma yin na de'i tshe yan lag sngar bstan pa gnyis byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: If the instigator does not wish to calm the harm done and the schism in the Saṅgha, then the two members previously mentioned are the instigator.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /

translated: If there is a fear that the monk to be expelled will harm the community, up to the point of taking life, or if there is a fear that the harm that has arisen will not be pacified, or if there is a fear that a schism in the community will arise,

original: skyes pa nye bar zhi bar mi 'gyur bar dogs pa yod na /
analyzed: skyes pa nye bar zhi bar mi 'gyur bar dogs pa yod na /

analyzed: gal te de dag gi gnyen por 'dod pa ma yin na ni de'i tshe yan lag sngar bstan pa gnyis byed pa po nyid yin no //

analyzed: de gnyis gang la byed pa po nyid yin zhe na de'i phyir / skrod pa la'o zhes bya ba smras te /

translated: With regard to the expulsion of a monk.

original: sus she na de'i phyir gzhan gyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
