translated: The text says, “If a bhikṣu knowingly places his foot on a roof above the saṅgha’s temple on a building with a flat roof or on a bed or bench with detachable legs, he commits an offense.”

original: gzhan dag gis brjod pas so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis brjod pas so zhes gsungs so //
translated: The Exposition of the Prātimokṣa says, “One knows by oneself or others tell one.”

original: rtsa ba 'byung ba la 'dug pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: rtsa ba 'byung ba la 'dug pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The root downfall of remaining in a place with elements has been explained.

original: // / srog chags dang bcas pa la spyod pa'i ltung byed brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / srog chags dang bcas pa la spyod pa'i ltung byed brjod par bya ste /
translated: The downfall of using water containing living beings🔽This downfall and the following downfall called “using water containing living beings” both appear to correspond to the following statements in the Sutra of Individual Liberation:

original: ltung byed 'di dang 'og nas srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod pa zhes bya ba'i ltung byed 'byung ba de gnyis ni so sor thar pa'i mdo las yang dge slong gang shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus rtsva 'am lci ba'am sa la 'debs
analyzed: ltung byed 'di dang 'og nas srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod pa zhes bya ba'i ltung byed 'byung ba de gnyis ni so sor thar pa'i mdo las yang dge slong gang shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chus rtsva 'am lci ba'am sa la 'debs
translated: “If a fully ordained monk knowingly uses water containing living beings to water grass, clay, or earth,🔽or has it done, he commits a downfall.

original: sam / 'debs su 'jug na ltung byed do zhes bya ba dang / yang dge slong gang shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod na ltung byed do zhes gsungs pas tshul dang 'dra bar snang ste /
analyzed: sam / 'debs su 'jug na ltung byed do zhes bya ba dang / yang dge slong gang shes bzhin du srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod na ltung byed do zhes gsungs pas tshul dang 'dra bar snang ste /
translated: “If a fully ordained monk knowingly uses water containing living beings, he commits a downfall.”

original: rang spyod pa ma yin pa dang / rang spyod pa zhes bya ba'i yul gyi bye brag gis ni de gnyis ltung ba tha dad pa nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang spyod pa ma yin pa dang / rang spyod pa zhes bya ba'i yul gyi bye brag gis ni de gnyis ltung ba tha dad pa nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The two are taught to be separate downfalls due to the distinction of the object of one’s own use and the object of another’s use.

original: rang spyod pa'i don nyid de las gzhan la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rang spyod pa'i don nyid de las gzhan la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: “The object of one’s own use and that which is other than that” is stated.

original: rang gi spyod pa ni rang spyod pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi spyod pa ni rang spyod pa'o //
translated: One’s own use is one’s own use.

original: gang la dgos pa de yod pa ni de'i don te /
analyzed: gang la dgos pa de yod pa ni de'i don te /
translated: That which has a purpose is the object of that.

original: de ni rang spyod pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ni rang spyod pa'i don to //
translated: That is the object of one’s own use.

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
translated: The thing of that is that itself.

original: rang spyod pa'i don nyid la ni 'og nas srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod pa zhes 'byung ba'i bslab pa'i gzhi de rnam par gzhag go / de las gzhan la'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang spyod pa'i don nyid la ni 'og nas srog chags dang bcas pa'i chu la spyod pa zhes 'byung ba'i bslab pa'i gzhi de rnam par gzhag go / de las gzhan la'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The basis of training that is stated below, “using water containing living beings,” is established in the object of one’s own use.

original: rang spyod pa'i don nyid ces bya ba de las gzhan ba ste /
analyzed: rang spyod pa'i don nyid ces bya ba de las gzhan ba ste /
translated: “That which is other than that” is other than the object of one’s own use.

original: rang spyod pa ma yin pa la'o //
analyzed: rang spyod pa ma yin pa la'o //
translated: It is not one’s own use.

original: de la srog chags dang bcas pa la spyod pa zhes bya ba'i bslab pa'i gzhi 'di nyid rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de la srog chags dang bcas pa la spyod pa zhes bya ba'i bslab pa'i gzhi 'di nyid rnam par gzhag go //
translated: This is how the training precept called “using water containing living beings” is formulated.

original: lhag ma ni 'og ma kho na las khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni 'og ma kho na las khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be understood from the following.

original: srog chags dang bcas pa la spyod pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: srog chags dang bcas pa la spyod pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The downfall of using water containing living beings has been explained.

original: // / gtsug lag khang gi ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: // / gtsug lag khang gi ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /
translated: The downfall of speaking in a temple

original: sgo cha gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sgo cha gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: “If you want to speak, you should open the door.”

original: sgo cha zhes bya ba ni sgo skyes la sogs pa sgo dang 'brel pa'i yo byad do //
analyzed: sgo cha zhes bya ba ni sgo skyes la sogs pa sgo dang 'brel pa'i yo byad do //
translated: “Door” means the door fittings and so forth that are attached to the door.

original: de dag gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de dang por @289b gzugs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /'dir sgo cha zhes smos pas sgo dang 'brel ba'i yo byad thams cad kyang ma bsdus te /
analyzed: de dag gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de dang por @289b gzugs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /'dir sgo cha zhes smos pas sgo dang 'brel ba'i yo byad thams cad kyang ma bsdus te /
translated: “You should open it” means you should open it first. Here, by mentioning “door,” all the fittings attached to the door are included.

original: 'di ltar ya phubs la sogs pa lhag ma dag ni 'phral la gzhug par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar ya phubs la sogs pa lhag ma dag ni 'phral la gzhug par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because the remaining parts, such as the lintel, are to be opened immediately.

original: 'dir gzhung ni sgo cha gong ma bcug na ni dngos gzhi'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni sgo cha gong ma bcug na ni dngos gzhi'o //
translated: Here, the text says: “If one inserts the upper part of the door, it is the actual basis.

original: sgo cha gzhan ma bcug na ni nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sgo cha gzhan ma bcug na ni nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one does not insert the other part of the door, it is a minor offense.”

original: sgo glegs kyang ngo zhes bya ba la 'dir sgo glegs zhes bya ba ni sgo leb la bya ste /
analyzed: sgo glegs kyang ngo zhes bya ba la 'dir sgo glegs zhes bya ba ni sgo leb la bya ste /
translated: “Also the door-sill” means that here the door-sill is called the door-panel.

original: de yang gzhug par bya'o //🔽skar khung dag kyang gdod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de yang gzhug par bya'o // skar khung dag kyang gdod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That should be inserted.🔽“Also the windows” means

original: ngos kyi skar khung dag kyang gdod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: ngos kyi skar khung dag kyang gdod par bya ba'o //
translated: that the windows on the sides should be made.

original: ltung ba 'di la byed pa po nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: ltung ba 'di la byed pa po nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the agent of this downfall?

original: de'i phyir / gtsug lag khang ni byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gtsug lag khang ni byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore, it says, “The agent is the one who builds the temple.”

original: tshad ji tsam zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: tshad ji tsam zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: What is the measure? Therefore, it says,

original: spyod lam bzhi shong ba'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: spyod lam bzhi shong ba'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: “It is the size that can accommodate the four postures.”

original: gtsug lag khang du spyod lam rnam bzhi byar rung zhing shong ba'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du spyod lam rnam bzhi byar rung zhing shong ba'o //
translated: It is the size that can accommodate the four postures in the temple.

original: ci gtsug lag khang tshad de tsam dang ldan pa thams cad byed pa po yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci gtsug lag khang tshad de tsam dang ldan pa thams cad byed pa po yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is the agent the one who builds any temple that has that measure?

original: de'i phyir gal te thams cad rdo 'am so phag gam shing las byas pa ma yin na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te thams cad rdo 'am so phag gam shing las byas pa ma yin na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, if it is not made of stone, brick, or wood, it is the maker.

original: gal te thams cad ril gyis rdo las byas pa 'am /
analyzed: gal te thams cad ril gyis rdo las byas pa 'am /
translated: If it is not made entirely of stone,

original: so phag so btang ba las byas pa 'am /
analyzed: so phag so btang ba las byas pa 'am /
translated: or made of bricks or wood,

original: shing las byas pa ma yin na byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: shing las byas pa ma yin na byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: it is the maker.

original: de dag las byas pa na byed pa po nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag las byas pa na byed pa po nyid ma yin no //
translated: When they are made, it is not the maker.

original: gtsug lag khang ni thams cad kyang byed pa po nyid yin te /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang ni thams cad kyang byed pa po nyid yin te /
translated: The monastery is the maker,

original: dge 'dun mnga' ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: dge 'dun mnga' ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: not only when it belongs to the Saṅgha,

original: gang zag dang khyim pa dbang ba yang byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang zag dang khyim pa dbang ba yang byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: but also when it belongs to an individual or a householder.

original: char chu bskyab pa'i g-yogs pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: char chu bskyab pa'i g-yogs pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: A roof to protect against rain is also.

original: gal te ma byas na byed pa po nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: gal te ma byas na byed pa po nyid yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: If it is not made, it is the maker.

original: gal te char chu bskyab pa'i phyir lo ma la sogs pas 'phro ma g-yogs na'o //
analyzed: gal te char chu bskyab pa'i phyir lo ma la sogs pas 'phro ma g-yogs na'o //
translated: If it is not covered with grass, leaves, and so on to protect against rain,🔽it is the maker.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa dge slong gis rtsig pa'i rim pa gnyis sam gsum dag las lhag par brtsig cing de la ltung byed du yang mi 'gyur ba mchis sam /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa dge slong gis rtsig pa'i rim pa gnyis sam gsum dag las lhag par brtsig cing de la ltung byed du yang mi 'gyur ba mchis sam /
translated: “Venerable! Is it permissible for a fully ordained monk to build a wall two or three stories high and not commit an offense?

original: yod de rtsa dag gis g-yogs par byed na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: yod de rtsa dag gis g-yogs par byed na ltung ba med do //
translated: If he covers it with grass, there is no offense.

original: spang leb dag gis g-yogs par byed na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: spang leb dag gis g-yogs par byed na ltung ba med do //
translated: If he covers it with planks, there is no offense.

original: shing leb dag gis g-yogs par byed na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: shing leb dag gis g-yogs par byed na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If he covers it with wooden boards, there is no offense.”🔽Is the owner of the monastery the one who commits all the offenses?

original: ci ltung ba 'byin par byed pa thams cad la gtsug lag khang 'di byed pa po nyid yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ltung ba 'byin par byed pa thams cad la gtsug lag khang 'di byed pa po nyid yin nam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: de'i phyir yon bdag gis byas sam zin nas blta'o @290a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir yon bdag gis byas sam zin nas blta'o @290a * //
translated: Therefore, if the owner has it built, it should be examined after it is completed.

original: ma smras pa la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ma smras pa la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If he does not say anything, there is no offense.

original: gal te yon bdag gis 'di skad ces gtsug lag khang byas nas blta'o zhe'am zin nas blta'o zhes dge slong ma la smras na dge slong de la gtsug lag khang de byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: gal te yon bdag gis 'di skad ces gtsug lag khang byas nas blta'o zhe'am zin nas blta'o zhes dge slong ma la smras na dge slong de la gtsug lag khang de byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: If the patron says to the nun, “I will see it built or I will see it finished,” then that monk is the builder of that monastery.

original: gal te de skad smra na de la nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de skad smra na de la nyes par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If he says that, there is no offense for him.

original: gang la de byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang la de byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
translated: But who is the builder of that monastery?

original: de'i phyir pha gu rim pa gsum las lhag par rtsig pa byas pa la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir pha gu rim pa gsum las lhag par rtsig pa byas pa la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “If he has it built with more than three layers of plaster.”

original: pha gu rim pa gsum las lhag par rtsig pa byas pa la gtsug lag khang de byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: pha gu rim pa gsum las lhag par rtsig pa byas pa la gtsug lag khang de byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: If he has it built with more than three layers of plaster, then that monastery is the builder of that monastery.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is the teaching:

original: nyin gcig la pha gu dag gis rim pa gsum brtsig par bya'i ;
analyzed: nyin gcig la pha gu dag gis rim pa gsum brtsig par bya'i ;
translated: He should have it built with three layers of plaster in one day.

original: de las lhag par brtsig par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / ci bdag nyid kho nas sam zhe na de'i phyir /🔽gzhan gyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de las lhag par brtsig par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / ci bdag nyid kho nas sam zhe na de'i phyir /🔽gzhan gyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The meaning is that he should not have it built with more than that.🔽If he has it built with more than that, his act constitutes a serious transgression.🔽If he has it built with more than that, his act constitutes a minor transgression.

original: 'dir gzhung ni byed du bcug na zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni byed du bcug na zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text says, “if one is made to build.”

original: gang gi tshe brtsigs na zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe brtsigs na zhe na /
translated: When is it built?

original: de'i phyir / nyi ma de la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / nyi ma de la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “on that day.”

original: nyi ma gang la rim pa gsum rtsig pa'i nyi ma de nyid la gal te lhag par brtsigs na'o //
analyzed: nyi ma gang la rim pa gsum rtsig pa'i nyi ma de nyid la gal te lhag par brtsigs na'o //
translated: If one builds an extra story on the very day on which the three stories are built,

original: nyi ma dang po la rim pa bzhi rtsig cing nyi ma gnyis ba la rim pa gnyis brtsegs na yang nyi ma dang po la lhag pa gang yin pa de nyi ma gnyis pa'i nyung ba'i khar brtsi bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: nyi ma dang po la rim pa bzhi rtsig cing nyi ma gnyis ba la rim pa gnyis brtsegs na yang nyi ma dang po la lhag pa gang yin pa de nyi ma gnyis pa'i nyung ba'i khar brtsi bar mi 'gyur /
translated: if one builds four stories on the first day and two stories on the second day, then whatever is extra on the first day is not to be added to the shortage on the second day.

original: de bzhin du nyi ma gnyis pa la lhag par rtsig pa gang yin pa de yang nyi ma dang po'i rim pa nyung ba'i khar brtsi bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nyi ma gnyis pa la lhag par rtsig pa gang yin pa de yang nyi ma dang po'i rim pa nyung ba'i khar brtsi bar mi bya'o //
translated: Similarly, whatever is extra on the second day is not to be added to the shortage on the first day.

original: gzhan la yang 'jim pa med pa las so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan la yang 'jim pa med pa las so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “And on another day, without clay” means

original: nyi ma gzhan la yang pha gu 'jim pa med pa gsum las lhag par rtsig pa byas na gtsug lag khang de /
analyzed: nyi ma gzhan la yang pha gu 'jim pa med pa gsum las lhag par rtsig pa byas na gtsug lag khang de /
translated: if one builds an extra fence on another day with less than three parts of clay, then that monastery

original: ltung ba'i byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: ltung ba'i byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: The one who causes the downfall is the one who builds the monastery.

original: de lta bas na 'jim pa med pa yang rim par bgrang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'jim pa med pa yang rim par bgrang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, even if there is no clay, the measurements must be observed.

original: chu khung dag ma btod pa rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chu khung dag ma btod pa rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is permissible not to dig a trench for water.

original: chu khung dag ma btod pa la ni nyi ma gzhan la pha gu rim pa gsum las lhag par rim brtsig pa byas na gtsug lag khang de ltung ba'i byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: chu khung dag ma btod pa la ni nyi ma gzhan la pha gu rim pa gsum las lhag par rim brtsig pa byas na gtsug lag khang de ltung ba'i byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: If one builds a wall higher than three stories without digging a trench for water, the one who causes the downfall is the one who builds the monastery.

original: 'di skad bstan te /🔽gal te rang gi gnas su chu khung btod pa la ni pha gu rim pa las lhag par rtsig pa byas na yang nyes pa med la /🔽rang gi gnas su chu khung ma btod pa la ni pha gu rim pa gsum las lhag par rtsig pa byas na dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / gal te rang gi gnas su chu khung btod pa la ni pha gu rim pa las lhag par rtsig pa byas na yang nyes pa med la / rang gi gnas su chu khung ma btod pa la ni pha gu rim pa gsum las lhag par rtsig pa byas na dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is taught.🔽If one digs a trench for water in one's own dwelling place, there is no fault in building a wall higher than three stories.🔽If one does not dig a trench for water in one's own dwelling place, building a wall higher than three stories becomes a downfall.

original: chu khung btod pa'i gnas yan chad nas rim pa gsum bgrang bar bya'o //
analyzed: chu khung btod pa'i gnas yan chad nas rim pa gsum bgrang bar bya'o //
translated: The counting of the three stories begins from the place where a trench for water is dug.

original: @290b brkos te rmang gang gi rtsig pa ma btsugs pa nyid kyang rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: @290b brkos te rmang gang gi rtsig pa ma btsugs pa nyid kyang rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is also permissible to dig the ground and not build the foundation walls.

original: sa brkos te rmang gi rtsa ba gzugs par bya'o //
analyzed: sa brkos te rmang gi rtsa ba gzugs par bya'o //
translated: One should dig the ground and build the foundation walls.

original: brkos te rmang gi rtsa ba ma btsugs pa nyid yin na de la ni nyi ma gzhan la yang pha gu rim pa gsum las lhag par rtsig pa bdag nyid kyis byas sam /🔽gzhan byed du bcug na yang thams cad du dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brkos te rmang gi rtsa ba ma btsugs pa nyid yin na de la ni nyi ma gzhan la yang pha gu rim pa gsum las lhag par rtsig pa bdag nyid kyis byas sam / gzhan byed du bcug na yang thams cad du dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one digs the ground and does not build the foundation walls, then even on another day, if one builds a wall higher than three times the height of a forearm, whether one does it oneself or has another do it, it is a root downfall.

original: gal te brkos te rmang gi rtsa ba btsugs pa nyid yin na de la ni nyi ma gzhan la pha gu rim pa gsum las lhag par brtsigs kyang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gal te brkos te rmang gi rtsa ba btsugs pa nyid yin na de la ni nyi ma gzhan la pha gu rim pa gsum las lhag par brtsigs kyang nyes pa med do //
translated: If one digs the ground and builds the foundation walls, then even if one builds a wall higher than three times the height of a forearm on another day, there is no fault.

original: sgo cha gong ma ma btsugs pa yang rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sgo cha gong ma ma btsugs pa yang rung ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is also permissible to not build the upper part of the door frame.

original: sgo cha gong ma zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sgo cha gong ma zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The upper part of the door frame

original: ya phubs la sogs pa'i sgo cha ni sgo cha gong ma ste /
analyzed: ya phubs la sogs pa'i sgo cha ni sgo cha gong ma ste /
translated: is the upper part of the door frame of the upper story, such as the roof.

original: de ma btsugs pa la yang nyi ma gzhan la pha gu rim pa gsum las lhag par brtsigs na yang dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ma btsugs pa la yang nyi ma gzhan la pha gu rim pa gsum las lhag par brtsigs na yang dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not built, then even if one builds a wall higher than three stories on another day, it becomes a root downfall.

original: gal te sgo cha gong ma de btsugs pa yin na de la ni pha gu rim pa gsum las lhag par brtsigs kyang nyes pa med de /
analyzed: gal te sgo cha gong ma de btsugs pa yin na de la ni pha gu rim pa gsum las lhag par brtsigs kyang nyes pa med de /
translated: If the upper part of the door is built, then there is no fault in building a wall higher than three stories.

original: sgo cha btsugs pa yan chad nas rim pa gsum bgrang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sgo cha btsugs pa yan chad nas rim pa gsum bgrang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The counting of the three stories begins from the building of the upper part of the door.

original: mdo gong ma gsum char las rung ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra smos pa ni de dag gi rim pa rnams la ltung ba'i phyir so sor gtso bo yin bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo gong ma gsum char las rung ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra smos pa ni de dag gi rim pa rnams la ltung ba'i phyir so sor gtso bo yin bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “appropriate” in the above three sūtras is mentioned because the individual stories are principal in that they are downfalls.

original: dang po'i mdun rol ni nyes pa med de zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dang po'i mdun rol ni nyes pa med de zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There is no fault if the first story is built.

original: pha gu rim pa gsum las lhag par rtsig pa byas na dngos gzhi'o zhes bstan pas na 'dir yang dngos gzhi'i rgyur gyur pa rim pa lhag par rtsig go snyam pa na /
analyzed: pha gu rim pa gsum las lhag par rtsig pa byas na dngos gzhi'o zhes bstan pas na 'dir yang dngos gzhi'i rgyur gyur pa rim pa lhag par rtsig go snyam pa na /
translated: Since it is taught that building a wall higher than three stories is a root downfall, if one thinks that building a higher story is a cause of a root downfall,

original: lhag pa dang po rtsig pa'i mdun rol du rim pa gsum rtsig pa'i tshe na ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas su 'gyur te /
analyzed: lhag pa dang po rtsig pa'i mdun rol du rim pa gsum rtsig pa'i tshe na ni sbyor ba'i nyes byas su 'gyur te /
translated: If one constructs the first excess in front of a wall, when one constructs the third story, one commits the preparatory act of a partial defeat.

original: sbyor ba thams cad la nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba thams cad la nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that all preparations are wrong actions.

original: de ltar dngos gzhi'i mdun rol du ni sbyor ba yin pas de'i phyir nyes pa de kun la thal bar 'gyur ba bsal ba'i phyir mdo 'di brjod de /
analyzed: de ltar dngos gzhi'i mdun rol du ni sbyor ba yin pas de'i phyir nyes pa de kun la thal bar 'gyur ba bsal ba'i phyir mdo 'di brjod de /
translated: Thus, since the first excess is a preparation for the actual basis, in order to eliminate the fault that all of these would be consequential, this sutra is stated.

original: ltung ba'i rgyur gyur pa lhag pa dang po rim pa bzhi pa'i mdun rol du nyi ma gzhan la rim pa snga ma dag brtsigs pa de la ni sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: ltung ba'i rgyur gyur pa lhag pa dang po rim pa bzhi pa'i mdun rol du nyi ma gzhan la rim pa snga ma dag brtsigs pa de la ni sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault called preparation for the first excess that is a cause of a downfall, when on another day one constructs the previous stories in front of the fourth story.

original: 'di ltar rim pa gsum brtsigs pa'i steng du nyi ma de nyid la rim pa bzhi pa rtsig pa'i phyir pha gu la sogs pa la 'dzin pa rtsom par byed pa de'i tshe na ni /🔽sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar rim pa gsum brtsigs pa'i steng du nyi ma de nyid la rim pa bzhi pa rtsig pa'i phyir pha gu la sogs pa la 'dzin pa rtsom par byed pa de'i tshe na ni /🔽sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i nyes byas so //
translated: Thus, when one begins to construct the fourth story on top of the three stories that have been constructed on that very day, in order to construct the fourth story, one commits the wrong action called preparation.

original: de brtsigs na ni dngos gzhir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / gtsug lag khang gi @291a * //
analyzed: de brtsigs na ni dngos gzhir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / gtsug lag khang gi @291a * //
translated: The meaning is that if one builds it, it becomes the actual basis.

original: ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The downfall of “in a temple” has been explained.

original: // / ma bskos par ston pa'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: // / ma bskos par ston pa'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /
translated: The downfall of “not appointed” is incurred when, wishing to speak,

original: pham par 'gyur ba ma byung ba mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang ma mo 'dzin pa lo nyi shu las mi nyung ba grong khyer pa'i skad smra ba dge slong ma la lus nye bar gzhol ba nyid kyi phyir bcos pa byas pa dge slong ma'i ston par🔽bsko'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba ma byung ba mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang ma mo 'dzin pa lo nyi shu las mi nyung ba grong khyer pa'i skad smra ba dge slong ma la lus nye bar gzhol ba nyid kyi phyir bcos pa byas pa dge slong ma'i ston par bsko'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: one says, “A monk who has not incurred a defeating offense, who is learned, who is an upholder of the discourses, the monastic code, and the scriptures, who is at least twenty years old, who speaks the local language, and who has been purified of any physical impediments should be appointed as a teacher of the nuns.”

original: dge slong pham par 'gyur ba ma byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa dge slong ma'i ston par bsko'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dge slong pham par 'gyur ba ma byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa dge slong ma'i ston par bsko'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: A monk who has not incurred a defeating offense and who possesses the other qualities should be appointed as a teacher of the nuns.

original: pham par 'gyur ba ma byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba ma byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “A defeating offense” means

analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba'i ltung ba ma byung ba ste /

analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba ma byung ba ni pham par ma gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: mdo sde dang 'dul ba dang ma mo 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “who is learned in the Sūtra Piṭaka, the Vinaya Piṭaka, and the Mātṛkā” means

analyzed: lo nyi shu las mi nyung ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “who is at least twenty years old” means

analyzed: de yang bsnyen par rdzogs pa nas brtsams te lo nyi shu lon pa'o //

analyzed: grong khyer ba'i skad smra ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “who speaks the language of the country” means

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyi dbang du byas te /

translated: In reality, the fourteenth day of the lunar month is the fifteenth day.

original: gso sbyong zhes smos pa 'dis ni dge 'dun gyis de'i nyin mo sngar gso sbyong bya zhing de'i 'og tu dge slong ma'i ston pa bsko bar bya ba'i don de ston par byed do //

translated: The term “purification day” indicates that the Saṅgha should perform the purification ceremony on that day and then appoint a teacher for the nuns.

original: phyogs gang du bsko bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: phyogs gang du bsko bar bya zhe na /
translated: In which direction should the teacher be appointed?

original: de'i phyir mtshams kyi nang du'o zhes bya ba smras so //🔽gal te mdo sde la sogs pa 'dzin pa med na ji lta bu las bsko bar bya zhe na de'i phyir /

translated: Therefore, it is said, “within the boundary.”🔽If there is no one who upholds the sūtras and so on, from whom should the teacher be appointed? Therefore, it is said,

analyzed: mdo sde la sogs pa 'dzin pa med na so sor thar pa thon pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: “If there is no one who upholds the sūtras and so on, then from one who recites the Prātimokṣa.”

original: de yang na pham par 'gyur ba'am lci ba'i chos rnams ston par nus pa'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽so sor thar pa thon pa de yang med na dge slong ma'i pham par 'gyur ba brgyad dam /
analyzed: de yang na pham par 'gyur ba'am lci ba'i chos rnams ston par nus pa'o zhes bya ba ni / so sor thar pa thon pa de yang med na dge slong ma'i pham par 'gyur ba brgyad dam /
translated: And she should be able to teach the defeats and the serious rules.

original: lci ba'i chos rnams gang gis don dang tshig gi sgo nas ston nus pa'i ngang tshul can de bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: lci ba'i chos rnams gang gis don dang tshig gi sgo nas ston nus pa'i ngang tshul can de bsko bar bya'o //
translated: If there is no one who has mastered the Pratimoksha, then a nun who is able to teach the eight defeats of a nun or the serious rules, both in meaning and in words, should be appointed.🔽If there is no one like that, then who should be appointed?

original: de yang med na ji lta bu las bsko bar bya zhe na de'i phyir phyi ma ni sring mo dag ci khyed cag dge slong ma'i dge 'dun tshogs sam yongs su dag gam mthun nam kha na ma tho ba med dam /
analyzed: de yang med na ji lta bu las bsko bar bya zhe na de'i phyir phyi ma ni sring mo dag ci khyed cag dge slong ma'i dge 'dun tshogs sam yongs su dag gam mthun nam kha na ma tho ba med dam /
translated: Therefore, the latter is: Sisters, is the assembly of the Sangha of nuns complete? Are you pure? Are you in harmony? Are you without offense?

original: khyed cag la dge 'dun gyis ma bskos pa'i gang zag 'ba' zhig sten par mi byed dam khyed cag la ston pa'i gang zag ni 'ga' zhig dge 'dun las 'ong ngo //
analyzed: khyed cag la dge 'dun gyis ma bskos pa'i gang zag 'ba' zhig sten par mi byed dam khyed cag la ston pa'i gang zag ni 'ga' zhig dge 'dun las 'ong ngo //
translated: “Do you not rely on anyone who is not appointed by the Saṅgha?” “Your teacher comes from the Saṅgha.”

original: khyed cag la dge slong 'ga' zhig yang ston par mi spro'o //
analyzed: khyed cag la dge slong 'ga' zhig yang ston par mi spro'o //
translated: “No bhikṣu is willing to be your teacher.”

original: khyed cag gi gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa ni dge 'dun las so //
analyzed: khyed cag gi gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa ni dge 'dun las so //
translated: “Your instructions and your further teachings come from the Saṅgha.”

original: sring mo dag gis bag yod par sgrubs shig ces bya ba de ston nus pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sring mo dag gis bag yod par sgrubs shig ces bya ba de ston nus pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: “Sisters, you should practice heedfulness.” This is what can be taught.

original: dge slong ma'i ston pa phyi ma ni de lta bu las bsko bar bya'o zhes @292a * //
analyzed: dge slong ma'i ston pa phyi ma ni de lta bu las bsko bar bya'o zhes @292a * //
translated: “The later teacher of bhikṣuṇīs should be appointed in this way.”

original: bya bar sbyar ro //🔽sring mo dag ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: bya bar sbyar ro // sring mo dag ces bya ba ni /
translated: This is how it should be applied.🔽“Sisters” means

original: kye sring mo dag ces bod pa'o //
analyzed: kye sring mo dag ces bod pa'o //
translated: “Hey, sisters!”

original: ci zhes bya ba ni dri ba'i tshig go //🔽khyed cag dge slong ma'i dge 'dun tshogs sam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ci zhes bya ba ni dri ba'i tshig go // khyed cag dge slong ma'i dge 'dun tshogs sam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “What?” is a word for asking.🔽“Is the assembly of bhikṣuṇīs complete?” means

original: khyed cag dge slong ma'i dge 'dun las gcig tu byed dam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyed cag dge slong ma'i dge 'dun las gcig tu byed dam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Are you acting as one with the assembly of bhikṣuṇīs?”

original: yongs su dag gam zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: yongs su dag gam zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: Are you completely pure?

original: pham par 'gyur ba ma byung ngam /
analyzed: pham par 'gyur ba ma byung ngam /
translated: Have you not incurred a defeating offense?

original: ltung ba gzhan dag kyang bshags pa dang byin gyis brlabs pa gnyis kyis phyir bcos pa byas sam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ltung ba gzhan dag kyang bshags pa dang byin gyis brlabs pa gnyis kyis phyir bcos pa byas sam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Have you confessed and received absolution for any other offenses?

original: mthun nam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mthun nam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Are you in agreement?

original: phan tshun mthun nam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phan tshun mthun nam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Are you in harmony with each other?

original: kha na ma tho ba med dam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med dam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Are you free from blame?

original: 'thab mo la sogs pa'i skyon dang bral lam zhes bya ba'o //🔽khyed cag la dge 'dun gyis ma bskos pa'i gang zag 'ga' zhig ston par mi byed dam zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'thab mo la sogs pa'i skyon dang bral lam zhes bya ba'o // khyed cag la dge 'dun gyis ma bskos pa'i gang zag 'ga' zhig ston par mi byed dam zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Are you free from the faults of quarreling and so on?🔽 Are you not being taught by someone who has not been appointed by the Saṅgha?

original: khyed cag la dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis ma bskos pa'i gang zag 'ga' zhig thugs thub tu ston pa med grang zhes 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: khyed cag la dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis ma bskos pa'i gang zag 'ga' zhig thugs thub tu ston pa med grang zhes 'dri ba'o //
translated: Are you not being taught by someone who has not been appointed by the Saṅgha of monks?

original: khyed cag la ston pa'i gang zag ni 'ga' zhig dge 'dun las 'ong ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyed cag la ston pa'i gang zag ni 'ga' zhig dge 'dun las 'ong ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Your teacher will come from the Saṅgha.🔽

original: khyed cag la ston pa'i gang zag su la 'bab pa ni 'ga' zhig dge 'dun gyis bskos te 'ong gi / gzhan la mi 'ong ngo zhes spyir bsgo ba'o //
analyzed: khyed cag la ston pa'i gang zag su la 'bab pa ni 'ga' zhig dge 'dun gyis bskos te 'ong gi / gzhan la mi 'ong ngo zhes spyir bsgo ba'o //
translated: The one who will be your teacher will be appointed by the Saṅgha.

original: khyed cag la dge slong 'ga' yang ston par mi spro'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyed cag la dge slong 'ga' yang ston par mi spro'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The other one said, No one will be your teacher.

original: nga yang dge 'dun gyis gsol ba dang las kyis bskos te 'ongs par zad kyi /
analyzed: nga yang dge 'dun gyis gsol ba dang las kyis bskos te 'ongs par zad kyi /
translated: The first one said, I was appointed by the Saṅgha through a request and a ritual.

original: rang dgar 'ongs pa ni ma yin pas gzhan su yang khyed cag la ston par sgro ba med do zhes spa bkod pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: rang dgar 'ongs pa ni ma yin pas gzhan su yang khyed cag la ston par sgro ba med do zhes spa bkod pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: I did not come here on my own, so no one else will be your teacher.

original: khyed cag gis gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa ni dge 'dun las so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyed cag gis gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa ni dge 'dun las so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The second one said, You should receive instructions and teachings from the Saṅgha.

original: kye sring mo dag khyed cag gis zla ba phyed phyed cing gso spyod bya ba dang / dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa'i rjes la dgag dbye bya ba la sogs pa'i gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa ni dge slong gi dge 'dun las 'thob po zhes dmigs kyis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: kye sring mo dag khyed cag gis zla ba phyed phyed cing gso spyod bya ba dang / dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa'i rjes la dgag dbye bya ba la sogs pa'i gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa ni dge slong gi dge 'dun las 'thob po zhes dmigs kyis bstan pa'o //
translated: O sisters, you should receive the instructions and teachings from the community of monks, such as the fortnightly confession, the rainy season retreat, the lifting of the restrictions, and so on.

original: sring mo dag gis bag yod par sgrubs shig ces bya ba ni /🔽sring mo dag gis bslab pa'i gzhi yang dag par blangs pa dag bag yod par sgrubs shig /'di ni dge 'dun gyis khyed cag la gdams shing rjes su bstan pa yin no zhes ston pa snying brtse ba can gyis /
analyzed: sring mo dag gis bag yod par sgrubs shig ces bya ba ni / sring mo dag gis bslab pa'i gzhi yang dag par blangs pa dag bag yod par sgrubs shig /'di ni dge 'dun gyis khyed cag la gdams shing rjes su bstan pa yin no zhes ston pa snying brtse ba can gyis /
translated: O sisters, practice heedfully.🔽 This is the instruction and teaching of the community to you.🔽 The compassionate one, the teacher, says this:🔽These are the words of instruction and teaching to the community of nuns out of compassion.

original: snying brtse ba'i phyir dge slong ma'i dge 'dun la gdams shing rjes su bstan pa'i tshig yin no zhes bya ba de ston @292b nus pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snying brtse ba'i phyir dge slong ma'i dge 'dun la gdams shing rjes su bstan pa'i tshig yin no zhes bya ba de ston @292b nus pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The meaning of I am able to teach is as follows:

original: ji skad sngar bstan pa'i rnam pa ston nus pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis dge slong ma'i ston par bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji skad sngar bstan pa'i rnam pa ston nus pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis dge slong ma'i ston par bsko bar bya'o //
translated: The community of monks who are able to teach the aspects as previously explained should appoint a monk as the teacher of the nuns.

original: 'di skad bstan te pham par 'gyur ba ma byung ba nyid la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te pham par 'gyur ba ma byung ba nyid la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: This is taught: One who has the qualities of not having committed any of the defeating offenses, and so on.

original: 'di ltar lci ba'i chos la sogs pa ston mi nus su zin kyang ji skad bstan ma thag pa de dag tsam yang ston nus pa yin na ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar lci ba'i chos la sogs pa ston mi nus su zin kyang ji skad bstan ma thag pa de dag tsam yang ston nus pa yin na ni /
translated: Even if one is not able to teach the weighty dharmas, and so on, if one is able to teach just those aspects that were just explained,

original: dge slong phyi ma 'di dge 'dun gyis dge slong ma'i ston par bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong phyi ma 'di dge 'dun gyis dge slong ma'i ston par bsko bar bya'o //
translated: then this latter monk should be appointed by the community as the teacher of the nuns.

original: chos bla ma'i mthu dang ldan pa ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni /🔽de chos kyang yin la /
analyzed: chos bla ma'i mthu dang ldan pa ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni / de chos kyang yin la /
translated: Except for one who has the power of the higher dharmas.

original: bla ma yang yin pas na chos bla ma'o //
analyzed: bla ma yang yin pas na chos bla ma'o //
translated: This is taught: It is a higher dharma because it is a dharma and it is higher.

original: de'i mthu ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i mthu ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o //
translated: Its power is the abandonment of the afflictions.

original: yang na chos bla ma zhes bya ba ni mi'i chos bla ma ste /
analyzed: yang na chos bla ma zhes bya ba ni mi'i chos bla ma ste /
translated: Or, the higher dharmas are the higher human dharmas.

original: nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: They are the state of being without afflictions, and so on.

original: de la gang yod pa de ni de'i mthu dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de la gang yod pa de ni de'i mthu dang ldan pa'o //
translated: That which exists is endowed with its power.

original: mthu de dang ldan pa'i dge slong ni ma gtogs te de ni dge 'dun gyis ma bskos par dge slong ma rnams la ston na yang nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mthu de dang ldan pa'i dge slong ni ma gtogs te de ni dge 'dun gyis ma bskos par dge slong ma rnams la ston na yang nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The exception is a monk who is endowed with that power. The meaning is that if he teaches the nuns without being appointed by the Saṅgha, he is not at fault.

original: 'dir gzhung ni so sor thar pa'i mdo las chos 'di lta bu dang ldan pa ma gtogs te zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni so sor thar pa'i mdo las chos 'di lta bu dang ldan pa ma gtogs te zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text of the Vinaya Sutra states, “Except for one endowed with such qualities.”

original: ci zhig rjes su bsgrubs na ma bskos par ston pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ci zhig rjes su bsgrubs na ma bskos par ston pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: If one asks, “What is the offense of teaching without being appointed?”

original: bskos pa de dag las gcig dang yang mi ldan pa dang ma bskos pa dge slong ma la ston na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bskos pa de dag las gcig dang yang mi ldan pa dang ma bskos pa dge slong ma la ston na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The text states, “If one does not possess even one of those appointed, or if one who is not appointed teaches the nuns.”

original: dge slong gang dge 'dun gyis bskos kyang yan lag ji skad smos pa de dag las gcig dang yang mi ldan pa dang / dge slong gang dge 'dun gyis ma bskos par yan lag ji skad smos pa de dag dang ldan yang rung mi ldan yang rung ba de dge slong ma las ston na ma bskos par ston pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong gang dge 'dun gyis bskos kyang yan lag ji skad smos pa de dag las gcig dang yang mi ldan pa dang / dge slong gang dge 'dun gyis ma bskos par yan lag ji skad smos pa de dag dang ldan yang rung mi ldan yang rung ba de dge slong ma las ston na ma bskos par ston pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If a monk, even though appointed by the community, does not have even one of the limbs as described, and if a monk, even though he has the limbs as described, is not appointed by the community, and if he teaches nuns, then there is an offense entailing suspension for teaching without being appointed.

original: sngar bskos pa ni ma bskos pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngar bskos pa ni ma bskos pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not the case that one who was appointed previously is not appointed.

original: dge slong gang dge 'dun gyis dag slong ma'i ston par sngar bskos pa ni ma bskos pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: dge slong gang dge 'dun gyis dag slong ma'i ston par sngar bskos pa ni ma bskos pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that a monk who was appointed previously by the community as a teacher of nuns is not appointed.

original: 'di ltar bskos pa nyid yin pas lan cig bskos pas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du dge slong ma la bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bskos pa nyid yin pas lan cig bskos pas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du dge slong ma la bstan par bya'o //
translated: Since he was appointed in this way, he should teach nuns for as long as he lives, even though he was appointed only once.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa re zhig lan cig dge slong ma'i ston par sngar bskos pa gang lags pa de ci dus gzhan gyi tshe yang bsko bar bgyi'am /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa re zhig lan cig dge slong ma'i ston par sngar bskos pa gang lags pa de ci dus gzhan gyi tshe yang bsko bar bgyi'am /
translated: “Venerable, is it the case that whoever is appointed as the teacher of nuns at one time is appointed at another time?

original: 'on te ma bskos par bstan par bgyi /🔽nye ba 'khor des bskos pa de nyid kyis bstan par bya'o @293a * //
analyzed: 'on te ma bskos par bstan par bgyi / nye ba 'khor des bskos pa de nyid kyis bstan par bya'o @293a * //
translated: Or is it the case that they are not appointed?”

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Upāli, it is the case that they are appointed.”🔽Here some texts say:

original: 'dir gzhung kha cig las kyang lan cig bskos pas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bstan par bya'i /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung kha cig las kyang lan cig bskos pas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du bstan par bya'i /
translated: “Whoever is appointed once teaches for as long as they live.

original: yang yang bsko bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yang yang bsko bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: They are not appointed again and again.”

original: chos bshad par gsol ba na yang rnam pa 'di yin pas gsungs te /
analyzed: chos bshad par gsol ba na yang rnam pa 'di yin pas gsungs te /
translated: When requesting the teaching of the Dharma, this is the procedure.🔽Here the text says:

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong ma gsol bar chos smra ba la ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba 'ga' mchis sam /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong ma gsol bar chos smra ba la ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba 'ga' mchis sam /
translated: “Is it the case that a bhikṣuṇī does not commit an infraction when she teaches the Dharma without being requested?”

original: yod de sngar gsol zin pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yod de sngar gsol zin pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Yes, if she has been previously requested.”

original: dge 'dun du ma langs shing 'os pa la gsol na nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge 'dun du ma langs shing 'os pa la gsol na nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There is no fault if she requests permission from the saṅgha or a suitable person.

original: gnas gang na dge 'dun du ma langs pa de na /
analyzed: gnas gang na dge 'dun du ma langs pa de na /
translated: In any place where many monks do not arise,

original: dge 'dun du ma langs shing de na dge slong gang dge slong ma'i ston par 'os pa pham par 'gyur ba ma byung ba la sogs pa'i yan lag dang ldan pa yod la //
analyzed: dge 'dun du ma langs shing de na dge slong gang dge slong ma'i ston par 'os pa pham par 'gyur ba ma byung ba la sogs pa'i yan lag dang ldan pa yod la //
translated: in that place, many monks do not arise. In that place, there is a monk who is suitable to be a teacher of nuns, who possesses the branches of not having committed a defeating offense, and so on.

original: de dge slong ma'i ston par ma bskos par de la dge slong ma rnams kyis gsol ba nyid na khyad par de lta bu dang ldan pa'i dge slong de dge slong ma rnams la ston pa na nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dge slong ma'i ston par ma bskos par de la dge slong ma rnams kyis gsol ba nyid na khyad par de lta bu dang ldan pa'i dge slong de dge slong ma rnams la ston pa na nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If he has not been appointed as a teacher of nuns, and if the nuns request him, then there is no offense for that monk who possesses such distinctions when he teaches the nuns.

original: de dag la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is the meaning of the text.🔽Also, there is no offense for those nuns

original: dge slong gang la dge slong ma rnams kyis gsol ba 'debs par byed pa'i dge slong ma gang dag yin pa de dag la yang ltung ba med pa'o //🔽'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las gang na dge slong gcig gam gang na gnyis sam /
analyzed: dge slong gang la dge slong ma rnams kyis gsol ba 'debs par byed pa'i dge slong ma gang dag yin pa de dag la yang ltung ba med pa'o // 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las gang na dge slong gcig gam gang na gnyis sam /
translated: who request that monk.🔽Here, the text of the Vinaya states:

original: gang na gsum gnas la /
analyzed: gang na gsum gnas la /
translated: In any place where one monk resides, or where two or three reside,

original: gal te ston pa'i 'os yin na nye bar song ba la gsol bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te ston pa'i 'os yin na nye bar song ba la gsol bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: If he is suitable to be a teacher, he should request it from one who has approached.

original: ston pa'i 'os su rung ba yin na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ston pa'i 'os su rung ba yin na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that if he is suitable to be a teacher.

original: ma bskos par ston pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: ma bskos par ston pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The downfall of teaching without being appointed has already been explained.

original: // / nyi ma nub kyi bar du ston pa'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: // / nyi ma nub kyi bar du ston pa'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /
translated: If one wishes to teach until the sun sets,

original: shes gtso'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: shes gtso'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: one should say, “I will teach.”

original: 'dir yang shes gtso zhes bya ba'i ming dang 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid do zhes bya bar ming can du sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: 'dir yang shes gtso zhes bya ba'i ming dang 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid do zhes bya bar ming can du sbyor bar byed do //
translated: Here, “I will teach” is applied to the name and the perception of the one who is the principal agent.

original: gang du 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang du 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: Where is one the principal agent?

original: nyi ma nub pa nyid la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: nyi ma nub pa nyid la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “Until the sun sets.”

original: nyi ma nub pa'i dngos po ni nyi ma nub pa nyid do //
analyzed: nyi ma nub pa'i dngos po ni nyi ma nub pa nyid do //
translated: The state of the sun setting is the sun setting.

original: de la der 'du shes na ste /
analyzed: de la der 'du shes na ste /
translated: If one perceives that,

original: gal te nyi ma yang nub par gyur la dge slong gis kyang nyi ma nub par shes na /
analyzed: gal te nyi ma yang nub par gyur la dge slong gis kyang nyi ma nub par shes na /
translated: If the sun has set and the monk knows that it has set,

original: de la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: de la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: then the perception is the primary factor.

original: ci zhig rjes su bsgrub na /
analyzed: ci zhig rjes su bsgrub na /
translated: What is it that is to be accomplished?

original: 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
translated: The perception is the primary factor.

original: de'i phyir mtshan thog thag tu chos ston pa ma gtogs par dge slong ma la ston na'o zhes bya bar smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan thog thag tu chos ston pa ma gtogs par dge slong ma la ston na'o zhes bya bar smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “except for teaching the Dharma all night, if a monk teaches a nun,”

original: dge @293b slong ma la ston na ste /
analyzed: dge @293b slong ma la ston na ste /
translated: if he teaches a nun,

original: mtshan thog thag tu chos ston pa ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: mtshan thog thag tu chos ston pa ni ma gtogs so //
translated: except for teaching the Dharma all night.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is how it is explained.

original: mtshan thog thag chos ston pa ma gtogs par nyi ma nub pa'i dus kyi tshe na dge slong gis dge slong ma rnams la ston par byed na ltung byed do //
analyzed: mtshan thog thag chos ston pa ma gtogs par nyi ma nub pa'i dus kyi tshe na dge slong gis dge slong ma rnams la ston par byed na ltung byed do //
translated: Except for teaching the Dharma all night, if a monk teaches nuns at the time of sunset, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: ci gnas thams cad du'am zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ci gnas thams cad du'am zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: Is it in all situations?

original: de'i tshe gal te sgo phye zhing de lta bu'i gtsug lag khang gi mdun na dbyar khang 'dug pa ni ma yin par ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i tshe gal te sgo phye zhing de lta bu'i gtsug lag khang gi mdun na dbyar khang 'dug pa ni ma yin par ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: At that time, if the door is open and there is no rainy season hut in front of such a temple,

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni ston pa'i dus kyi tshe'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni ston pa'i dus kyi tshe'o //
translated: “at that time” means at the time of teaching.

original: gal te sgo phye zhing zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te sgo phye zhing zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “If the door is open” means

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang ngo //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang ngo //
translated: the temple of the Saṅgha of monks.

original: de lta bu'i gtsug lag khang gi mdun na zhes bya ba ni ston pa'i dus kyi tshe sgo phye ba'i gtsug lag khang de'i mdun na'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i gtsug lag khang gi mdun na zhes bya ba ni ston pa'i dus kyi tshe sgo phye ba'i gtsug lag khang de'i mdun na'o //
translated: “In front of such a temple” means in front of that temple with the open door at the time of teaching.

original: dbyar khang 'dug pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dbyar khang 'dug pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Rainy season hut” means

original: gal te de'i mdun na dge slong ma'i dbyar khang 'dug na ni /
analyzed: gal te de'i mdun na dge slong ma'i dbyar khang 'dug na ni /
translated: if there is a rainy season hut for nuns in front of that temple,

original: de'i tshe myur du thags thogs med par rang gi gnas su 'jug tu yod pas der nyi ma nub kyi bar du ston kyang ltung bar mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de'i tshe myur du thags thogs med par rang gi gnas su 'jug tu yod pas der nyi ma nub kyi bar du ston kyang ltung bar mi 'gyur bas /
translated: at that time, one can quickly and without hesitation enter one’s own residence. Since one can stay there until sunset, there is no offense in staying there.

original: de'i phyir ma yin par ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma yin par ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, “no” is said.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i rnam pa de lta bu ma yin pa'i gnas su nyi ma nub kyi bar du ston na ltung byed do //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i rnam pa de lta bu ma yin pa'i gnas su nyi ma nub kyi bar du ston na ltung byed do //
translated: If he teaches in a place that is not of that kind described above, until the sun sets, he commits an offense.

original: 'di ni mtshon pa tsam du zad de myur du thags thogs med par rang gi gnas su phyin par rung ba'i gnas gzhan du yang nyi ma nub kyi bar du ston pa la ltung ba med la /
analyzed: 'di ni mtshon pa tsam du zad de myur du thags thogs med par rang gi gnas su phyin par rung ba'i gnas gzhan du yang nyi ma nub kyi bar du ston pa la ltung ba med la /
translated: This is merely an illustration. There is no offense if he teaches in another place that is suitable for him to go to quickly and without difficulty, until the sun sets.

original: de lta bu ma yin par nyi ma nub kyi bar ston na ltung byed do//🔽'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las dge slong gis gdugs bas pa'i dus kyi tshe'i bar du dge slong ma la ston par bgyid la /
analyzed: de lta bu ma yin par nyi ma nub kyi bar ston na ltung byed do// 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las dge slong gis gdugs bas pa'i dus kyi tshe'i bar du dge slong ma la ston par bgyid la /
translated: If he teaches in a place that is not suitable in this way, until the sun sets, he commits an offense.

original: ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba 'ga' mchis sam /🔽bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ltung bar yang mi 'gyur ba 'ga' mchis sam / bka' stsal pa /
translated: In this regard, some texts ask, “Is there any case where a monk teaches a nun until the time of the end of the day, and there is no offense?”

original: yod de dge slong ma rnams kyi dbyar khang du ston nam grong mtha'i gtsug lag khang ngam khang khyim dag tu ston na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: yod de dge slong ma rnams kyi dbyar khang du ston nam grong mtha'i gtsug lag khang ngam khang khyim dag tu ston na ltung ba med do //
translated: The answer is, “There is. There is no offense if he teaches in the nuns’ rainy season retreat house, or in a temple or house on the outskirts of a town.”

original: gang gi ni rab tu ston pa ni ma gtogs so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi ni rab tu ston pa ni ma gtogs so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Except for the one who is teaching.🔽The offense of a wrong action is explained as follows:

original: nyi ma nub kyi bar du ston pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /🔽// / zas chung zad tsam gyi phyir ston pa'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: nyi ma nub kyi bar du ston pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to / // / zas chung zad tsam gyi phyir ston pa'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /
translated: “Until sunset.”🔽If a nun, desiring to speak,

original: dge slong mas chos dri ba la mi 'jigs par bya ba'i phyir dge slong la zas dbul bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dge slong mas chos dri ba la mi 'jigs par bya ba'i phyir dge slong la zas dbul bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: should offer food to a monk in order to make him fearless in asking doctrinal questions of her,

original: dge slong mas dge slong la zas dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong mas dge slong la zas dbul bar bya'o //
translated: she should offer food to a monk.

original: ci zhig gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig gi phyir zhe na /
translated: For what purpose?

original: mi 'jigs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'jigs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to make him fearless.

original: yul gang la mi 'jigs par bya ba'i phyir zhe na /🔽chos dri ba la ste /
analyzed: yul gang la mi 'jigs par bya ba'i phyir zhe na / chos dri ba la ste /
translated: In regard to what object?🔽In asking doctrinal questions.

original: bdag gis chos zhu bar bya'o snyam pa la'o //🔽rgya cang dang shur bu dang lcag @294a * //
analyzed: bdag gis chos zhu bar bya'o snyam pa la'o // rgya cang dang shur bu dang lcag @294a * //
translated: In thinking, “I will ask about the Dharma.”

original: pod dang shur bu phre'u yang nga zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: pod dang shur bu phre'u yang nga zhes bya ba la /
translated: “A girdle, a shoulder-cloak, a rainsuit, and a waistband.”

original: rgya cang la sogs pa ni ska rags kyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: rgya cang la sogs pa ni ska rags kyi rnam pa ste /
translated: A girdle and so on are types of belts.

original: dge slong mas rgya cang la sogs pa yang sbyin par dge slong la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong mas rgya cang la sogs pa yang sbyin par dge slong la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: A nun should give a needle case, etc. to a monk.

original: dge slong gis de dag blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong gis de dag blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: A monk should accept them.

original: dge slong gis zas la sogs pa de dag dge slong ma dag las blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis zas la sogs pa de dag dge slong ma dag las blang bar bya'o //
translated: A monk should accept that food, etc. from the nuns.

original: ci zhig rjes su bsgrub na zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir ston pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir /🔽dge slong de ltar gyur pa ma yin pa la zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir dge slong ma la ston to zhes bya ba smras na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ci zhig rjes su bsgrub na zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir ston pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir / dge slong de ltar gyur pa ma yin pa la zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir dge slong ma la ston to zhes bya ba smras na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If a monk teaches a nun for the sake of a little food, what is the downfall?🔽The verse text says:🔽If a monk who is not like that teaches a nun for the sake of a little food.

original: dge slong ma la ston pa'i dge slong zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir ston pa ma yin pa la dge slong 'di zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir dge slong ma la ston to zhes de skad smra na zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir ston pa'i ltung byed du
analyzed: dge slong ma la ston pa'i dge slong zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir ston pa ma yin pa la dge slong 'di zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir dge slong ma la ston to zhes de skad smra na zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir ston pa'i ltung byed du
translated: If a monk who is not teaching a nun for the sake of a little food says, “This monk teaches a nun for the sake of a little food,” then for teaching for the sake of a little food, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: 'gyur ro // bden pa nyid la ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: 'gyur ro // bden pa nyid la ni ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if it is the truth.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir dge slong ma la ston pa bden na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no//
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir dge slong ma la ston pa bden na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no//
translated: Here the text says, “If a monk teaches a nun for the sake of a small amount of food, there is no offense.”

original: zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir ston pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: zas cung zad tsam gyi phyir ston pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The downfall through teaching for a small amount of food has been explained.

original: // / gos byed pa'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /🔽shes gtso'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: // / gos byed pa'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas / shes gtso'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The downfall through sewing is explained in the lines beginning, “If one wishes to sew,” and so on.

original: 'dir yang shes gtso zhes bya ba'i ming dang 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba'i ming can du sbyor bar byed do //🔽gang la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir yang shes gtso zhes bya ba'i ming dang 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba'i ming can du sbyor bar byed do // gang la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: Here, the term “chief in discernment” refers to the one who is chief in the discernment of the name and the form.

original: dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa nyid la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa nyid la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If one asks, “Who is chief in the discernment of the name and the form?” the text says, “A nun who is not a relative.”

original: gang gi gos bya ba'i dge slong ma de yang nye du ma yin pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: gang gi gos bya ba'i dge slong ma de yang nye du ma yin pa nyid yin la /
translated: The nun for whom the monk sews is not a relative.

original: gos byed pa'i dge slong gis kyang de nye du ma yin pa nyid du shes na de la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: gos byed pa'i dge slong gis kyang de nye du ma yin pa nyid du shes na de la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: Also, a monk who is making robes, if he knows that she is not a relative, he is the one who is the primary perceiver.

original: ci zhig rjes su bsgrub na 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ci zhig rjes su bsgrub na 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: What is the act that is the primary perceiver?

original: gos byed na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gos byed na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “if he makes robes.”

original: mthar thug na dngos gzhi'o //
analyzed: mthar thug na dngos gzhi'o //
translated: The actual basis is at the end.

original: mdun rol du ni sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: mdun rol du ni sbyor ba'o //
translated: The preparation is at the beginning.

original: gos byed pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: gos byed pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The offense of making robes has been explained.

original: // / gos sbyin pa'i ltung byed brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / gos sbyin pa'i ltung byed brjod par bya ste /
translated: The offense of giving robes should be mentioned.

original: shes gtso'o zhes bya ba dang / dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa nyid la'o zhes bya ba bslab pa'i gzhi snga ma las drangs te 'dir khas blangs te /🔽ci zhig rjes su bsgrub na 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: shes gtso'o zhes bya ba dang / dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa nyid la'o zhes bya ba bslab pa'i gzhi snga ma las drangs te 'dir khas blangs te / ci zhig rjes su bsgrub na 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: The primary perceiver is the same as in the previous training rule, and it is said here that it is in regard to a nun who is not a relative.

original: gos byin na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gos byin na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: What is the act that is the primary perceiver? Therefore it is said, “if he gives robes.”

original: dge slong gis dge slong ma la'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis dge slong ma la'o //
translated: It is a monk in regard to a nun.

original: ji lta bu zhig byin zhe na de'i phyir gos dbul ba ma yin pa la'o @294b zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig byin zhe na de'i phyir gos dbul ba ma yin pa la'o @294b zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: What is given? Therefore it says, “except for giving cloth to the community of nuns.”

original: dge slong gis dge slong ma'i dge 'dun la gos dbul ba ma gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: dge slong gis dge slong ma'i dge 'dun la gos dbul ba ma gtogs pa ste /
translated: Except for giving cloth to the community of nuns, a monk should not give to others, such as those with whom he is intimate.

original: ngo bshes par gyur pa la sogs pa gzhan la sbyin par gyur na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ngo bshes par gyur pa la sogs pa gzhan la sbyin par gyur na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the text.

original: ci dge 'dun la gos dbul ba ma gtogs pa gzhan thams cad la sbyin na ltung byed du 'gyur ram zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ci dge 'dun la gos dbul ba ma gtogs pa gzhan thams cad la sbyin na ltung byed du 'gyur ram zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: If it is asked, “Does a monk commit an offense of wrong conduct for giving to all others except for giving cloth to the community of nuns?”

original: gal te bor rlag byung ba dang / legs par smra ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa dang / brje ba'i phyir ma yin pa la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gal te bor rlag byung ba dang / legs par smra ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs par byed pa dang / brje ba'i phyir ma yin pa la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it says, “except for giving to those who have lost their cloth, to those who speak well, to those who are fully ordained, and to those who are exchanging.”

original: gal te dge slong ma bor rlag byung ba de la sbyin pa dang / legs par smra ba sbyin pa dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa byed pa'i tshe sbyin pa dang / brje ba'i phyir sbyin pa'i don bzhi po de dag la byin pa gang yin pa de la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gal te dge slong ma bor rlag byung ba de la sbyin pa dang / legs par smra ba sbyin pa dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa byed pa'i tshe sbyin pa dang / brje ba'i phyir sbyin pa'i don bzhi po de dag la byin pa gang yin pa de la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that there is no offense for giving to those four: giving to a nun who has been expelled, giving to one who has been defeated, giving to one who has been suspended, and giving to one who has been expelled for not recognizing an offense.

original: ma yin pa la'o zhes bya ba smos pa ni /
analyzed: ma yin pa la'o zhes bya ba smos pa ni /
translated: To one who is not a relative

original: bzhi po de dag ma yin pa gzhan la byin na ltung byed do //
analyzed: bzhi po de dag ma yin pa gzhan la byin na ltung byed do //
translated: means that if one gives to someone other than those four, there is an offense of wrongdoing.

original: gos byin pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /🔽// / dge slong ma dang lhan cig 'dron lam du 'jug pa'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /🔽lam rgyags bskur bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gos byin pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to / // / dge slong ma dang lhan cig 'dron lam du 'jug pa'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas / lam rgyags bskur bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The offense of giving cloth has already been explained.🔽The offense for traveling by appointment with a nun🔽means that if a monk travels by appointment with a nun, he should give her provisions.

original: dge slong dang 'dron lam du 'gro bas lam rgyags rin po che lnga'am /
analyzed: dge slong dang 'dron lam du 'gro bas lam rgyags rin po che lnga'am /
translated: A monk who is traveling should give provisions to a nun who is traveling.

original: rin po cher smos pa lnga'am /
analyzed: rin po cher smos pa lnga'am /
translated: The five precious substances or the five substances that are considered precious,

original: bza' ba lnga'am /
analyzed: bza' ba lnga'am /
translated: the five kinds of food,🔽and the five kinds of medicines.

original: bza' bar smos pa lnga las gang 'byor cing 'os par bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: bza' bar smos pa lnga las gang 'byor cing 'os par bskur bar bya'o //
translated: Of the five kinds of food mentioned, one should send whatever is available and appropriate.🔽By whom should it be sent?

original: su dag gis bskur bar bya zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: su dag gis bskur bar bya zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: rtse rgod dang rtse rgod ma dang dge tshul dang dge tshul ma dag gis so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rtse rgod dang rtse rgod ma dang dge tshul dang dge tshul ma dag gis so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: By the young men, the young women, the novices, and the novice nuns.

original: de dag khyer du gzhug go //
analyzed: de dag khyer du gzhug go //
translated: They should be made to carry it.

original: dge slong dang dge slong ma rnams gcig gi lam rgyags gcig gis bskur du rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong dang dge slong ma rnams gcig gi lam rgyags gcig gis bskur du rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is suitable for the monks and nuns to send provisions for one another.

original: dge slong dang dge slong ma de dag gis lam rgyags rang rang gi 'khor med na gcig gis gcig gi bskur du rung ste rigs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: dge slong dang dge slong ma de dag gis lam rgyags rang rang gi 'khor med na gcig gis gcig gi bskur du rung ste rigs pa nyid yin no //
translated: If those monks and nuns do not have their own retinue, it is suitable for one to send for another. This is reasonable.

original: gcig gis gcig gi byin len yang ngo zhes bya ba ni dge slong dang dge slong ma rnams gcig gi byin len yang gcig gis byar rung ngo /
analyzed: gcig gis gcig gi byin len yang ngo zhes bya ba ni dge slong dang dge slong ma rnams gcig gi byin len yang gcig gis byar rung ngo /
translated: The giving and taking of the precepts is also for one another. It is suitable for the monks and nuns to give and take the precepts from one another.

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa na ba lam du dor bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa na ba lam du dor bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should not abandon a sick fellow practitioner on the road.

original: dge slong lam du 'gro ba dag gis tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa na ba lam du dor bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong lam du 'gro ba dag gis tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa na ba lam du dor bar mi bya'o //
translated: Monks traveling on the road should not abandon a fellow practitioner who is sick on the road.

original: de bskur bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bskur bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They should carry him.

original: nad pa de dge slong lam du 'gro ba dag gis bskur bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: nad pa de dge slong lam du 'gro ba dag gis bskur bar bya ba'o //
translated: Monks traveling on the road should carry the sick person.

original: dge slong ma la yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong ma la yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Nuns should do the same.

original: dge slong ma rnams kyis kyang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa na ba lam du dor bar @295a * //
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams kyis kyang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa na ba lam du dor bar @295a * //
translated: Nuns should not abandon a fellow practitioner who is sick on the road.

original: mi bya ba dang / de bskur bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi bya ba dang / de bskur bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They should carry him.

original: de la phan tshun grogs bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la phan tshun grogs bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: They should help each other.

original: nad pa bskur ba de la dge slong dang / dge slong ma rnams phan tshun gcig gi grogs gcig gis bya'o //
analyzed: nad pa bskur ba de la dge slong dang / dge slong ma rnams phan tshun gcig gi grogs gcig gis bya'o //
translated: Monks and nuns should help each other carry the sick person.

original: ji ltar grogs bya zhe na de'i phyir logs nas bzung bas so zhes bya ba smras te ;
analyzed: ji ltar grogs bya zhe na de'i phyir logs nas bzung bas so zhes bya ba smras te ;
translated: How should they help each other?

original: gal te dge slong na bar gyur na /
analyzed: gal te dge slong na bar gyur na /
translated: If a monk becomes sick,

original: dge slong mas mgo logs nas bzung bar bya zhing gal te dge slong ma na bar gyur na yang dge slong gis mgo logs nas bzung bar bya ste /🔽rkang pa logs nas ni rigs mthun pas gzung bar bya ba'o //🔽grong du phyin pa nyid na song yang nyes pa med do zhes bya ba dge slong dang dge slong ma de dag gis nad pa khrid de grong du phyin pa nyid na nad pa bzhag ste /
analyzed: dge slong mas mgo logs nas bzung bar bya zhing gal te dge slong ma na bar gyur na yang dge slong gis mgo logs nas bzung bar bya ste / rkang pa logs nas ni rigs mthun pas gzung bar bya ba'o // grong du phyin pa nyid na song yang nyes pa med do zhes bya ba dge slong dang dge slong ma de dag gis nad pa khrid de grong du phyin pa nyid na nad pa bzhag ste /
translated: But if the sick person is a monk, a monk should hold his head, and if the sick person is a nun, a nun should hold her head.🔽If they go to a village, there is no offense even if they go.

original: gzhan du 'gro na de'i tshe nyes pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gro na de'i tshe nyes pa med pa'o //
translated: If those monks and nuns take the sick person to a village and leave the sick person there, and then go elsewhere, there is no offense.

original: ci dus thams cad du 'gro ba la nyes pa med dam zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ci dus thams cad du 'gro ba la nyes pa med dam zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: Is there no offense at all times?

original: nad pa'i sman dang zas legs par sbyar te rang bzhin mthun pa'i nad g-yog gcig kyang bzhag nas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: nad pa'i sman dang zas legs par sbyar te rang bzhin mthun pa'i nad g-yog gcig kyang bzhag nas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: If they prepare good medicine and food for the sick person, and leave one attendant who is suitable for the sick person, there is no offense.

original: nad pa'i sman sbyar cing zan yang legs par bsgrubs nas rang bzhin mthun pa'i nad g-yog mtshan 'dra ba gcig kyang nye bar bzhag nas phyis de la 'gro bar bya'o //

analyzed: // / dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa za ba'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas de'i phyir shes gtso'o zhes bya ba smras te /
