original: 'dir yang shes gtso zhes bya ba'i ming dang / 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba'i ming can @297a * //
analyzed: 'dir yang shes gtso zhes bya ba'i ming dang / 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba'i ming can @297a * //
translated: The one who is the chief in understanding is the one who is the chief in perception.

original: du sbyor bar byed do //🔽de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni so sor thar pa'i mdo las yang dge slong gang shes bzhin du zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽de'i rnam par 'byed pa las kyang gal te dge slong gis gal te de shes la zos na zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: du sbyor bar byed do // de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni so sor thar pa'i mdo las yang dge slong gang shes bzhin du zhes gsungs pa yin no // de'i rnam par 'byed pa las kyang gal te dge slong gis gal te de shes la zos na zhes gsungs te /
translated: One should understand that the same is true of the other pārājikas.🔽Thus, the text of the Pratimokṣa Sūtra says, “If a bhikṣu, knowing that a bhikṣuṇī has prepared the food, eats it. . . . ”🔽The Vibhāṣā says, “If a bhikṣu eats knowing that a bhikṣuṇī has prepared the food. . . . ”

original: gal te dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa la dge slong mas sbyor du bcug par shes na zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa la dge slong mas sbyor du bcug par shes na zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Vibhāṣā says, “If a bhikṣu eats knowing that a bhikṣuṇī has prepared the food. . . . ”

original: gang la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
translated: What is the primary basis of the perception?

original: de'i phyir dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa nyid la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa nyid la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it says, “In the case of a bhikṣuṇī preparing the food, the primary basis is the perception of the bhikṣuṇī.”

original: sbyor du bcug pa'i dngos po ni sbyor du bcug pa'i dngos po nyid de /
analyzed: sbyor du bcug pa'i dngos po ni sbyor du bcug pa'i dngos po nyid de /
translated: The state of being prepared by a bhikṣuṇī is the state of being prepared by a bhikṣuṇī.

original: dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa nyid de la de ltar shes na yul de la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa nyid de la de ltar shes na yul de la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: In the case of a bhikṣuṇī preparing the food, the primary basis is the perception of the bhikṣuṇī.

original: 'dir sbyor du bcug pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dir sbyor du bcug pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, the term “prepared” means

original: byed du bcug pa ste /
analyzed: byed du bcug pa ste /
translated: and causing to do.

original: de yang gal te tshig gis bcol zhing ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyis sbyor du bcug pa yin na ste /
analyzed: de yang gal te tshig gis bcol zhing ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyis sbyor du bcug pa yin na ste /
translated: Moreover, if one requests with words and causes to do through verbal manifest karma,🔽but if one does not request with words, but causes to do through bodily manifest karma, then it is a heinous act.

original: spring yig la sogs pas ni nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spring yig la sogs pas ni nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here the text states: “If one eats food that one has requested through a letter and so on, then it is an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las spring yig dag dang lag yig dag dang lag rtsis dang mngags pa dang brgyud pa dang zur gyis bsod snyoms sbyor du bcug pa zos na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las spring yig dag dang lag yig dag dang lag rtsis dang mngags pa dang brgyud pa dang zur gyis bsod snyoms sbyor du bcug pa zos na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here the text states: “If one eats food that one has requested through a letter, a note, a sign, an envoy, a series, or a hint, then it is an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: ji ltar sbyor du bcug pa nyid la zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar sbyor du bcug pa nyid la zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: How is it that one causes to do?

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan dag gis so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan dag gis so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it says, “through false qualities.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa yin pa bden na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa yin pa bden na ltung ba med do //
translated: Here the text states: “If one says, ‘I am a stream enterer, a once returner, a nonreturner, or an arhat,’ then it is a downfall.”

original: mdo sde 'dzin pa dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa dag yin pa bden na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mdo sde 'dzin pa dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / ma mo 'dzin pa dag yin pa bden na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If it is true that they are holders of the sutras, holders of the Vinaya, and holders of the mātṛkā, then there is no offense.

original: gang la sbyor du bcug pa nyid la zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang la sbyor du bcug pa nyid la zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: If it is the one who is urged to apply himself, then why did he say:

original: mgron du ma bos pa la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: mgron du ma bos pa la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: To one who is not invited?

original: de ni mgron yang yin la ma bos pa yang yin pas mgron du ma bos pa ste de la'o //
analyzed: de ni mgron yang yin la ma bos pa yang yin pas mgron du ma bos pa ste de la'o //
translated: He is both a guest and not invited, so he is not invited.

original: bos pa yang lhag na'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bos pa yang lhag na'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If he is invited, there is an additional offense.

original: mgron du bos pa la yang lhag par sbyor du bcug pa nyid la'o //
analyzed: mgron du bos pa la yang lhag par sbyor du bcug pa nyid la'o //
translated: If he is invited, there is an additional offense for urging him to apply himself.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: gal te mgron du bos kyang lhag par sbyor du 'jug pa la'o //
analyzed: gal te mgron du bos kyang lhag par sbyor du 'jug pa la'o //
translated: If he is invited, there is an offense for urging him to apply himself.

original: 'dir gzhung ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Here is the text:

original: dge slong rab tu mang po dag khyim gzhan du mgron du bos par gyur pa na @297b der dge slong ma 'ongs te dris pa /
analyzed: dge slong rab tu mang po dag khyim gzhan du mgron du bos par gyur pa na @297b der dge slong ma 'ongs te dris pa /
translated: When many monks were invited to a house, a nun asked,

original: khyed cag gis dge slong gang dag mgron du bos /
analyzed: khyed cag gis dge slong gang dag mgron du bos /
translated: Which monks did you invite?

original: ming che ge mo dang che ge mo dag go //
analyzed: ming che ge mo dang che ge mo dag go //
translated: The names of so-and-so and so-and-so.

original: zan ji lta bu dag sbyin sum 'phel gyi zan dag go //
analyzed: zan ji lta bu dag sbyin sum 'phel gyi zan dag go //
translated: What kind of food? Food that is tripled.

original: mi rung ste dge slong de dag ni rgyun du zhugs pa yin pas de dag la rtsang phye dag sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mi rung ste dge slong de dag ni rgyun du zhugs pa yin pas de dag la rtsang phye dag sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: That is not proper. Those monks are stream-enterers. Give them food that is not tripled.

original: de lta bas na mgron du bos su zin kyang sbyin bdag gis ma bsams pa bzhin du 'jug pa gang yin pa de yang bza' bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na mgron du bos su zin kyang sbyin bdag gis ma bsams pa bzhin du 'jug pa gang yin pa de yang bza' bar mi bya ste /
translated: Therefore, even if invited, if the monks do not enter the house as intended by the donor, they should not eat.

original: zos na ltung byed do //
analyzed: zos na ltung byed do //
translated: If they eat, they commit an offense.

original: ci zhig sbyor du bcug pa nyid la zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ci zhig sbyor du bcug pa nyid la zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: If it is asked, “What is it that is to be eaten?,”

original: bza' bar bya ba'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bza' bar bya ba'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: it is said, “It is what is to be eaten.”

original: 'bras chan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras chan la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is rice and so on.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan dag gis so zhes smras na /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan dag gis so zhes smras na /
translated: If it is said, “With false qualities,”

original: yang dag pa'i yon tan ji lta bu dag gis she na de'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i yon tan ji lta bu dag gis she na de'i phyir /
translated: it is asked, “With what kind of true qualities?”

original: bsgrub pa phun sum tshogs pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bsgrub pa phun sum tshogs pas so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It is said, “With the perfection of practice.”

original: bsgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa rdzogs pa ni bsgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa ste des so //
analyzed: bsgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa rdzogs pa ni bsgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa ste des so //
translated: The perfection of practice is the perfection of practice.

original: bsgrub pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni tshul khrims nas brtsams te /🔽dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar dag bzung ngo //
analyzed: bsgrub pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni tshul khrims nas brtsams te / dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar dag bzung ngo //
translated: The word “practice” refers to morality up to arhatship.

original: de thos pas kyang rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de thos pas kyang rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is also permissible to hear it.

original: bsgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs su gyur pa'i thos pa gang yin pa des sbyor du bcug na yang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: bsgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa'i thabs su gyur pa'i thos pa gang yin pa des sbyor du bcug na yang nyes pa med do //
translated: If one is engaged in practice by means of hearing, which is the means for the perfection of practice, there is no fault.

original: bro gar dang / glu gling dang mkhas pa la sogs pa gzhan dag gis sbyor du bcug pa ni 'di'i rjes su 'brang bas nyes byas su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bro gar dang / glu gling dang mkhas pa la sogs pa gzhan dag gis sbyor du bcug pa ni 'di'i rjes su 'brang bas nyes byas su rig par bya'o //
translated: If one is engaged in practice by others, such as skilled actors, dancers, singers, and musicians, it should be understood as a fault due to following them.

original: bsod snyoms sbyor du bcug pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: bsod snyoms sbyor du bcug pa ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of engagement in alms:

original: tshul khrims kyis sbyor du bcug pa dang / thos pas sbyor du bcug pa ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis sbyor du bcug pa dang / thos pas sbyor du bcug pa ste /
translated: engagement in alms by morality and engagement in alms by hearing,

original: mdo snga ma gnyis dang go rims bzhin no ;
analyzed: mdo snga ma gnyis dang go rims bzhin no ;
translated: in the same order as the previous two sutras.

original: / ci zhig rjes su bsgrub na bza' bar bya ba byed pa po nyid yin zhe na de'i phyir zos na'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: / ci zhig rjes su bsgrub na bza' bar bya ba byed pa po nyid yin zhe na de'i phyir zos na'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore, he says, “when it is eaten.”

original: zos pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zos pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the nature of what is eaten,

original: de ni mid na de'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de ni mid na de'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: he says, “when it is swallowed, it is that.”

original: zos pa de ni mid na dngos gzhir gyur pa'o zos pa de yin gyi khar bcug pa tsam kho nas ni ma yin no ;🔽/ gzhan gyi don du na smad par bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zos pa de ni mid na dngos gzhir gyur pa'o zos pa de yin gyi khar bcug pa tsam kho nas ni ma yin no ; / gzhan gyi don du na smad par bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: When that which is eaten is swallowed, it becomes the actual basis. It is that which is eaten, not merely what is placed in the mouth.🔽It is blameworthy for the sake of others.

original: gzhan gyi don du sbyor du bcug pa la ni na smad par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du sbyor du bcug pa la ni na smad par bya ba nyid do //
translated: It is blameworthy for the sake of others when it is prepared for the sake of others.

original: na smad par byed pa'i phyir na smad par bya ba ste /
analyzed: na smad par byed pa'i phyir na smad par bya ba ste /
translated: It is blameworthy because it is censured.

original: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni de nyid do //
translated: That is its nature.

original: 'di skad bstan te /🔽dge slong mas gzhan gyi don du sbyor du bcug pa dge @298a * //
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te / dge slong mas gzhan gyi don du sbyor du bcug pa dge @298a * //
translated: This is what is taught.🔽If a bhikṣuṇī prepares food for the sake of others,

original: slong gzhan gyis zos na nyes byas so //
analyzed: slong gzhan gyis zos na nyes byas so //
translated: and another bhikṣu eats it, it is a minor offense.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las gzhan gyi don du sbyor du bcug par shes bzhin du zos na nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las gzhan gyi don du sbyor du bcug par shes bzhin du zos na nyes byas so //
translated: Here, the text is: If one eats, knowing that one has been made to prepare it for the sake of others, it is a minor offense.

original: 'di dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa yin no zhes bya bar mi shes pa'i dge slong gis dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa de zos pa la ni ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa yin no zhes bya bar mi shes pa'i dge slong gis dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa de zos pa la ni ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If a monk does not know that a nun has made him prepare it, and eats it, thinking, “This was prepared by a nun,” there is no offense.

original: bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na byin cig ces zer ba yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na byin cig ces zer ba yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Also, if one says, “Give it,” when one is engaged in alms-round.

original: dge slong bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na dge slong ma 'di skad ces dge slong 'di la bsod snyoms byin cig ces zer ba dge slong gis blangs te zos na yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na dge slong ma 'di skad ces dge slong 'di la bsod snyoms byin cig ces zer ba dge slong gis blangs te zos na yang nyes byas so //
translated: If a monk says, “Give alms-food to this monk,” and a nun says, “Give it to this monk,” and the monk accepts it and eats it, it is a minor offense.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa re zhig dge slong bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na de na dge slong ma zhig khyim bdag la 'di skad ces /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa re zhig dge slong bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na de na dge slong ma zhig khyim bdag la 'di skad ces /
translated: Here, the text is: Venerable, if a monk is engaged in alms-round, and a nun says to a householder, “Give this to the monk,”

original: dge slong 'di la bsod snyoms byin cig ces mchi zhing dge slong des kyang de blangs te 'tshal na ltung ba cir 'gyur nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no ;
analyzed: dge slong 'di la bsod snyoms byin cig ces mchi zhing dge slong des kyang de blangs te 'tshal na ltung ba cir 'gyur nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no ;
translated: The monk should say, Give alms to this monk, and if the monk accepts and eats it, what is the offense? It is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: / dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
analyzed: / dge slong mas sbyor du bcug pa'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba de bshad zin to /
translated: The offense of eating more than once invited is explained.

original: // / yang yang za ba'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: // / yang yang za ba'i ltung byed smra bar 'dod nas /
translated: If one wishes to explain the offense of eating again,

original: khyim gzhan du yang zan la bos pa dang du blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: khyim gzhan du yang zan la bos pa dang du blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: one should say, One should accept and take up the invitation to eat in another's house.

original: dge slong gis khyim gzhan du yang zan la mgron du bos pa dang du blang zhing bdag gir bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis khyim gzhan du yang zan la mgron du bos pa dang du blang zhing bdag gir bya'o //
translated: A monk should accept and take up the invitation to eat in another's house.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gtsug lag khang 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi khyim gzhan du yang ngo zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gtsug lag khang 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi khyim gzhan du yang ngo zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: The word again shows that it is not only in the monastery, but also in another's house.

original: dus shes par bya ste 'jug par bya'i snga tshogs su mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dus shes par bya ste 'jug par bya'i snga tshogs su mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One should know the time and enter, but one should not do it beforehand.

original: gal te khyim bdag gzhan du mgron du bos pa dang du blangs par gyur na der zan la sogs pa'i dus shes par bya ste 'jug par bya'i /
analyzed: gal te khyim bdag gzhan du mgron du bos pa dang du blangs par gyur na der zan la sogs pa'i dus shes par bya ste 'jug par bya'i /
translated: If a householder invites him to another place, he should go there, knowing the time for eating, etc.

original: ha cang snga tshogs su 'gro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: ha cang snga tshogs su 'gro bar mi bya'o //
translated: But he should not go too early.

original: de'i phyir gand'i brdungs te rang rang gi 'khor de la blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir gand'i brdungs te rang rang gi 'khor de la blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, he should look at his own retinue after the signal of the gong.

original: khyim gzhan du mgron du bos pa de'i phyir dus la bab par gand'i brdungs te gnas brtan gnas brtan rnams kyis rang gi 'khor gang dang gang yin pa dag la blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyim gzhan du mgron du bos pa de'i phyir dus la bab par gand'i brdungs te gnas brtan gnas brtan rnams kyis rang gi 'khor gang dang gang yin pa dag la blta bar bya'o //
translated: For the sake of a householder who invites him to another place, he should look at his own retinue after the signal of the gong at the proper time.

original: glo bur du 'ongs pa la ni gnas brtan gyis so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: glo bur du 'ongs pa la ni gnas brtan gyis so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The elder should look at the newly arrived.

original: dge slong glo bur du 'ongs pa rnams la ni dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong glo bur du 'ongs pa rnams la ni dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis blta bar bya'o //
translated: The elder of the saṃgha should look at the newly arrived monks.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong 'khor dang spyod pa rnams kyis ni rang rang gi 'khor rnams la @298b bltas te 'dong bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong 'khor dang spyod pa rnams kyis ni rang rang gi 'khor rnams la @298b bltas te 'dong bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the text says that monks, with their retinue and conduct, should look at their own retinue and go.

original: dge slong gang la la glo bur du 'ongs pa de la ni dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong gang la la glo bur du 'ongs pa de la ni dge 'dun gyi gnas brtan gyis blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The elder of the saṅgha should look after any monk who has suddenly arrived.

original: gya tshom du zan gcad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽nad la sogs pa'i rgyu med par khro ba la sogs pas sam /
analyzed: gya tshom du zan gcad par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni / nad la sogs pa'i rgyu med par khro ba la sogs pas sam /
translated: One should not fast out of carelessness.

original: le lo la sogs pas gya tshom du rang gi zan gcad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: le lo la sogs pas gya tshom du rang gi zan gcad par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not fast out of carelessness, such as out of anger, or out of laziness, and so on, without a cause such as illness.

original: skom gyi phyir gsol ba dag 'debs na bsdad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skom gyi phyir gsol ba dag 'debs na bsdad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one is asked to stay for a drink, one should stay.

original: gal te yon bdag gsol ba 'debs te /
analyzed: gal te yon bdag gsol ba 'debs te /
translated: If a patron asks,

original: 'dir dge slong dag gis skom btung bar bya'o zhes gsol ba dag 'debs par byed na /
analyzed: 'dir dge slong dag gis skom btung bar bya'o zhes gsol ba dag 'debs par byed na /
translated: “Monks, please drink a beverage here,”

original: dge slong dag gis khyim gzhan der ci ran cig bsdad par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag gis khyim gzhan der ci ran cig bsdad par bya'o //
translated: monks should stay in that house for just what is necessary.

original: yang yang za ba'i ltung byed la byed pa po gang yin zhe na de'i phyir /🔽cig car yang rung /
analyzed: yang yang za ba'i ltung byed la byed pa po gang yin zhe na de'i phyir / cig car yang rung /
translated: What is the agent of the downfall of eating again and again?🔽It is the same as the agent of the downfall of eating stored food.

original: phyis kyang rung ste /
analyzed: phyis kyang rung ste /
translated: The downfall is accrued by eating again and again.

original: gos kyi rnyed pa med pa'i mgron du bos pas gnyis pa rnyed pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gos kyi rnyed pa med pa'i mgron du bos pas gnyis pa rnyed pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The second is the one who is invited without the acquisition of cloth.

original: nyi ma gcig la cig car yang rung phyis kyang rung ste /
analyzed: nyi ma gcig la cig car yang rung phyis kyang rung ste /
translated: Either simultaneously or later,

original: gos kyi rnyed pa med pa'i mgron du bos pa gnyis pa rnyed pa ni kha na ma tho ba 'di'i byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: gos kyi rnyed pa med pa'i mgron du bos pa gnyis pa rnyed pa ni kha na ma tho ba 'di'i byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: the second one who is invited without the acquisition of cloth is the actual perpetrator of this offense.

original: cig car dang du blangs pa la ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes 'og nas 'byung bas /
analyzed: cig car dang du blangs pa la ni nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes 'og nas 'byung bas /
translated: If one simultaneously accepts both invitations, it is an offense of wrong conduct, as will be explained below.

original: de'i phyir gang gi tshe mgron du bos pa gnyi ga dang du len par byed cing /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gi tshe mgron du bos pa gnyi ga dang du len par byed cing /
translated: Therefore, when one accepts both invitations,

original: bza' ba'i phyir snga phyi sems par mi byed pa de'i tshe ni gang gi bza' ba phyis 'grub par 'gyur ba de kho na las chos nyid kyi dbang gis nyes byas su 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bza' ba'i phyir snga phyi sems par mi byed pa de'i tshe ni gang gi bza' ba phyis 'grub par 'gyur ba de kho na las chos nyid kyi dbang gis nyes byas su 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
translated: if one does not consider which meal to attend first or later, then one should understand that it is an offense of wrong conduct by the power of reality dharmata, in regard to the one whose meal will be obtained later.

original: ji ste mgron du bos pa gcig la gos med pa nyid yin na de lta na ni gos med pa kho na las nyes byas su 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ste mgron du bos pa gcig la gos med pa nyid yin na de lta na ni gos med pa kho na las nyes byas su 'gyur te /
translated: If one of the invitations is without the acquisition of cloth, then it is an offense of wrong conduct only in regard to the one without cloth.

original: gos dang bcas pa dang / gos med pa dang / gos dang bcas shing gos kyi rin dang yang bcas pa dang / gos med cing gos kyi rin yang med pa zhes bya ba rnam pa bzhis ltung ba bstan pa mdzad do //
analyzed: gos dang bcas pa dang / gos med pa dang / gos dang bcas shing gos kyi rin dang yang bcas pa dang / gos med cing gos kyi rin yang med pa zhes bya ba rnam pa bzhis ltung ba bstan pa mdzad do //
translated: The four types of downfalls are taught by way of four types: with robes, without robes, with robes and the price of robes, and without robes and without the price of robes.

original: de la gos dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni gos dang bcas pa gzhan nas 'dir gos la bos pa ste /
analyzed: de la gos dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni gos dang bcas pa gzhan nas 'dir gos la bos pa ste /
translated: With robes means that with robes is mentioned here in place of with robes.

original: mgron du bos pa gnyi ga yang gos dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mgron du bos pa gnyi ga yang gos dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Both invitations are with robes.

original: gos med pa zhes bya ba ni gos dang bcas pa gzhan nas 'dir gos med pa la bos pa ste /
analyzed: gos med pa zhes bya ba ni gos dang bcas pa gzhan nas 'dir gos med pa la bos pa ste /
translated: Without robes means that without robes is mentioned here in place of with robes.

original: snga ma ni gos dang bcas pa yin la /
analyzed: snga ma ni gos dang bcas pa yin la /
translated: The former is with robes.

original: phyi ma ni gos med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽gos dang bcas shing gos kyi rin dang yang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni /🔽gos kyang yod cing gos kyi rin @299a * //
analyzed: phyi ma ni gos med pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // gos dang bcas shing gos kyi rin dang yang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni / gos kyang yod cing gos kyi rin @299a * //
translated: The latter is without robes.🔽With robes and the price of robes means

original: yang yod pa'o //
analyzed: yang yod pa'o //
translated: that robes exist and the price of robes exists.

original: gos med cing gos kyi rin yang med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gos med cing gos kyi rin yang med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase without clothes and without the price of clothes means

original: gos kyis kyang stong zhing gos kyi rin gyis kyang stong pa'o //
analyzed: gos kyis kyang stong zhing gos kyi rin gyis kyang stong pa'o //
translated: that he is empty of clothes and empty of the price of clothes.

original: de la gos kyi rin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la gos kyi rin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase the price of clothes

original: gos kyi zong yin par shes par bya'o //🔽ji zhig la mgron du bos pa rnyed na byed pa po nyid yin zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: gos kyi zong yin par shes par bya'o // ji zhig la mgron du bos pa rnyed na byed pa po nyid yin zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: means the value of clothes.

original: bza' bar bya ba la'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: bza' bar bya ba la'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: If one asks, What is it that one does when one finds an invitation to a meal? the text says,🔽One eats.

original: bza' bar bya ba ji lta bu la zhe na /
analyzed: bza' bar bya ba ji lta bu la zhe na /
translated: If one asks, What kind of food is eaten?

original: lnga'i khongs su gtogs pa la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: lnga'i khongs su gtogs pa la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: the text says, One of the five.

original: 'bras chan dang / zan dron dang / 'de gu dang / sha dang / snum khur zhes bya ba lnga po de dag gi khongs su gtogs pa la ste /
analyzed: 'bras chan dang / zan dron dang / 'de gu dang / sha dang / snum khur zhes bya ba lnga po de dag gi khongs su gtogs pa la ste /
translated: One of the five is rice, barley, wheat, meat, and beans.

original: lnga po de dag gi nang nas gang yang rung ba la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽mgron du bos pa snga ma las /
analyzed: lnga po de dag gi nang nas gang yang rung ba la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // mgron du bos pa snga ma las /
translated: The phrase one of the five means any one of the five.

original: cig shos rnam pa ji lta bu rnyed na byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: cig shos rnam pa ji lta bu rnyed na byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
translated: If one asks, What is the difference between the first invitation and the second?

original: de'i phyir / gal te gzhan yang de nyid yin na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / gal te gzhan yang de nyid yin na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “If another is also that very one.”

original: gal te mgron du bos pa gzhan cig shos kyang bza' bar bya ba de nyid kyi khongs su gtogs pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te mgron du bos pa gzhan cig shos kyang bza' bar bya ba de nyid kyi khongs su gtogs pa yin na /
translated: If another invited guest is included in the group that is to eat,

original: de'i tshe de rnyed na byed pa po nyid yin la /
analyzed: de'i tshe de rnyed na byed pa po nyid yin la /
translated: then at that time, if he obtains it, the agent is at fault.

original: gal te de nyid ma yin na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: gal te de nyid ma yin na ltung ba med do //
translated: But if he is not that very one, there is no offense.🔽Here, the text of the question is:

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa re zhig dge slong sngar bza' ba ma lags pa la g-yar drangs nas de slad kyis bza' ba la g-yar drangs te /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa re zhig dge slong sngar bza' ba ma lags pa la g-yar drangs nas de slad kyis bza' ba la g-yar drangs te /
translated: “Venerable! First, a monk is invited to eat what is not food. Later, he is invited to eat food.

original: des de 'tshal na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: des de 'tshal na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: If he eats that, what is the offense?”

original: nye ba 'khor ltung ba med do //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor ltung ba med do //
translated: “Upāli, there is no offense.”

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong bza' ba lnga po dag ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i bza' ba dag la sngar g-yar drangs nas de slad kyis bza' ba lnga po dag la g-yar drangs te des de 'tshal na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong bza' ba lnga po dag ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa'i bza' ba dag la sngar g-yar drangs nas de slad kyis bza' ba lnga po dag la g-yar drangs te des de 'tshal na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: “Venerable! First, a monk is invited to eat food other than the five foods. Later, he is invited to eat the five foods. If he eats that, what is the offense?”

original: nye ba 'khor ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: But Upali, it is not a downfall.

original: dge slong ji lta bu la de byed pa po nyid yin zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: dge slong ji lta bu la de byed pa po nyid yin zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: What kind of monk is the agent of that?

original: na ba ma yin pa dang las ma byas pa dang lam du ma song ba la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: na ba ma yin pa dang las ma byas pa dang lam du ma song ba la'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It is said, Not when sick, not when not doing the work, not when not on the road.

original: na ba ma yin pa ni mi na ba'o //
analyzed: na ba ma yin pa ni mi na ba'o //
translated: Not sick means not ill.

original: gang gis las ma byas pa de ni las ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis las ma byas pa de ni las ma byas pa'o //
translated: Not doing the work means not doing the work of the Saṅgha.

original: gang lam du ma song ba de ni lam du ma song ba ste /
analyzed: gang lam du ma song ba de ni lam du ma song ba ste /
translated: Not on the road means not on a road.

original: de dag la de byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: de dag la de byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: He is the agent of that.

original: de lta bas na na ba la sogs par gnas pa'i dus dag la ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na na ba la sogs par gnas pa'i dus dag la ni ltung ba med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no downfall when one is sick, etc., and when it is the proper time.

original: gnas ma yin pa'i dus dag la ni nyes byas te //
analyzed: gnas ma yin pa'i dus dag la ni nyes byas te //
translated: But there is an offense of wrong conduct when it is not the proper time.

original: gnas ma yin pa'i dus thams cad la ni nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas ma yin pa'i dus thams cad la ni nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, There is an offense of wrong conduct for all improper times.

original: de dag rnyed pa gang la gang gis byed pa po yin zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag rnyed pa gang la gang gis byed pa po yin zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: By what means is one the agent of what?

original: dang du blangs na nyes byas kyi'o zhes bya ba smras @299b te ;
analyzed: dang du blangs na nyes byas kyi'o zhes bya ba smras @299b te ;
translated: If one accepts it, it is a wrong doing.

original: khas blangs pa'i dus na nyes byas kyi byed pa po yin no //
analyzed: khas blangs pa'i dus na nyes byas kyi byed pa po yin no //
translated: At the time of accepting it, one is an agent of a wrong doing.

original: 'dir dang du blangs pa ni yid kyi yin pa'i phyir de ni bsdams par bya ba'i nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'dir dang du blangs pa ni yid kyi yin pa'i phyir de ni bsdams par bya ba'i nyes byas so //
translated: Here, since accepting it is mental, it is a wrong doing that is to be restrained.

original: khar za ba'i mdun rol du 'gro ba la sogs pas rjes su bsgrub pa ni bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: khar za ba'i mdun rol du 'gro ba la sogs pas rjes su bsgrub pa ni bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that subsequent practice by going in front of the one who is eating and so on is a wrong doing that is to be confessed.

original: zos na dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zos na dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one eats it, it is the actual basis.

original: mgul du mid zin pa'i dus na dngos gzhi'i byed pa po yin no //
analyzed: mgul du mid zin pa'i dus na dngos gzhi'i byed pa po yin no //
translated: At the time of swallowing it, one is an agent of the actual basis.

original: gos kyi rnyed pa zhes smos na gos kyi tshad ji tsam la zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: gos kyi rnyed pa zhes smos na gos kyi tshad ji tsam la zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: If one asks, “Since it is said ‘gain of cloth,’ what is the measure of cloth?”

original: 'dir gos kyi mthar gyur pa ni khru gang gi khyon no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'dir gos kyi mthar gyur pa ni khru gang gi khyon no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “Here, the limit of cloth is one cubit.”

original: gos la bos pa 'dir gos kyi tshad mthar gyur pa ni khru gang gi khyon yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gos la bos pa 'dir gos kyi tshad mthar gyur pa ni khru gang gi khyon yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the measure of cloth is to be understood as the limit of cloth, which is one cubit.

original: gal te gos khru gang gi khyon las chung ba'i gos dang bcas par bos pa de ni gos med pa nyid yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te gos khru gang gi khyon las chung ba'i gos dang bcas par bos pa de ni gos med pa nyid yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: If one invites while wearing a garment that is smaller than one cubit, it should be understood that one is not wearing a garment.

original: dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho ba nyid kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho ba nyid kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: One would only commit the actual basis offense.

original: gos sbyin par byed pa la sogs pa gzhan dag la ni khru gang gi khyon ni dngos gzhi'i byed pa po yin la de bas chung ba ni nyes byas byed pa po yin gyi /
analyzed: gos sbyin par byed pa la sogs pa gzhan dag la ni khru gang gi khyon ni dngos gzhi'i byed pa po yin la de bas chung ba ni nyes byas byed pa po yin gyi /
translated: For others, such as those who give garments, one cubit is the actual basis for the agent, and less than that is the basis for the secondary offense.

original: 'dir ni de bas chung bas dngos gzhi'i byed pa po yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni de bas chung bas dngos gzhi'i byed pa po yin no //
translated: Here, less than that is the basis for the actual basis.

original: sngar na ba ma yin pa dang las ma byas pa dang / lam du ma song ba la'o zhes smos na lam gyi tshad ji tsam zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: sngar na ba ma yin pa dang las ma byas pa dang / lam du ma song ba la'o zhes smos na lam gyi tshad ji tsam zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: If one says, “Previously, I was not sick, I did not do the work, I did not go on the road,” how far is the road? Therefore it is said:

original: lam ni dpag tshad phyed do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lam ni dpag tshad phyed do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The road is half a krośa.

original: 'dir lam gyi mthar gyur pa ni dpag tshad phyed do //
analyzed: 'dir lam gyi mthar gyur pa ni dpag tshad phyed do //
translated: Here, the end of the road is half a krośa.

original: gzhan la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Also for others.

original: yang yang za ba las gzhan pa 'dus shing za ba la sogs pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi dag la yang ste /
analyzed: yang yang za ba las gzhan pa 'dus shing za ba la sogs pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi dag la yang ste /
translated: and also in the other bases of training such as gathering and eating,🔽and also in those bases of training.

original: yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bslab pa'i gzhi de dag la yang lam gyi mthar gyur pa ni dpag tshad phyed do zhes 'dis 'dra bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bslab pa'i gzhi de dag la yang lam gyi mthar gyur pa ni dpag tshad phyed do zhes 'dis 'dra bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: The word also indicates that the limit of the path is half a krośa in the same way as this.

original: 'dir ram grur 'gro ba la yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dir ram grur 'gro ba la yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, or in a boat, also.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni skam la 'gro ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni skam la 'gro ba'i lam mo //
translated: Here means on a path on dry land.

original: grur 'gro zhes bya ba ni grur zhugs te 'gro ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: grur 'gro zhes bya ba ni grur zhugs te 'gro ba'i lam ste /
translated: In a boat means on a path in a boat.

original: de gnyis la yang mthar gyur pa'i tshad ni dpag tshad phyed yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis la yang mthar gyur pa'i tshad ni dpag tshad phyed yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the limit of both of those is half a krośa.

original: las kyi mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: las kyi mtshan nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the characteristic of work?🔽Therefore it is said:

original: de'i phyir / las kyi phyag dar re lde tsam mam dkyil 'khor ba mal tsam yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / las kyi phyag dar re lde tsam mam dkyil 'khor ba mal tsam yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The work is the size of a handspan or the size of a mat.

original: las kyi mthar gyur pa'i tshad ni gal te phyag dar re lde tsam byas pa 'am /
analyzed: las kyi mthar gyur pa'i tshad ni gal te phyag dar re lde tsam byas pa 'am /
translated: The limit of work is the size of a handspan if one does it oneself,🔽or the size of a mat if one has others do it.

original: gal te byug pa mal tsam bas pa de yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te byug pa mal tsam bas pa de yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: If it is only a little, it should be understood as a minor offense.

original: gzhan la yang ngo zhes bya ba 'dir yang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan la yang ngo zhes bya ba 'dir yang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: And also for others. This should be applied here also.

original: @300a * // des na 'dus shing za ba la sogs pa dag la yang las kyi mtshan nyid 'di yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: @300a * // des na 'dus shing za ba la sogs pa dag la yang las kyi mtshan nyid 'di yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, this characteristic of an offense should be understood also for eating in a group, etc.

original: de yang dge 'dun gyi nyid dam mchod rten gyi nyid yin na'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽phyag dar la sogs pa'i las bstan pa gang yin pa de yang gal te dge 'dun gyi nyid yin nam /
analyzed: de yang dge 'dun gyi nyid dam mchod rten gyi nyid yin na'o zhes bya ba ni / phyag dar la sogs pa'i las bstan pa gang yin pa de yang gal te dge 'dun gyi nyid yin nam /
translated: And that is for the Saṅgha or for a stūpa.

original: gal te mchod rten gyi nyid yin na de'i tshe las dus so zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te mchod rten gyi nyid yin na de'i tshe las dus so zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Whatever work is taught, such as sweeping, etc., if it is for the Saṅgha or for a stūpa, then it is work at the proper time.

original: na ba'i tshad gang zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: na ba'i tshad gang zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: What is the measure of being sick? Therefore it is said:

original: na ba nyid kyi tshad ni mi nus pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: na ba nyid kyi tshad ni mi nus pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The measure of being sick is the inability to do it.

original: na ba'i dngos po ni na ba nyid de de'i tshad ni mi nus pa nyid do //
analyzed: na ba'i dngos po ni na ba nyid de de'i tshad ni mi nus pa nyid do //
translated: The state of being sick is being sick. The measure of that is the inability to do it.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught:

original: ji ltar na mgron du bos pa gcig gang yin pas 'tsho bar mi nus pa de lta bu'i na ba nyid du gyur pa yin na /
analyzed: ji ltar na mgron du bos pa gcig gang yin pas 'tsho bar mi nus pa de lta bu'i na ba nyid du gyur pa yin na /
translated: Just as one who is invited to a meal cannot live on what is offered to a single guest, so too is one who is sick.

original: de'i tshe ji snyed pa khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe ji snyed pa khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: In that case, one should accept as much as is needed.

original: gzhan la yang ngo zhes bya ba 'dir yang sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan la yang ngo zhes bya ba 'dir yang sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The same should be applied to others.

original: des na de dag la yang 'di dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: des na de dag la yang 'di dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the same applies to them.

original: bshams pa ni mgron du bos pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bshams pa ni mgron du bos pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is prepared is not the same as what is invited.🔽What is prepared is not the same as what is invited.🔽What is prepared is not the same as what is invited.🔽What is prepared is not the same as what is invited.🔽What is prepared is not the same as what is invited.🔽What is prepared is not the same as what is invited.🔽What is prepared is not the same as what is invited.🔽What is prepared is not the same as what is invited.🔽What is prepared is not the same as what is invited.🔽What is prepared is not the same as what is invited.🔽What is prepared is not the same as what is invited.🔽What is prepared is not the same as what is invited.🔽What is prepared is not the same as what is invited.🔽What is prepared is not the same as what is invited.🔽What is prepared is not the same as what is invited.🔽What is prepared is not the same as what is invited.🔽What is prepared is not the same as what is invited.🔽What is prepared is not the same as what is invited.🔽What is prepared is not the same as what is invited.🔽What is prepared is not the same as what is invited.🔽What is prepared is not the same as what is invited.🔽What is prepared is not the same as what is invited.🔽What is prepared is not the same as what is invited.🔽What is prepared is not the same as what is invited.🔽What is prepared is not the same as what is invited.🔽What is prepared is not the same as what is invited.🔽What is prepared is not the same as what is invited.

original: nyin gcig mi chad par bshams pa'i zan nar ma zos pa gang yin pa de ni dus ston la sogs pa'i nyi ma dag la lan 'ga' gang du bos pa de'i mgron du bos pa gzhan ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyin gcig mi chad par bshams pa'i zan nar ma zos pa gang yin pa de ni dus ston la sogs pa'i nyi ma dag la lan 'ga' gang du bos pa de'i mgron du bos pa gzhan ma yin par rig par bya'o //

analyzed: de bzhin du sde pa lnga po thams cad la rnam par rtog par byed na yang ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Similarly, there is no offense if he thinks of any of the five sects.”

analyzed: de ni chos dang ldan pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: mu ge byung na mgron du bos pa ji snyed byung ba de snyed bdag gir bya'o //

analyzed: 'di skad bstan te //

translated: Thus, when that monk gives his own alms, which were prepared by the donor, to the five, if the donor is not pleased to give to the five,

translated: In this way, by means of this method, the donor is delighted, and then he should give to the five.

original: 'di skad bstan te /

translated: “without measuring.”

original: lhung bzed 'di snyed cig ba zhes shig ces tshad yongs su ma bcad par stobs par byed pa'i ste /
analyzed: lhung bzed 'di snyed cig ba zhes shig ces tshad yongs su ma bcad par stobs par byed pa'i ste /
translated: He gives without measuring, without specifying, “Give this much alms.”

original: gal te yongs su bcad de stobs na ni chos dang ldan pa'i dgos pa yod na lhung bzed brgya blangs kyang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gal te yongs su bcad de stobs na ni chos dang ldan pa'i dgos pa yod na lhung bzed brgya blangs kyang nyes pa med do //
translated: If he gives after measuring, then there is no fault if he takes a hundred alms bowls if there is a Dharma-related purpose.

original: ci khyim pa stobs pa'i bsod snyoms yongs su ma dpags pa thams cad byed pa po yin nam zhe @303b na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ci khyim pa stobs pa'i bsod snyoms yongs su ma dpags pa thams cad byed pa po yin nam zhe @303b na de'i phyir /
translated: Is the one who makes the alms always the householder who gives the alms without measuring? Therefore he says:

original: ci bder ma byas pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ci bder ma byas pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: “without making comfortable.”

original: gang gis ci bder ma byas pa de ni ci bder ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis ci bder ma byas pa de ni ci bder ma byas pa ste /
translated: One who does not do what is comfortable is one who does not do what is comfortable.

original: de byed pa po yin no //
analyzed: de byed pa po yin no //
translated: He is the agent.

original: ci bder byas pa ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: ci bder byas pa ni nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in doing what is comfortable.

original: ci rab tu byung ba stobs pa'i bsod snyoms kyang byed pa po yin nam zhe na de'i phyir //
analyzed: ci rab tu byung ba stobs pa'i bsod snyoms kyang byed pa po yin nam zhe na de'i phyir //
translated: Is one who gives alms to a renunciate also the agent?🔽Therefore it is said:

original: khyim pa'i'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: khyim pa'i'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The householder's.

original: khyim pa stobs pa'i bsod snyoms so //
analyzed: khyim pa stobs pa'i bsod snyoms so //
translated: The alms of a householder.

original: bsod snyoms ci tsam zhig byed pa po yin zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: bsod snyoms ci tsam zhig byed pa po yin zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: How much alms is the agent? Therefore it is said:

original: bre'u chung dag gi tshad ni 'bras thug po che ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung phyed dang lnga btsos pa tshod ma ma gtogs pa las lhag pa'i bsod snyoms te /
analyzed: bre'u chung dag gi tshad ni 'bras thug po che ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung phyed dang lnga btsos pa tshod ma ma gtogs pa las lhag pa'i bsod snyoms te /
translated: The measure of a small container is an alms of more than half a Magadha small container of cooked rice, excluding vegetables.

original: grogs kyi skal ba dang yang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: grogs kyi skal ba dang yang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It is also said to be together with a share of a companion.

original: 'bras thug po che skam yul ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung phyed dang lnga btsos pa'i chan tshod ma ma gtogs pa las lhag pa'i bsod snyoms ni byed pa po'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'bras thug po che skam yul ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung phyed dang lnga btsos pa'i chan tshod ma ma gtogs pa las lhag pa'i bsod snyoms ni byed pa po'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The term “excessive alms” is to be supplied in the above verse.

original: bsod snyoms lhag pa de'i bre'u chung gang gi tshad ji tsam zhe na /
analyzed: bsod snyoms lhag pa de'i bre'u chung gang gi tshad ji tsam zhe na /
translated: What is the measure of a “handful” of rice?

original: de'i phyir 'bras thug po che ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung phyed dang lnga btsos pa zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras thug po che ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung phyed dang lnga btsos pa zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: The text states: “five and a half Magadha-doṇas of dry rice.”

original: 'bras thug po che skam yul ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung phyed dang lnga btsos pa'i chan no //
analyzed: 'bras thug po che skam yul ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung phyed dang lnga btsos pa'i chan no //
translated: This refers to the amount of rice gruel that can be made from five and a half Magadha-doṇas of dry rice.

original: ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung gang la ni 'bras thug po che drus pa skam yul ma ga dha pa'i srad bcu drug ste /
analyzed: ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung gang la ni 'bras thug po che drus pa skam yul ma ga dha pa'i srad bcu drug ste /
translated: One Magadha-doṇa of dry rice is equal to sixteen Magadha-palas of dry rice.

original: yul ma ga dha ba'i srad gcig la bod kyi srad gnyis yod de /
analyzed: yul ma ga dha ba'i srad gcig la bod kyi srad gnyis yod de /
translated: One Magadha-pala is equal to two Tibetan-se.

original: 'bras skam bre'u chung gang la bod kyi srang ni sum cu rtsa gnyis yod /
analyzed: 'bras skam bre'u chung gang la bod kyi srang ni sum cu rtsa gnyis yod /
translated: One Magadha-doṇa of dry rice is equal to thirty-two Tibetan-se.

original: phul tshad du brtsis na ni bdun phul do dang khyor gang yod do //
analyzed: phul tshad du brtsis na ni bdun phul do dang khyor gang yod do //
translated: If one were to calculate the maximum amount, it would be seven measures and one kumbha.

original: tshod ma ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshod ma ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Except for vegetables.

original: der tshod ma brtsi bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: der tshod ma brtsi bar mi bya ste /
translated: Vegetables should not be excluded from the calculation.

original: dge slong ji snyed yod kyang rung ste /
analyzed: dge slong ji snyed yod kyang rung ste /
translated: No matter how many monks there are,

original: 'bras thug po che skam yul ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung phyed dang lnga btsos pa'i chan tshod ma ma gtogs pa de las lhag pa'i bsod snyoms len na thams cad du ltung byed do //
analyzed: 'bras thug po che skam yul ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung phyed dang lnga btsos pa'i chan tshod ma ma gtogs pa de las lhag pa'i bsod snyoms len na thams cad du ltung byed do //
translated: if a monk receives alms that exceed the amount of a half-measure of dry, non-glutinous grain of Magadha, excluding vegetables, it is a downfall in every instance.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong ji tsam du bre'u chung phyed dang lnga las lhag pa'i bsod snyoms len na thams cad du ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong ji tsam du bre'u chung phyed dang lnga las lhag pa'i bsod snyoms len na thams cad du ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The text states: “No matter how many monks there are, if a monk receives alms that exceed the amount of a half-measure of dry, non-glutinous grain of Magadha, it is a downfall in every instance.”

original: gal te dge slong de la grogs dag yod na grogs de dag re res kyang tshad de tsam re res blang bar bya'am zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te dge slong de la grogs dag yod na grogs de dag re res kyang tshad de tsam re res blang bar bya'am zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If a monk has companions, should each of them receive that amount? No, they should not.

original: de'i phyir grogs kyi skal pa dang yang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir grogs kyi skal pa dang yang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the portion of the companions is included in the portion of the monk.

original: grogs ji snyed yod kyang rung ste /
analyzed: grogs ji snyed yod kyang rung ste /
translated: Even if there are many friends,

original: de dag gi skal pa dang bcas par tshad de tsam zhig blang par bya'i /
analyzed: de dag gi skal pa dang bcas par tshad de tsam zhig blang par bya'i /
translated: one should take only that much that is their share.

original: de las lhag par mi blang ngo //🔽'dir gzhung ni so sor thar pa las 'dod na dge slong de dag gis lhung bzed @304a * //
analyzed: de las lhag par mi blang ngo // 'dir gzhung ni so sor thar pa las 'dod na dge slong de dag gis lhung bzed @304a * //
translated: One should not take more than that.🔽Here the scripture is the Pratimoksa, which states:

original: gang ba gnyis sam gsum blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang ba gnyis sam gsum blang bar bya'o //
translated: If one wishes, those bhikṣus may take two or three full alms bowls.

original: de las lhag par len na ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de las lhag par len na ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one takes more than that, there is an offense.

original: bsod snyoms tshad ji skad bstan pa las lhag pa de gang gi tshe byed pa po yin zhe na /
analyzed: bsod snyoms tshad ji skad bstan pa las lhag pa de gang gi tshe byed pa po yin zhe na /
translated: When does one become the agent of taking more than the prescribed amount of alms?

original: de'i phyir zos pa na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zos pa na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it says: “when one eats it.”

original: mgul du mid pa na'o ci zos so cog thams cad na 'am zhe na /
analyzed: mgul du mid pa na'o ci zos so cog thams cad na 'am zhe na /
translated: Does this apply to all food that is eaten?

original: de'i phyir mnos pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mnos pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it says: “when one accepts it.”

original: de nas mnos te gzhan du khyer ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de nas mnos te gzhan du khyer ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means: “after accepting it, one carries it elsewhere.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las de nyid du 'dug ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las de nyid du 'dug ste /
translated: Here the scripture is the Questions of Milinirvana Sutra, which states:🔽“One should eat in that very place.”

original: ji snyed zos kyang ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji snyed zos kyang ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: But there is no offense if one eats as much as one wishes.

original: de la ni nyes byas kyi'o zhes bya ba ni /🔽mnos pa de la bsod snyoms lhag par nod na sbyor ba'i tshe ni nyes byas kyi byed pa po yin no //
analyzed: de la ni nyes byas kyi'o zhes bya ba ni / mnos pa de la bsod snyoms lhag par nod na sbyor ba'i tshe ni nyes byas kyi byed pa po yin no //
translated: Here, there is an offense of wrong conduct🔽if one accepts more alms than one has promised to accept.

original: gzhan gyis mnos pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyis mnos pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: One is also an offender if one eats what another has accepted.

original: gzhan nod du bcug pa zos na yang nyes byas kyi byed pa po yin te /
analyzed: gzhan nod du bcug pa zos na yang nyes byas kyi byed pa po yin te /
translated: One is also an offender if one eats what another has accepted for one.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las 'dag gu dag dang / snum khur dag bstabs pa de la lhung bzed gnyis sam gsum las lhag par gzhan nod du bcug na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las 'dag gu dag dang / snum khur dag bstabs pa de la lhung bzed gnyis sam gsum las lhag par gzhan nod du bcug na nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text states: “If one accepts more than two or three alms-bowls, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: gzhan la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni zan mnos pa las gzhan pa ma mnos pa la ni ltung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni zan mnos pa las gzhan pa ma mnos pa la ni ltung ba med pa'o //
translated: There is no offense if one has not accepted alms.

original: 'dir gzhung ni de nyid du 'dug ste ji snyed zos kyang ltung ba med do zhes sngar bstan pa de nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni de nyid du 'dug ste ji snyed zos kyang ltung ba med do zhes sngar bstan pa de nyid yin no //
translated: Here, the text states: “There is no offense if one eats as much as one wishes.”

original: mdo 'di ni nyes byas su dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir byas so //
analyzed: mdo 'di ni nyes byas su dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir byas so //
translated: This sūtra was composed in order to dispel doubt about misdeeds.

original: las su ma byas pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: las su ma byas pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Also, it is not a misdeed if one does not do it.
